name: A Shielded Astral Glyph
notes:
It is the shielded form of An Astral Glyph.
Part of the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
location: Final boss room of the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: Abyssador
notes: Abyssador is the hardest of the Warzone bosses.
behaviour: Has a very erratic retargeting behavior. Goes invisible often.
strategy: Trap it in the western part of his dungeon.Mages should use Sudden Death Runes and summon Fire Elementals or Fire Devils to deal more damage.Paladins should use Infernal Bolts and Sharpshooter but have to be wary of the distance attacks.

name: Aftershock
notes: A boss in the Heart of Destruction Quest.
behaviour: After taking some damage he will transform into Foreshock and vice versa. Aftershock never retreats.
strategy: Unknown

name: Ahau
notes: Part of the Adventures of Galthen Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-456 and starting up to 4 hp/turn)
behaviour: Yells Hwaaarrrh!!!, Wraaahgh?!, or AAAAAH!! when being rebornAhau attacks in melee range. Ahau never retreats.

name: Alptramun
notes: It's one of the bosses of The Dream Courts Quest.
abilities: Lifesteal (300-700; 150%; hits all players near target and propagates as a chain)
behaviour: It retargets often, so the blocker should use Challenge very often. Alptramun never retreats.
strategy: Have the blocker stay at the center of the room, then throw some Fire Bomb Runes around this area to help cancel Alptramun's invisibility. All players should avoid staying in front of it since it uses a very strong death beam. Use area attacks during the fight and never allow the summons to stay alive for very long since they heal the boss. Mage's should not use Sudden Death Runes since they will heal the boss for a huge amount of health.

name: Amenef the Burning
notes: It's one of the minibosses of Kilmaresh Quest, Wanted mission.
location: Through a teleport inside the Ruins of Nuur, here.
behaviour: Amenef the Burning attacks in melee range. Amenef the Burning never retreats.

name: An Astral Glyph
notes:
It also exists as a shielded form, A Shielded Astral Glyph.
Part of the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
location: Final boss room of the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: An Observer Eye
notes: Part of the Opticording Sphere Quest. It can also appear as  when its cord is cut and after it's damaged for the first time. Note that you can only obtain the Lightsphere once, if you kill it again you will not receive a second one.
location: Replica Dungeon, past the Mysterious Device.
behaviour: It is immobile, so it won't move. It will attack when provoked. An Observer Eye never retreats.
strategy: Do not get close to it and walk around it using Magic Wall Runes to protect yourself from its sight. After using the machine north of the room, attack it from distance and do not use summons since they may trigger the boss' beams and target the players. Druids can use earth damage due to Boss's heavy death resistance.

name: Ancient Spawn of Morgathla
notes:
It looks like an Ancient Scarab with different colours. This boss has no cooldown; you can fight it again immediately after killing it.
Part of the Dangerous Depths Quest.
location: Deep under the Gnome Deep Hub.
behaviour: It fights in close combat. Ancient Spawn Of Morgathla never retreats.
strategy: Be careful with the Burrowing Beetles and with the environment that will also cause you a lot of damage. Attack it while avoiding the Obsidian Pipes and the Sulphur Geysire around the rooms.

name: Angry King Chuck
notes: It's King Chuck, but angry that you messed with his cauldron. It's part of the final game of the Orcsoberfest event.
strategy: Make him walk into the Strong Orger Beers so that he drinks it can calms down.

name: Anmothra
notes: Its speech, sanguis meus et anima mea in gratiam illorum quas diligo, is Latin for my blood and soul for those that I love.All players who sufficiently damage it during the last minute of the fight will receive the Slayer of Anmothra achievement.
location: Plains of Havoc, north-west from Dark Cathedral and south of Outlaw Camp, inside a portal for levels 20-40 (here), during the Rise of Devovorga World Quest. Can be fought on Vengoth during Devovorga's Essence Mini World Change.
behaviour: It follows its target (sometimes re-targeting). Anmothra never retreats.
strategy: Treat it like a Dragon Lord. Easy for level 28 mages to kill using two demon skeletons, or team with one knight level 25 or higher as blocker and any shooter.

name: Annihilon
notes: Belonging to an unknown and possibly otherwise extinct breed of demons, Annihilon is pure power. It is said that Annihilon was responsible for the destruction of his own race. He is the last survivor of countless battles that mirrored the demonic version of the 'survival of the fittest' phrase. His massive, heavy body is just one huge mass of moving muscles. There is no place for finesse in his body full of sheer strength. What he lacks in skill, he easily makes up with raw power. This aeon-old creature has served many masters in his wretched life. It is assumed that he was already a follower of one of the Ruthless Seven when they started to form their cabal. He stayed stoical at their side during their rise to power. He was present at many of the greatest triumphs of his cruel masters. The Ruthless Seven often employed the rather simple-minded Annihilon for banal tasks as there is no known demon at their disposal that matches him in strength. As long as there is something to kill, Annihilon is absolutely loyal to his masters. This loyalty and his lack of ambition, apart from slaughter and killing, makes him to one of the preferred servants of the Ruthless Seven. He is the perfect tool to keep lesser demons in line and does not mind to use his strength to fulfil some smaller tasks that might be at hand. This ancient creature is often accompanied by parasites that feed on his dripping spicy sweat. Detecting some of these small but extremely nasty parasites is a helpful sign to know about Annihilon's presence in advance. It's one of the bosses of The Inquisition Quest.
abilities: Paralyze Ice Ball (reduces speed by 785 points) Annihilon
Rarely Debuffs (Reduces Distance by 50-75% for 13 secs seconds) Annihilon
location: Through the teleport in the Soul Wells in the Inquisition quest. He is the sixth boss.
behaviour: Will follow you and attack with his very strong Melee, tries to run away on black Health. It walks very slow, but retargets often, so you may have some trouble in trapping him.
strategy: an example how to trap Annihilon

name: Anomaly
notes: A boss in the Heart of Destruction Quest.
behaviour: He will transform into Charged Anomaly after taking some damage. This will occur a few times. An anomaly never retreats.
strategy: Unknown

name: Apprentice Sheng
notes: It spawns with 4 Minotaurs so you may fight up to 2 Hyaenas, 9 Minotaurs, and 2 Wolves in the final room along with Apprentice Sheng.
behaviour: Apprentice Sheng attacks from a distance. Apprentice Sheng will retreat at 4  (4.21%, red) health.
strategy: Strategy for a team of players: Get 3 players to block it into a corner and heal with small health potions, while attacking it on defensive fighting with melee. Get 1 more person with a high distance skill to shoot arrows or throw spears on offensive fighting. To solo the boss a fast player can run to the small north room to lure the boss inside. After that place two boxes or honey flowers to keep the minotaurs out and only fight Apprentice Sheng and 2 hyaenas (10-20 small health potions is best to keep yourself from dying). Another way is using poison arrows to lower defense, and spears to kill the boss. Strategy for a single player: Stand in the oven room on the tile marked with white square on the screenshot, the Apprentice Sheng will keep the distance from you, but he will keep coming back to the tile marked with red square on the screenshot. Each time he comes back, you will hit him. At the same time you will only be attacked by a maximum of two other monsters, standing to your right. Apprentice Sheng will push one of the monsters away each time he walks onto the tile marked red.

name: Arachir the Ancient One
notes: Vampire lord from Drefia. Spawns with up to 4 Vampires.
behaviour: Turns Invisible really often and runs away in low health.
strategy: This boss often causes death for unprepared players, even high levels, so if you are planning to hunt in Vampire Crypts, always be all ready in case this boss appears. Arachir often hits with paralyze + drunkeness combo, so you should always keep a Dwarven Ring ready in case you need to escape or you try to outrun it. The best way to kill it is a simple formation of 2 Druids healing the blocker and shooters killing fast, with Fire Waves, Fireball runes and Divine Missiles. Mages: A possible strategy for mages would be to lure it to the rope hole while using Mana shield. Then use either Hell's Core (Sorcerers) or Eternal Winter (Druids) to kill this vampire lord and it's summoned Liches. Higher levels can successfully kill this boss alone with help of field runes like Energy Bombs or Energy Walls, to keep summones Liches or eventual Vampires from attacking you.

name: Arbaziloth
notes: Final boss of the No Rest for the Wicked Quest. Loot table varies depending on how the boss is killed, see the quest page for details.
behaviour: Arbaziloth attacks in melee range.

name: Armenius (Creature)
notes:
You get teleported out of Armenius room once you kill it, so you can't loot it. However, it doesn't drop any item.
When visiting Armenius bar you have a small chance of being challenged by him and teleported to his basement, if you do you get the achievement "His True Face".
behaviour: The same as a Vampire.
strategy: The same strategies used when facing Vampires since it behaves similary, but has stronger attacks.

name: Arthei
notes: Arthei was once a normal person and a citizen of Carlin. He, his wife Kala, and his brothers Marziel, Lersatio, and Boreth, travelled to Yalahar in order to find a new home. From that moment on Marziel started keeping a diary.This creature is the strongest of all vampire bosses and the fourth and last boss you will encounter during the Blood Brothers Quest.You will receive The Dust of Arthei when you use a Blessed Wooden Stake on his dead body.
abilities: rarely Summons ( Shadow of Boreth , Shadow of Lersatio or Shadow of Marziel )
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Arthom the Hunter
notes: He's the boss of the Hunters and Poachers in the Hunter Camp, but also seems to be a researcher studying the culture of the Dworcs. While at first the man-eating Dworcs seemed rather passive towards them and everything was going as planned, things soon turned grim. After the young and inexperienced members of the group Jenkinson and Abrams first managed to be infected by a strange toxin, the Dworcs also suddenly turned on them. They ended up being gorily sacrificed and eaten before his eyes after dying a painful death from the poison. He wrote those experiences down in his notes, and from these it actually appears that he eventually died himself too. Here he is, however, very much alive.
abilities: Bleeding Berserk (up to 15hp/turn) Arthom the Hunter
Stone Ball (does nothing) Arthom the Hunter
behaviour: Runs when in low health. He fixes himself on his target and is unlikely to change.
strategy: He's somewhat stronger than a regular Hunter so you shouldn't really struggle.

name: Ascending Ferumbras
notes: It will transform into a Destabilized Ferumbras when killed. When standing stille it looks like: Part of the Ferumbras' Ascendant Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: Ashmunrah
notes: This pharaoh protects the chamber where you can merge all parts of Helmet of the Ancients. Has the ability to kill a level 120 knight with 1 strong combo. For a long time, he was considered the only Pharaoh who does not drop any Pharaoh Rares, until a Holy Scarab was looted. He will spawn even with players in the room; you can see some animations on the tile in the middle of the room when he is about to spawn. One of the Pharaohs of The Ancient Tombs Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-1001+ and starting up to 7 hp/turn)
behaviour: Malicious, will make all efforts to destroy intruders.
strategy: He uses melee attack, so use blockers to run around him and distance fighters to fire on him. He is guarded by a Behemoth and 4 Ghosts. Note that the 4 Plaguethrowers now shoot as the fences were removed with the summer 2007 update.

name: Atab
notes: No notes
behaviour: If you have the Challenger of the Iks title and are within his spawning area, every time he takes damage from you there's around a 10% chance he teleports you to his trap room located here. Note that fields also count for the teleport chance, so you can speed up the process and get reliably teleported without killing Atab by running him across Fire Bombs. After being teleported Atab will fully heal, enabling you to continue the fight. It's important to note that if multiple players with the Challenger of the Iks title are present within the spawn area, they will be teleported together to confront Atab in the trap room. If you wish to kill Atab but do not want to get teleported, you can position him in the north doorway and stand one square north of him while you kill him. When Atab yells, "FEEL THE WRATH OF PURE ENERGY!!!", be cautious, for his strongest attack follows.

name: Ayana the Crimson Curse
notes: This boss, just like Tamru the Black and Owin, only spawns during Full Moon. It has a random spawn time between 30 to 60 minutes.
abilities: Yellow Ball (250-930) Ayana the Crimson Curse
Life Drain Chain (350+) Ayana the Crimson Curse
Great Fire Wave (230-350) Ayana the Crimson Curse
Death Ball (300-350) Ayana the Crimson Curse
Giant Fire Ring (600-840) Ayana the Crimson Curse
behaviour: It will disappear if lured too far away from its spawn location.

name: Azerus
notes: He wears the Yalahari Set.
abilities: Summons (1-8? Rift Worms , 1-8? Rift Broods , 1-8? Rift Scythe , 1-5? War Golems )
behaviour: Will always try to get near you. Azerus will retreat at 1 to 1039 (0% - 4%, deep red) health.
strategy:
You will need 3 to 5 knights to block the summons, you can not hurt
Azerus much until the war golems spawn at this point all fire should be concentrated on Azerus to kill him fast. Final boss of the In Service of Yalahar Quest.

name: Bakragore
notes: It is the final boss of the Rotten Blood Quest. Upon defeating Bakragore for the first time, players have an increased chance to drop a Bag You Covet. This chance will keep on increasing further with every kill until they loot a bag from him. Then, the drop chance returns to its original value which is considerably lower than the increased first-kill chance. Each time they subsequently defeat him without receiving a bag, the chances increase again untill their next drop. Bakragore has four progenies, two pairs of twins which were split from him: Murcion & Ichgahal, and Chagorz & Vemiath.
strategy: Identically to how it works in the Soul War Quest, in order to fight Bakragore players need to have killed all its progeny and gathered the four taints beforehand. Additionally, failing the final battle will remove the last two taints and erase the progress of two random bosses. The erased progress of the two bosses, while random, should be the same for the whole team. Players have 25 minutes to finish this fight. The following information considers a team fighting the boss on the easiest mode possible. For harder modes, players must consider the effects of having the final taint and burdens. Bakragore fights together with four Elder Bloodjaws and combines some of the mechanics of its children, but with important changes. The boss can summon up to four  Mushrooms, and it leaves mould tracks on the ground where it walks. It also heals lightly when stepping on its own tracks. During the fight, players have a counter next to their names increasing by two per second to a maximum of 20. Each time a player moves, they "drop" these charges on the ground, leaving  Darkfields as tracks for three seconds and reducing the counter by one. Staying over the Darkfields causes 3,4% maximum health per second as Agony Damage, which is increased under maximum stacks to 20,5% maximum health per second. The boss can summon up to four  Pillars of Dark Energy, that can chain players for Death Damage. When taking damage from this chain spell, a different counter is applied to the characters hit by it. This counter is reduced at a rate of one per second and deals 1,500+ Death Damage with every tick. The maximum counter value is 10. Players should be extra careful when having these because getting hit by Bakragore's beam spell will trigger all charges at once, dealing a high Death Damage outburst. Every 90 seconds, Bakragore will drop a Rotten Charge at the center of the room that lasts for 15 seconds. If no Elder Bloodjaw steps on it: If an Elder Bloodjaw steps on it: The fight against Bakragore can be made harder and more rewarding if players sacrifice at least one of its minion's essence before starting. For each essence they sacrifice, an  Elder Bloodjaw will be replaced by an echo of the corresponding boss, but rewards will be applied for that fight. See Bakragore's Burden for all the details.

name: Bane Lord
notes: The Bane Lord is the boss of the Bane Bringers. It has a chance to spawn with Bane Bringers during the Bewitched event. First seen on the 2012 Bewitched.
location: Green Claw Swamp, on the Bewitched area.
behaviour: Same as the Bane Bringer.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Barbaria
notes: She is the Barbarian Brutetamer's boss.
location: Center of Krimhorn's Big Barbarian Camp around here
behaviour: Barbaria attacks in melee range. Barbaria never retreats.
strategy: It spawns near the center of the camp. Treat it like a bloodwalker.

name: Battlemaster Zunzu
notes: Battlemaster Zunzu is a raid monster since February 17th, 2010.
location: Zao (Muggy Plains, May Spawn somewhere between the following two coordinates here and here or here).
behaviour: Battlemaster Zunzu attacks in melee range. Battlemaster Zunzu never retreats.
strategy:
Mages: should be at least level 120 to solo these without Magic Shield. Be sure to keep exura gran or vita handy as they can deal massive damage. Use Energy Wave or Great Energy Beam as a Sorcerer, or Ice Wave as a Druid. You can also use Ice Strike and your favourite weapon, but considering their high amount of health, that is not recommended unless you're in a party.
Knights: should kill this using Berserk and Blood Rage if you're fighting them solo. In a party, rely on your shooters to help you.
Paladins: should run them, but be very careful not to attract more lizards while doing so or you will have a hard time. Use strong ammunition to drop them as fast as possible.

name: Bibby Bloodbath
notes: Only appears during the Warpath Mini World Change. You can face this boss once every 24 hours. After killing her you will get kicked out of her camp in 2 minutes and won't be able to reenter until there's no cooldown. Note that if you try to face Bibby again before the cooldown is over it will reset and you'll have to wait another 24 hours. Her name is most probably an allusion to Bibby Blocksberg, famous little witch from 80's children book and television series. When you kill her, you will earn the achievement Bibby's Bloodbath.
abilities: Scratch Wave [ energy wave 's size; 5 SQM long; 3 SQM wide; looks like yellow spark - same as Mutated Tiger ] (0-200)
location: North of the Jakundaf Desert located (here), north of Carlin (here) or east of the Femor Hills (here).
behaviour: Will fight in close combat while spamming her Yellow Spark Exori and going invisible from time to time.
strategy: Knights with medium skills can kill it easily, and so can Paladins. Sorcerers and Druids should use Magic Shield and Sudden Death Runes.

name: Big Boss Trolliver
behaviour: Acts the same as a normal Troll Champion.
strategy: Just kill it as it is not much harder than an average Troll Champion.

name: Black Knight
notes: The Black Knight is a deserted knight of the King's army. He lives deep in the swamps of Tibia and attacks every intruder of his sphere. Well-equipped, he is very strong in close combat and uses his spear for distance fighting. He is a member of the TBI who turned the other way. "Commander of the Royal Army, assumed dead in the collapse of his unfinished home."  Spawn cannot be blocked.
location: Only in Black Knight's Villa beneath the Green Claw Swamp (north-west of Venore, here). You need to be over level 50 to enter.
behaviour: The Black Knight fights with Melee and throws Spears when the enemy tries to escape. A Black Knight never retreats.
strategy:
For Druids and Sorcerers this is a very hard creature to hunt, forget your Icicle and your Stalagmite runes here, since he is immune to Earth and Ice Damage. Since he's resistant to all other elements, the best you can do is to use Explosions or Physical Strikes. A basic strategy consists of the Knight blocking the Black Knight and Challenges it whenever it retargets, while the Druid/Sorcerer uses the above. But the most efficient duo-strategy to kill it faster would be a Knight blocking while a Paladin uses Divine Missiles.
Not a good creature to do a fast hunt on since he takes quite some time to respawn (around 10 minutes with regards to the server state).
It is possible for a Paladin to solo this creature at level 50. It is reccomended that you take either Royal Spears or Enchanted Spears and a good shield, though you should kill the Bonelords first to avoid mana drain. If you can, also kill the Scorpions too. This will dramatically increase your chances of succeeding.

name: Black Vixen
notes:
It's a leader of the Werefoxes.
Part of the Grimvale Quest - The Curse Spreads
location: After an Earth Portal inside Cormaya's were-beasts cave, here.
behaviour: Black Vixen attacks from a distance.
strategy: Treat it like a stronger Werefox.

name: Bloodback
notes:
It's a leader of the Wereboars.
Part of the Grimvale Quest - The Curse Spreads
location: After an Earth Portal inside Edron's were-beasts cave, here.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Treat it like a stronger Wereboar. Mages and paladins can use Fire Wall Runes to avoid most of its damage.

name: Bloom of Doom
notes: All players who sufficiently damage a Bloom of Doom during the last minute of the fight will receive the Cocoon of Doom achievement.
behaviour: Does not move.
strategy: Keep at least 3 SQMs of distance, to avoid the Plant Bomb and melee attacks. All his other spells are more weak. A Bloom of Doom has a special melee attack (random in time) that consume thousands of HP (9600+).

name: Bolfrim (Creature)
notes:
Appeared during Tibia's 15th and 20th Anniversary  celebrations as well as on January 8, 2018 (unintended), in a raid at a random time once a day.
The following message will appear:
A bug has appeared in Stonehome. Testers, to the rescue!
Then, 20 minutes later he will spawns:
Beware! The testers, finally driven mad by bugs, have arrived at Stonehome!
abilities: great haste bomb (hastes everyone in it; including himself)
behaviour: Unknown.Bolfrim attacks in melee range.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Boogey
notes: It's the fourth floor boss. Use his body to get a random reward before you use the body of Evil Mastermind, otherwise you may not get any item.
abilities: Sudden Death Bomb Summon (1-2 Demon Skeletons )
behaviour: Boogey attacks in melee range. Boogey never retreats.
strategy: Kill it fast.

name: Boreth
notes: Boreth was once a normal person and a citizen of Carlin. He, his brothers Arthei, Marziel, and Lersatio, and Arthei's wife Kala, travelled to Yalahar in order to find a new home. From that moment on Marziel started keeping a diary.Boreth is a plant-crazy vampire. You can see it by the lots of plants that grow in his tower. He is the first boss you will encounter during the Blood Brothers Quest. You can summon him by thrice using a Firebug on the Twines in front of his throne. There are 2 Plaguethrowers in his room.You will receive The Dust of Boreth when you use a Blessed Wooden Stake on his dead body.
behaviour: Fights until death in close combat. He uses Invisibility very often. Summons 3-4 Vampires at once.
strategy: Knights: the best option is to Exori or Exori Gran as much as possible while keeping an eye on your health.  That way you kill all the summons as well so they don't do extra damage.

name: Bragrumol
notes: It's one of the bosses of Kilmaresh Quest.
abilities: Damage Reflection (reflects 95% of the Death Damage it takes)
behaviour: Bragrumol attacks in melee range. Bragrumol never retreats.
strategy: Do not use Death Damage against it since the boss will reflect it.

name: Brain Head
behaviour: Unknown. Brain Head never retreats.
strategy:
Do not use energy and fire, as these damage types will heal the boss.
Part of the Feaster of Souls Quest.

name: Bretzecutioner
notes: Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest. In order to access the boss room you will need The Ice Islands Quest completed until mission 9 ("Formorgar Mines 1").
behaviour: Chases you into its melee range while throwing boulders at you from a distance. Sometimes combos its attacks with its projectile.Bretzecutioner attacks in melee range. Bretzecutioner never retreats.
strategy: Try to keep your distance from it unless you are a knight. It is very fast after it uses haste, so using Fire Wall Runes might be useful. Handle it as a slightly stronger destroyer.

name: Brokul
notes: It's a Deathlings boss and part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Brokul attacks in melee range. Brokul will retreat at 2000  (4%, red) health.
strategy: Never stay in front of it, as it has 3 very strong beam spells. Shooters should also keep their distance to avoid the two bomb spells it uses.

name: Brother Chill
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: This boss is part of the final battle of the Secret Library Quest, check it for more context. After another minute killing the raid, the southwestern wing will be opened: THE SOUTH WESTERN WING HAS BEEN BREACHED! RUSH TO CRUSH THE INTRUDERS! Inside this wing you will face Brother Chill and Brother Freeze, as well as Biting Colds. The Brothers and the Biting Colds heal each other. Thus, in order to defeat them, you have to keep them away from each other. You can start with either Brother while the rest of the team keeps the other one and the Colds away from it. After killing Brother Chill and Brother Freeze, go back to the central chamber where a new raid will start (After the death of the frozen brothers the invasion of the central chamber continues!)

name: Brother Freeze
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: This boss is part of the final battle of the Secret Library Quest, check it for more context. After another minute killing the raid, the southwestern wing will be opened: THE SOUTH WESTERN WING HAS BEEN BREACHED! RUSH TO CRUSH THE INTRUDERS! Inside this wing you will face Brother Chill and Brother Freeze, as well as Biting Colds. The Brothers and the Biting Colds heal each other. Thus, in order to defeat them, you have to keep them away from each other. You can start with either Brother while the rest of the team keeps the other one and the Colds away from it. After killing Brother Chill and Brother Freeze, go back to the central chamber where a new raid will start (After the death of the frozen brothers the invasion of the central chamber continues!)

name: Bruise Payne
notes: Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest. It is also an allusion to Batman.
abilities: earth wave (poisons for up to 9 hp/turn)
location: A bat-shaped area above northern Zao. To access it, enter the Magic Forcefield located in Yalahar's Alchemist Quarter, here.
behaviour: Behaves much like a regular Mutated Bat. Bruise Payne will retreat at 64 to 479 (4% - 29.94%, red) health.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Bruton
behaviour: Bruton attacks in melee range.
strategy:
Paladins should use crossbow with powerful venom or scorch elemental imbuiment.
Druids and Sorcerers should use their terra wave and fire wave alongside Sudden death runes.

name: Brutus Bloodbeard
notes: Only appears on Pirate Raids in Liberty Bay or you have a chance to encounter him by finishing a killing task for Raymond Striker. You get a chance to kill him in the Killing in the Name of... Quest after killing 3000 pirates for Raymond Striker. The teleporter is located here. Brutus Bloodbeard
location: Liberty Bay, the lighthouse south west of the depot during pirate raid. Task Boss - here
behaviour: Brutus Bloodbeard attacks in melee range. Brutus Bloodbeard will retreat at 62 to 466 (3.99% - 29.97%, deep red to red) health.
strategy: Stand still or use a Dwarven Ring because the drunkness is similar to that of djinns. For sorcerers/druids, it is highly recommended to use one of Ultimate Spells in order to kill other pirates around, get the most experience and loot the hat. You can treat him as slightly stronger version of Pirate Corsair so it shouldn't be too hard for any vocation to kill it.

name: Bullwark
notes: He looks like a Moohtant. You can only face this boss if it was the most voted one in the Rathleton Quest. Talk to Flora here to enter its room.
behaviour: Bullwark never retreats.
strategy: Avoid its melee damage (unless you are a blocker). The boss can kept at distance using Fire Wall Runes, but be careful not to get trapped by its summons. Do not waste time trying to kill the summons since Bullwark will replace them immediately.

name: Burster
location: Otherworld (Dwarf Bridge). Shares a Varying Monster Spawn with an Instable Breach Brood, here. The respawn rate is 4 to 5 minutes, and is not affected by Rapid Respawn.
behaviour: Fights in close combat.
strategy: This boss can be very hard, it is not recommended below level 150.

name: Captain Jones
notes: New boss creature in Summer Update 2008. It's probably an allusion of Davy Jones, the captain of the Flying Dutchman in the Pirates of the Carribean movie.
behaviour: Captain Jones never retreats.

name: Cave Spider
notes: Part of the Hidden Threats Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-400+? and starting up to 16 hp/turn)
behaviour: It behaves like Mamma Longlegs (a Giant Spider).
strategy: Treat it like Mamma Longlegs (a Giant Spider).

name: Chagorz
notes: One of the bosses in the Rotten Blood Quest.
strategy: Chagorz is the twin of Vemiath, and both share similarities. A charge builds up on the players, and if it reaches a counter of 20, it will cause damage. If players move, they will drop the charge to the floor beneath them, creating a  Darkfield that lasts for three seconds. The darkfields deal 3% of a character's maximum HP as Agony Damage when stepped on, or once every second while standing on it. The boss will heal if it comes into contact with the players tracks. It fights together with two  Elder Bloodjaws, not considering modifiers from taints. The boss can summon multiple  Pillars of Dark Energy. These can chain players for Fire Damage. When taking damage from this chain spell, a different counter is applied to the characters hit by it. This counter is reduced at a rate of one per second and deals 1,200~ Fire Damage with every tick. The maximum counter value is 10. Players should be extra careful when having these because getting hit by Chagorz's beam spell will trigger all charges at once, dealing a high Fire Damage outburst. Every 90 seconds, Chagorz will drop a  Rotten Charge at the center of the room that lasts for 15 seconds. If no Elder Bloodjaw steps on it: If an Elder Bloodjaw steps on it:

name: Channeling Earl Osam
notes: It's Earl Osam while channeling his Magical Spheres to heal himself. It's one of the bosses of Grave Danger Quest.
behaviour: It doesn't move.
strategy: See Earl Osam.

name: Charged Anomaly
notes: Transformed form of Anomaly.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: It is immune to normal damage sources. Make it walk through the red vortices for three times, he will take 6000 hp damage each time. Do not take Charged Anomaly lightly, it can easily combo a level 350~ mage without magic shield.

name: Charging Outburst
notes: Transformed form of Outburst.
behaviour: If not killed within 10 seconds, deals over 3000 energy damage.
strategy: Knights/Paladins: Focus your strongest spells to deal as much physical damage as possible before it changes back to Outburst. Mages: It's recommended for all mages to bring some extra Explosion Runes to help kill Charging Outburst. Druids can also use Physical Strike which is similar in strength.

name: Chayenne (Creature)
notes: Tibia's 15th Anniversary! Chayenne! Huge team taking Chayenne down Before Chayenne appeared, two messages were broadcasted to the server:
abilities: Summons (1-2+? Baby Pet of Chayenne or Noble Pet of Chayenne or Undead Pet of Chayenne or Ghastly Pet of Chayenne )
behaviour: Attacks players. Chayenne never retreats.
strategy: Trap her behind one of her summons and kill her fast.

name: Chikhaton
notes: Its speech, victis, is Latin for vanquished.All players who sufficiently damage it during the last minute of the fight will receive the Slayer of Chikhaton achievement.
location: Edron, behind the portal here, during the Rise of Devovorga World Quest. Can be fought on Vengoth during Devovorga's Essence Mini World Change.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Chizzoron the Distorter
notes: He is a lizard boss which spawns with the 5th message of the Orcs raid on Zzaion. Before it spawns, five messages are broadcast in white text to all players on that game world:
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Chopper
notes:
One of the Hive Bosses.
Part of the War Against the Hive Quest
behaviour: Stays in close combat until the death.
strategy: Separate it from other monsters and simply kill it. It's not too strong alone.

name: Cocoon
notes: None.
location: Vengoth in the lair of Devovorga after having killed all the sub-bosses at the same time and damaged Devovorga enough.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: You can't hit him. Instead, you can kill the four Bloom of Doom, and he will become in a Vulnerable Cocoon.

name: Count Tofifti (Creature)
notes:
Appears during the Tibia's 15th Anniversary, in a raid at a random time once a day.
A message will appear:
"A mummy has appeared somewhere east of Grizzly Adams... start counting!"
"The countdown to your death has started somewhere east of Grizzly Adams. Do you dare meet Count Tofifti?"
behaviour: Attacks players, walks fast.
strategy: Get knights to surround him and kill him as fast as you can. Tibia's 15th Anniversary! 7 Count Tofifti! Fight against Count Tofifti

name: Count Vlarkorth
notes: It's one of the bosses of Grave Danger Quest.
location: Under the Cemetery north of Edron.
behaviour: Count Vlarkorth attacks in melee range. Count Vlarkorth never retreats.
strategy: Use Death Damage on the boss and Avalanches if you need to kill the summons. Make sure you keep the Soulless Minions away from the boss, otherwise it will heal too much and be very hard to kill. Twice during the fight, it will summon one Dark <vocation> for each player in the room. These must be killed and the respective vocation must use the corpse on Count Vlarkoth to make it vulnerable again. For example, a Druid must use the Good Remains of a Druid on the boss. Demon Skeletons can be summoned in the room to help trap the boss, since its only magical attack deals Fire Damage.

name: Countess Sorrow
notes: It's the Phantasm's boss.
location: Pits of Inferno - Bazir's Throneroom. here
behaviour: Summons fast and hit slowly and usually doesn't do comboes. But, Countess Sorrow can send you and your team directly to the Temple in a blink of an eye.
strategy: You can't hit this monster with Physical Damage. Mages must use Fire-Based Attacks and a Druid must heal the blocker always (Druids' elements are not necessary because Countess Sorrow is strong against Ice Damage and immune to Earth Damage).

name: Craban (Creature)
notes:
Appears during the Tibia's 15th Anniversary, in a raid at a random time once a day. Before Craban appears, two messages are broadcast in white text to all players:
"A harmless looking little crab has appeared in Stonehome. Don't trust it, citizens of Edron..."
"Craban is visiting Stonehome - beware of Sudden Death!" Tibia's 15th Anniversary! 4 Craban and Denson Larika fight! Fight with Craban at 0:18 / Fight with Denson Larika at 1:53
abilities: Blood bomb (summons Crabs and Blood Crabs )
behaviour: Attacks players.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Crultor
behaviour: Crultor attacks in melee range.

name: Cublarc the Plunderer
notes: Appears during raids on Zzaion and the steppe.
location: Spawns randomly here and during 3 different raids:
behaviour: It behaves in the same way as an Orc Marauder.Cublarc the Plunderer attacks from a distance.
strategy: Be careful when facing this creature because it spawns with many others. The strategy is the same as an Orc Marauder. Remember that they only appear during a raid so kill it fast, make sure you have enough supplies with you because the real problem are the Orc Marauders that appear with him. Try not to lure the other orcs or you may die quickly.

name: Custodian
notes: It's an Order of the Cobra boss, and part of the Grave Danger Quest. Its respawn time is directly related to the Cart Packed with Gold. The impact is confirmed via community tests, but the specifics are still unknown: it seems the cart reaching end of the tunnel or being destroyed is a prerequisite for the respawn timer of Custodian to start counting.
behaviour: Unknown

name: Damage Resonance
notes: Appears when Rupture is damaged a certain amount of hitpoint. It may spawn multiple times.
behaviour: It stays at a distance. Spawns with 4 Sparks of Destruction. When a Damage Resonance spawns, any damage dealt to Rupture will heal Rupture for 5000 hitpoints.
strategy: It is important for all members of the team to not use any utori spells on Rupture. Also recommend all member to stop attack right away when the Damage Resonance spawns. A clear indication of that is when Spark of Destruction spawn.

name: Darkfang
notes:
It's a leader of the Werewolves.
Part of the Grimvale Quest - The Curse Spreads
location: After a teleport inside Edron's were-beasts cave.
behaviour: Fights in close combat.
strategy: Treat it like a stronger Werewolf.

name: Deadeye Devious
notes: Responsible for raiding the Liberty Bay depot in some raids. You get a chance to kill him in the Killing in the Name of... Quest after killing 3000 pirates for Raymond Striker. The teleporter is located here.
location: Just outside the south exit of the Liberty Bay depot. Task Boss - here
behaviour: Deadeye Devious attacks from a distance. Deadeye Devious will retreat at 58 to 434 (4% - 29.93%, red) health.
strategy: GFB's are a must - the amount of pirates that swarm this area is phenomenal. So try and pick them off and weaken Deadeye at the same time. Try Magic Shield and running in and out of the depot - or up and down stairs.

name: Death Priest Shargon
notes: He is part of the Dark Trails Quest.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: It is extremely important to kill the Lesser Death Minions first, before they become stronger. Also, although one would expect items that provide protection from Death Damage such as Koshei's Ancient Amulet to be useful against Shargon, extra attention is recommended as such items will increase the holy damage taken from both the dazzled status and the holy wave. It is strongly recommended to not use Wild Growth or Magic Walls because if you do so, the boss will disappear and summon around 20-30 Death Reapers.

name: Deathbine
notes:
Carniphila's boss. Part of the Paw and Fur Society tasks of Grizzly Adams.
Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-100 and starting up to 5 hp/turn)
location: Tiquanda, going down this hole and entering this portal.
behaviour: It will try to get close by paralyzing you, in order to attack with its earth and melee attacks. Deathbine never retreats.
strategy: Just treat it like a somewhat stronger Carniphila.

name: Deathstrike
notes: He is an overgrown Stone Devourer.
behaviour: Heals and goes invisible very often. Deathstrike will retreat at 2000  (1%, deep red) health.
strategy: Trap him in a corner and have your team shower him with Sudden Death Runes.  Sorcerers should rotate energy beams & waves, along with sudden deaths. It is recommended to bring a team with 10 players at least. Good tip is for druid and sorcerer to do summon of fire elemental and fire devil for some more damage.

name: Deep Terror
notes: It is the first boss you will encounter during the Hero of Rathleton Quest. It will spawn when you kill the four Tentacles of the Deep Terror on the quest. Like the other bosses, you will not loot anything unless you have first slain Professor Maxxen. Thus you will not loot anything on the first kill.
location: His lair in the Underground Glooth Factory in Jaccus Maxxen's Dungeon
behaviour: Retargets to whoever deals the most damage.
strategy: Trap it with knights and wild growth runes so that it cannot reach the shooters. All shooters should use their strongest spells to bring it down as fast as possible since it heals a lot and you have only 10 minutes in the boss room.

name: Delany (Creature)
notes:
Appeared during Tibia's 15th and 20th Anniversary celebrations, in a raid at a random time once a day.
The following message will appear:
A War Golem has appeared south-west of Svargrond.
Then, 20 minutes later he will spawns:
Delany has been spotted to the south-west of Svargrond, brace yourselves!
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Demodras
notes:
It is the Dragons' boss. Looks the same as a Dragon Lord. Always spawns with two Dragon Lords, save for in the quest room. Demodras' corpse can be skinned for a chance of getting a Red Dragon Leather.
Video of a Level 120 Royal Paladin Killing Demodras for Task on Fidera Knight killing Demodras (special task) Tibiando Demodras - Dragon Claw - Warrior Outfit - Celesta
location: PoH Dragon Lair (here) on the way to the Ornamented Shield Quest, PoI Dragon Lair (here), Thais Dragon Lair (here) on the way to the Naginata Quest. The special task teleport is located inside the PoH Dragon Lair, here.
behaviour: Demodras will retreat at 300  (6.67%, red) health.
strategy: Mages: Get a good blocker, and use Sudden Death Runes or Icicle Runes if your level and magic level are high enough. Otherwise, bring a Paladin or other Mages for back-up. A Mage or Paladin may attempt the special task at level 100 with reasonable success. Paladins will probably not need Magic Shield. Knights: It is possible to solo this creature with good skills and high level using Fierce Berserk. It is advised to attempt the special task on at least level 130 when you can use Ultimate Healing Potions.

name: Denson Larika (Creature)
notes:
Appears during the Tibia's 15th Anniversary, in a raid at a random time once a day. Before Denson Larika appears, two messages are broadcast in white text to all players:
"Something's a-cooking in Klaus' tavern on Nargor. The pirates are feeling watched."
"Denson Larika has started an epic pirates vs. ninjas battle in Klaus' tavern on Nargor!" Tibia's 15th Anniversary! 4 Craban and Denson Larika fight! Fight with Craban at 0:18 / Fight with Denson Larika at 1:53
location: Around the pirate tavern, near Klaus.
behaviour: Attacks players.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Despor
notes: When killing this boss, you can kill Maliz, Vengar, Bruton, Greedok, Vilear, Crultor, or Despor in any order. However, only Dragon Pack will show in Bosstiary.
behaviour: Despor attacks in melee range.

name: Destabilized Ferumbras
notes: It will transform into a Ferumbras Mortal Shell when killed. When standing stille it looks like: Part of the Ferumbras' Ascendant Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: Devovorga (Invincible)
notes: Part of the Rise of Devovorga World Quest. Cannot be killed as she is immune to all elements. For the main creature see Devovorga.
behaviour: This is the invincible form of Devovorga, encountered before all mini-bosses of the Rise of Devovorga event are killed.
strategy: Don't go near her.

name: Devovorga
notes:
Part of the Rise of Devovorga World Quest. According to the featured article of August 26th 2010, "this will be a battle against the largest and most powerful monster Tibia has ever seen."Its sound "PEREAT MUNDUS!" is Latin for Let the world perish!
All players who sufficiently damage her during the last minute of the final fight will receive the Devovorga's Nemesis achievement.
behaviour: Retargets, fights until death.
strategy: Have a Knight with level 250 or higher to block it using many Stone Skin Amulets and Might Rings, as it have very powerful Melee. It can also be trapped with Magic Walls while the shooters stay behind the bridge.

name: Dharalion
notes: He is the boss of the Elves. Always spawns with at least 2 Elf Scouts and 1 Elf Arcanist. Looks the same as an Elf Arcanist.
abilities: Poison Strike (Reduces Distance by a lot)
location: Shadowthorn, the Time Ring Quest room.
behaviour: Dharalion fights until death.
strategy: Just treat him like a strong Elf Arcanist. It's recommended to use  a Stealth Ring or the spell Invisible when fighting him, so his summons cannot see you.

name: Diblis the Fair
notes: No notes
behaviour: Run when is on yellow health.
strategy:
Mages should have a blocker while using Energy Damage/Fire Damage based Spells and Magic Shield.
Paladins should also have a blocker and use Divine Missile to kill it fast.
Knights should have a shooter and use using either Berserk or Fierce Berserk when the banshees reach you. Use Inflict Wound on him right away because he will go invisible a lot and run with a lot of health left.

name: Dipthrah
notes: Dipthrah was sentenced to be locked away, after his part in the conspiracies against the pharaoh, Arkhotep. He is the pharaoh of divinity, and the only pharaoh immune to physical damage. One of the Pharaohs of The Ancient Tombs Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-260 and starting up to 4 hp/turn)
Debuff (Reduces Melee and Distance by 40-60% for 40 seconds) Dipthrah
behaviour: Malicious, will make all efforts to destroy intruders. He will walk diagonally through summons to reach his target.Dipthrah attacks in melee range. Dipthrah never retreats.
strategy:
In his room there are 9 Magicthrowers and 5 Bonelords. He has a standard non-blockable spawn, spawning on the west side of the room (right by the Coal Basin). Due to his physical immunity, mages are highly recommended. Paladins should use elemental arrows and knights enchanted weapons. His mana drain makes up a lot of his damage, so knights can quite easily block it. Bronze Amulets may be a good choice for mages and Garlic Necklaces for knights. Knights: enter the room first to distract the pillars. Be sure to challenge the pharaoh to protect the shooters. Dipthrah will drain your mana a lot and most of your attack spells will be blocked, so it may be a good idea to just block the pharaoh. It may help your shooters to shoot Fire Bombs for their safety.
Paladins: if there is a knight, stand behind him and shoot with elemental arrows. If there is no knight, you can substitute a blocker with some difficulties (you will need a healer - your mana will be depleted fast).
Mages: shoot from a distance with Flame Strike or Ice Strike. A mage (preferably druid for Mass Healing) can quite easily camp this pharaoh alone after the first clear by having a Demon Skeleton summon block for them. In this strategy, the knight will enter first and attract the pillars. After the first clear, the knight leaves the room and the DS are attacked (if they are closest to the pillars). The pharaoh cannot easily kill a DS because most of its damage is from Life Drain. Bomb runes will prevent the pharaoh from reaching the mage and Fireball or Icicle runes can be used to attack the pharaoh without moving the summons (if the summons move, the pharaoh is more likely to attack the mage). Setting up in the north-west corner of the room will also permit 2-3 Bonelords spawning.

name: Dirtbeard
notes: It's the second floor boss. Use his body to get a random reward before you use the body of Evil Mastermind, otherwise you may not get any item. Probably an allusion to Blackbeard.
behaviour: Dirtbeard attacks in melee range. Dirtbeard will retreat at 25 to 188 (3.97% - 29.84%, deep red to red) health.

name: Diseased Bill
notes: Is an infected human.
abilities: Melee (0-240+ and starting up to 3 hp/turn)
behaviour: Runs away in red health.
strategy: Shoot from the door or run around a hole. If you are a lower level mage, you can also summon a demon skeleton inside the room with Diseased Bill since it is immune to earth damage and life drain. You can aid it with runes when they move away from the door.

name: Diseased Dan
notes: He's an infected human, a plague carrier.
abilities: Melee (0-103+ and starting up to 3 hp/turn)
Poison Storm on you (poisons you up to 31 hp /turn)
behaviour: Like a Bog Raider.
strategy: Open the door and shoot, go out if you need to heal. Note that more than one player can enter the sealed door at the same time, so ask a friend for help if you need a blocker. Since the Summer Update 2012 the hp decreased from 2000 to 800 and the attacks became weaker.

name: Diseased Fred
notes: Is an infected human. He is the strongest of the diseased humans.
abilities: Melee (0-150+ and starting up to 4 hp/turn)
location: Alchemist Quarter, here. Since the Summer Update 2012 you can reach him easier by a ramp directly from +1, instead of having to walk past the pit with Bog Raiders.
behaviour: Like a Bog Raider, but he runs in low hp.
strategy: Same strategy you would use for a Bog Raider, run around and shoot him.

name: Doctor Marrow
notes: It is part of the final fight of The Cradle of Monsters Quest.
behaviour: Attacks in close range and doesn't retarget very often.
strategy: Destroy the Antennaes in the room, otherwise they will heal him. Shooters should stay far away from the boss to avoid it's strong AoE Earth Damage attack, and the blocker should stand on a field bomb of any element to avoid running away when Feared. After Doctor Marrow takes some damage, it will run away and leave you with The Monster.

name: Doctor Marrow
notes: It is part of the final fight of The Cradle of Monsters Quest.
behaviour: Attacks in close range and doesn't retarget very often.
strategy: Destroy the Antennaes in the room, otherwise they will heal him. Shooters should stay far away from the boss to avoid it's strong AoE Earth Damage attack, and the blocker should stand on a field bomb of any element to avoid running away when Feared. After Doctor Marrow takes some damage, it will run away and leave you with The Monster.

name: Doctor Perhaps
notes: It's the first floor boss. Use his body to get a random reward before you use the body of Evil Mastermind, otherwise you may not get any item. Doubtlessly an allusion to "Doctor No", the villain in James Bond's first movie.
behaviour: Fights to death in close range.Doctor Perhaps attacks in melee range.
strategy: Kill it fast.

name: Dracola
notes: It is the Undead Dragon boss. If he is spawned, there may be more liches than usual in the room.
behaviour: Behaves just like a regular Undead Dragon, except that it is much stronger. It also runs in low health.
strategy: Treat it like a regular Undead Dragon, just keep in mind it can do very high comboes. Have a Knight stand diagonal, a Druid to heal the Knight and as many Mages and Paladins shoot at Dracola.

name: Dragon Hoard
notes: An unreachable creature that shares health points with the seventh and last dragon boss you kill in the 20 Years a Cook Quest final bossfight. It is the creature that grants players their reward for the fight.

name: Dragonking Zyrtarch
notes: This is one of the bosses in the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
behaviour: It is immune to all damage, you have to kill its mortal form; the Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch.
strategy: Unknown

name: Dreadful Disruptor
notes: Dreadful Disruptor sighted and killed on Descubra.
location: Otherworld (Edron). Shares a Varying Monster Spawn with a Stabilizing Dread Intruder, here. The respawn rate is 4 to 5 minutes, and is not affected by Rapid Respawn.
behaviour: Fights in close combat.

name: Dreadmaw
notes: Dreadmaw is the Killer Caimans' boss.
location: Northen part of Muggy Plains, near the rice fields here and here.
behaviour: Similar to Killer Caimans.
strategy: Kill it like an ordinary Killer Caiman.

name: Drume
notes:
It's one of the Usurper leaders trying to take control of the Order of the Lion. 
Part of The Order of the Lion Quest.
abilities: Summons (1 Preceptor Lazare or Grand Commander Soeren or Grand Chaplain Gaunder )
location: Bounac in the fields to the south-east.
behaviour: Drume attacks in melee range. Drume never retreats.

name: Duke Krule
notes: It's one of the bosses of Grave Danger Quest.
behaviour: Attacks in close range.Duke Krule attacks in melee range.
strategy: This boss' summons can hit harder than the boss itself, so extra care should be taken with them. If you have two knights, one of them can take the boss and the other the summons. After some seconds, all players will have their appearance changed into either a Water Elemental or a Fire Elemental. Along with that, around each player a large magic spell of the corresponding element (water/fire) will appear every turn. If two players that have different appearances get near each other, they'll take around 2000 damage. In order to avoid this, the recommended strategy is to have the knight positioned at the center of the room with the boss and the other team members around him, at safe distance. The transformation resets every few seconds, which means that in case a shooter has a summon targeting him, this player can wait until his transformation matches the Knight's and bring him the summon. This must be done fast however to avoid a change in the appearance in the meantime.

name: Earl Osam
notes: It's one of the bosses of Grave Danger Quest.
behaviour: Earl Osam never retreats.
strategy: After some time attacking Earl Osam (Fire Damage is recommended) the boss will teleport to the center of the room and become invulnerable, and 4 Magical Spheres will appear on each side of the room and start moving towards Earl Osam. You must kill them as quickly as possible before they reach the boss, for each Sphere that reaches him, Earl Osam will heal for 80,000 hitpoints. If more than one Sphere reaches the boss, he will most likely heal to full health. The team must be ready to change targets from one Sphere to the next quickly to ensure at least 3 of them are killed in time.

name: Earth Overlord
notes: New creature in Summer Update 2008.
abilities: a kind of earth UE spell (poisons, starting from 25)
location: The Elemental Spheres Quest, Druid's part - Earth Sphere.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Keep a good distance, try to stand diagonal from it (even if you try to outrun it). Use mana shield for  your own safety and it is preferred to use sudden death runes as you want to kill as many as you possibly can in the given time.

name: Ekatrix
notes:
She is the witch responsible for tainting souls.
Part of The Tainted Souls Quest.
location: Tainted Caves in the Green Claw Swamp.
behaviour: Like a Witch, will try to stay away from her attacker.
strategy: Unknown

name: Elvira Hammerthrust
notes: Part of the Bank Robbery Mini World Change. Elvira is the thief that robs the Ab'Dendriel bank.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Treat her like a Dwarf Guard.

name: Energized Raging Mage
notes: Was introduced in the Summer Update 2011.
behaviour: Fights in close combat. Tries to escape when his health drops to red.
strategy: The Energized Raging Mage will continually spawn when they are killed as long as insufficient Yielothax have been killed. For this reason it is advised not to kill him and focus your efforts on the Yielothaxes. The achievement Mageslayer can be earned by killing him twice.

name: Energy Overlord
notes: New creature in Summer Update 2008.
location: The Elemental Spheres Quest, Knight's part - Energy Sphere.
behaviour: Faster than Energy Elementals, but slower than a Giant Spider. Fights to the death.
strategy:
Stay diagonal, it uses Great Energy Beam often.
It is highly recommended to have 3 knights killing in order to break its shield. 
For solo hunting it is recommended to be level 130+. Use Fierce Berserk as often as possible as there is a time limit of two minutes inorder to kill it. Remember that with its high resistance to physical attacks, even a skilled knight can only do 150 damage on average with Fierce Berserk. It's not likely that you can kill more than one within the two minute time frame (if you are sword-wielding 250-level knight and use Tagralt Blade, you can kill up to 3 Energy Overlords at one time). Keep in mind that it paralyzes often with its Wrath of Nature attack, so its wise to heal every turn so that you can stay diagonal and avoid the lethal energy beam. Since Summer Update 2009, it always drops Pure Energy.

name: Enraged Morshabaal
notes: It is a stronger version of Morshabaal and shares most of its properties with it, except that it takes less damage and can become Furious Morshabaal.
location: Morshabaal appears inside a teleporter that spawns at the stone circle in the northwest of Edron, here. Only characters of level 150 or higher can enter
strategy: See Morshabaal.

name: Enusat the Onyx Wing
notes: It's the miniboss faced at the end of Kilmaresh Quest - Aspiring Oracle.
location: In a tomb under Kilmaresh Central Steppe, here.
behaviour: Enusat the Onyx Wing attacks from a distance. Enusat the Onyx Wing never retreats.

name: Eradicator
notes: One of the bosses in the Heart of Destruction Quest.
behaviour: Transforms into a more vulnerable form after certain period of time (1 minute- 1.5 minutes) along with summoning 4 Spark of Destruction. A eradicator never retreats.
strategy: Just attack the boss using Death Damage as much as possible since its stronger to all other elements. During the fight it will constantly change forms and 4 Sparks of Destruction will spawn, requiring the team to retarget the boss and mind the summons. If the team decides to trap the boss on the northern part of the room, extra care should be taken when leaving because the Sparks will accumulate and may be very dangerous.

name: Esmeralda
notes: Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest. Esmeralda being killed on Secura.
abilities: Melee (0-170 and starting up to 5 hp/turn)
Poisoning Beam (poisons you starting at 5 hp /turn)
Poisoning Berserk (poisons you starting at 4 hp /turn)
location: Yalahar Sewers, entry teleport can be found here.
behaviour: Esmeralda fights until death in close-combat.
strategy: Just like a normal Mutated Rat, only stronger.

name: Essence of Malice
notes: Part of the Cults of Tibia Quest.
behaviour: Essence of Malice attacks in melee range. Essence of Malice never retreats.
strategy: The Essence of Malice does not hit very hard, just use Physical and elemental (except Death) damage on it.

name: Ethershreck
notes: Ghastly Dragon's boss. A very popular boss to hunt during Double Loot Events due to being one of the few sources of the Golden Can of Oil. Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
location: Northern Zao, Ghastly Dragon Lair. Its teleporter is located here.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy:
Paladins should put a Fire Wall on the floor and run the boss around it. You can expect it to die within 15-25 shots.
Mages should put on Magic Shield and use Explosions or Energy Strikes.
Knights should keep him diagonal to avoid unnecessary wave damage and use all of their attack spells to bring him down as fast as possible. Blood rage and Annihilation should be a good combo.

name: Evil Mastermind
notes: It's the sixth and last floor boss. Use it to get your reward.
behaviour: Keeps distance shooting at you with magical attacks and runs (slowly) when you approach.Evil Mastermind attacks from a distance.
strategy: Kill from close so he uses the melee more than his other distance attacks.

name: Faceless Bane
notes: Part of The Dream Courts Quest - Haunted House.
abilities: Summons a Ripper Spectre , a Gazer Spectre and a Burster Spectre at once
behaviour: Faceless Bane never retreats.
strategy: Avoid using Death Damage at all costs since it will reflect it back to you and Faceless Bane is strong to it. For the blocker it is recommended to use energy and death protection because in almost every turn it uses a combo of energy and death spells. Trap the boss inside the room and don't worry about its summons because they will be summoned and stacked on boss. Druids and sorcerers should use fire, ice, earth and energy spells.

name: Fahim the Wise
notes:
Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest. 
Note: The mission rewards are given before facing this boss, but he must be fought before you can re-take the task.
location: Magician Quarter (Yalahar) past the teleport on the top floor of the front left tower, which is located here.
behaviour: Fights until death.
strategy:
Sorcerers and Druids should enter and fire a few shots of SD before he has a chance to summon too many, because with its three summons and its own attacks, things can get out of hand quickly.  Recommended for levels 60+.
Paladins have a little room to run on the rooftop, so it's recommended to use a strong projectile and run circles.
Knights should charge the boss and slay it as quickly as possible using exori/exori grans, because again, the summons can make things difficult.

name: Fat Porker
notes: It's part of the Do not Feed the Porker game during the Orcsoberfest event.
behaviour: It doesn't move nor attacks. A fat porker never retreats.
strategy: Attack it with whichever method you prefer.

name: Fazzrah
notes: Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest. Before Updates/10.8, players needed to have completed the Wrath of the Emperor Quest up to mission 7 in order to be able to reach him. After this update, however, his teleporter is much easier reachable and only requires the completion of the first eight missions of The New Frontier Quest.
location: A boat in Razachai accessed via the Muggy Plains (teleporter here).
behaviour: Fazzrah attacks in melee range. Fazzrah never retreats.
strategy: Treat him like a stronger Lizard Zaogun.

name: Fernfang
notes: It's the Monks' Boss.
location: Isle of Mists. Fernfang and 2 to 4 War Wolves spawn on the second floor and 4 to 6 War Wolves spawn in the first floor.
behaviour: Fernfang fights until death. He tries to keep away from players with his high speed "similar to a level 70" spamming Exori San. He retargets to the nearest player or summon.
strategy: Since it can only be fought by druids, simply use area runes to kill all the war wolves that spawn with him, then SD him to death. The best strategy for low levels is go to the first floor, kill the War wolves down there, then jump up and down and use runes or making summonds to distract him, if you are higher leveled, corner him with the war wolves he summons and use Flame Strike and Underworld Rod.

name: Feroxa (Gloom Wolf)
behaviour: Chases her target. Feroxa never retreats.
strategy: Unknown

name: Feroxa (Killable Werewolf)
behaviour: She will transform into her gloom wolf form or her weak human form when she reaches 0 health. Feroxa never retreats.
strategy: Chase her and attack with all firepower.

name: Feroxa (Werewolf)
behaviour: Chases her target. She will transform into her killable werewolf form when she is at about half health. Feroxa never retreats.
strategy: She cannot be damaged by any attacks. You must guide her over the Silvered Traps. Drag Closed Silvered Traps to the ground and use them to open them, at which point the silvered trap will become immobile and that have been placed on the floor laid by players. When she walks over these traps she will be damaged for 1000 health. When she walks over 20 traps, she will transform into her killable werewolf form.

name: Feroxa
notes: Feroxa always spawns on the 13th of each month when the Grimvale Mini World Change is active.
location: Grimvale cave, behind the teleport, here.
behaviour: Feroxa stands at a distance shooting arrows and casting spells at her target. When she is wounded, she will transform into her werewolf form, and behave differently. Feroxa never retreats.
strategy: At her first human stage you need to fight her with normal attacks, both spell and physical. When you reduce her health to about half, she will transform into her werewolf form. In this phase she is immune to almost everything except for Silvered Traps and Life Drain damage. When Feroxa walks on these traps, she will be damaged for 1,000 health points and the traps will vanish. The traps can be stacked and she does not heal, so it's a matter of having enough traps to bring the boss to half health. As an alternative, sorcerers and druids can summon either Gozzlers or Ghouls to deal Life Drain damage, but this process takes a lot longer. At half health, she will change into her killable werewolf form. Now you must attack her with all your firepower. When she reaches 0 health she will either turn into her weak human form or her gloom wolf form, both of which are quite weak and must be taken down with sheer firepower. You will receive two sets of loot for the whole battle. Only the final form of Feroxa (Gloom Wolf) will grant you a kill count in the Bosstiary.

name: Ferumbras Essence
notes: Part of the Ferumbras' Ascendant Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: You must lure all the Ferumbras Essences in the voids which are created when the Rift Invaders are killed.

name: Ferumbras Mortal Shell
notes: Ferumbras Mortal Shell is the last stage of Ferumbras during the Ferumbras' Ascendant Quest.
behaviour: Does not retarget very often.
strategy: Lure it to the south-west corner of the room and them just keep attacking it. It's strong to most elements but takes considerable Physical Damage. See the quest spoiler for a detailed strategy.

name: Ferumbras Soul Splinter
notes:
The Ferumbras Soul Splinter will turn into a Ferumbras Essence when killed, you must lure all the Ferumbras Essences in the voids which are created when the Rift Invaders are killed.
Part of the Ferumbras' Ascendant Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: Ferumbras
notes: Ferumbras was removed from society and banished to his citadel by the mages at the Edron academy. He has a massive arsenal of spells to torture and heal. Ferumbras was an evil sorcerer who once instilled fear into the heart of Thaians many years ago. Summoning demons and warlocks, he attacked Thais twice during the span of his life. After his second attack, he was finally killed and most assumed him to be gone for good. But his wrath was brought down when he returned some time later and found his daughter, Fortinbrae, had been killed and her soul trapped by the brave knights who had slain her, in the Plains of Havoc temple. Ferumbras traveled there to recapture his daughter's soul, but he was defeated again and disappeared. There are many rumors about his current whereabouts. After he was slain, he produced several oddly-charged runes, including a Sudden Death rune with 0 charges and a Poison Bomb rune with over 30 charges. There are 2 Magic Pillars at his room, which can summon up to 3 Demons each. Ferumbras was first sighted on Eternia on August 21th 2006, but a bug prevented players from reaching him. He appeared there again after two weeks when the bug had been fixed. He was first killed on Antica on October 13th 2006. Before he appears, three messages are broadcast in white text to all players on that world: What people have to say about Ferumbras
abilities: Trembling Debuff Ball (Reduces Distance by 50%-90% for 6 seconds) Ferumbras
location: His citadel on Kharos. You must ask Zoltan for permission  to access the citadel.
behaviour: Ferumbras attacks in melee range. Ferumbras will retreat at 1 to 3599 (0% - 4%, deep red) health.
strategy: The main blocker (the first entering the TP) gets to ferumbras and waits for help from the other knights. They take the summoned demons with Exeta Res. All shooters stay 1 sqm away and try to kill Ferumbras as fast as possible. Druids should use Wild Growth runes next to the shooters to avoid Demons from targeting, shooters will still be able to shoot SDs.

name: Fire Overlord
notes: New creature in Summer Update 2008. Do not be frightened to face it. Just run and shoot Sudden Death runes, but do not forget to keep your magic shield on.
location: The Elemental Spheres Quest, Sorcerer's part - Fire Sphere.
behaviour: Behaves similar and looks like a Hellfire Fighter.
strategy: Run it and use Sudden Death Runes.

name: Flameborn
notes:
Hellspawn's boss. Part of the Paw and Fur Society tasks of Grizzly Adams.
Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest. The portal which leads to the boss is in northwest of Restricted Area of Magician Quarter, here.
behaviour: Flameborn attacks in melee range. Flameborn never retreats.
strategy: Treat him as a stronger Hellspawn. You can use Energy Wall Runes to easily avoid him as a paladin or mage.

name: Flamecaller Zazrak
notes: Lizard Dragon Priest's boss, spawns with 0-2 Lizard Legionnaires and 0-2 Lizard High Guards.
location: Muggy Plains, south of the Temple of Equilibrium (Zao), here, and on the mountain north of Chaochai, here.
behaviour: Flamecaller Zazrak attacks from a distance.
strategy:
Kill it quickly, since it can be annoying with its strong attacks, invisibility and fast self-healing. Area runes and spells are useful to use against this creature to cancel its commonly used invisibility. 
Paladins should be 80+ with assassin stars before trying to solo, but it's better to kill with a partner if you're under level 100.
Knights should use chase opponent option and use Fierce Berserk and Great Health Potion when needed. 
Lower leveled mages should kill using Sudden Death Runes and Avalanche as well as Mana Shield.

name: Fleabringer
notes: It's the Gnarlhounds' boss.
location: Steppe of Zao. Can be found in this cave, in this cave, on the surface around here and possibly other places. Spawns with 2-5 Insect Swarms.
behaviour: Run away in red hp.
strategy: Any vocation above level 25 can kill up close, but lower level Mages and Paladins should keep their distance.

name: Fleshcrawler
notes:
Ancient Scarab's boss. Part of the Paw and Fur Society tasks of Grizzly Adams. Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
The portal which leads to the boss is in the deepest floor of a Larva Cave near the northwest exit of Ankrahmun. Its teleporter is located here.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy:
Treat it like a slightly stronger Ancient Scarab. Mages under level 60 are recommended to use Mana Shield, since they could die instantly by an unfortunate combo.
You can cast a Energy Wall Rune on the ground and run him around, that way no damage will be taken. Be sure to cast it straight, otherwise he can make a shortcut.

name: Fleshslicer
notes:
One of the new Hive Bosses.

Part of the War Against the Hive Quest.
behaviour: Approaches the target very fast.
strategy: Separate it from other monsters, stand diagonally and take it down.

name: Foreman Kneebiter
notes: Foreman Kneebiter will disappear one hour after spawning.
behaviour: Foreman Kneebiter chases the opponent until death.
strategy:
Knights: Knights should have good skills like 75/75. But it is recommended to have 80/80. Of course you don't know when you will meet him so you may die because of bad skills and a low amount of supplies. However a backpack of health potions should be enough. If you are Premium you should use Berserk-like Spells too.
Sorcerers, the best way is to simply run using your best wand while shooting strike Spells like Death Strike if you are Premium. If you are non-premium you should still use your best wand and run. Using Fireball runes instead of Flame Strike/Death Strike is a good idea too. Just keep distance.
Druids should use their best rods like a Underworld Rod or a Hailstorm Rod combined with Flame Strike/Death Strike.  If you are non-premium, use Fireball runes.
Mages can shoot Sudden Death runes. It's easier and faster.
Paladins need good skills. Use royal spears combined with either Ethereal Spear or Fireball runes.

name: Foreshock
notes: A boss in the Heart of Destruction Quest.
behaviour: After taking some damage he will transform into Aftershock and vice versa. A foreshock never retreats.
strategy: Unknown

name: Fugue
notes:
It's one of the Usurper leaders trying to take control of the Order of the Lion. 
Part of The Order of the Lion Quest.
behaviour: Fights in close combat. Fugue never retreats.
strategy: Fugue is similar in strength to Grand Master Oberon, though its many summons can make the fight more dangerous. For a small team or even a duo with a blocker and healer it isn't very complicated and should be rather straightforward damage dealing. Without a blocker, or at lower levels (<400), a good strategy is to pull Fugue outside of the room and close the door, protecting yourself from the Usurpers. After that, you can also use the stairs to go down in case of an emergency or to heal your Special Summon, if using it. Bear in mind that Fugue disappears if it's not killed a few minutes after it spawns, which can hinder the solo strategy with stair-hopping ineffective.

name: Furious Morshabaal
notes: It is a stronger version of Morshabaal and Enraged Morshabaal and shares most of its properties with them, except that it takes less damage and reflects more damage.
location: Morshabaal appears inside a teleporter that spawns at the stone circle in the northwest of Edron, here. Only characters of level 150 or higher can enter
strategy: See Morshabaal.

name: Fury of the Emperor
notes: Part of the Wrath of the Emperor Quest.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.
