Great Yellow Musical Notes Ball on itself (Reduces Magic Level ) Furyosa
Self-Healing (10000 only once and when on red hp)
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Gaffir
notes:
It's an Order of the Cobra boss.
Part of the Grave Danger Quest.
behaviour: Unknown

name: Gaz'haragoth
notes: Gaz'haragoth is a Demon Prince who was once in charge of overseeing Roshamuul, until the explosion of the Dream Catcher mutated him into his current form. After a world breaks Roshamuul's wall, Gaz'haragoth is found on top of the mountain at the center of the island, and will remain there until it's defeated. Upon defeat, Gaz'haragoth is cast to the Roshamuul Prison lowest levels, where it will be imprisoned in a secure room. Even so, eventually he gathers considerable strength and can be fought again by brave warriors. Before he appears, the following message is broadcast in white text to all players of the world he spawns in:
location: Spawns every day at Server Save on top of the central mountain in Upper Roshamuul (+2 floor, here), until killed for the first time. Once this happens, spawns rarely as a raid in the Roshamuul Prison (-5 floor, here).
behaviour: Gaz'haragoth fights his opponents in close combat. Gaz'haragoth has many announced abilities:
strategy: Gaz'haragoth has a large energy UE, announced 5 seconds before its execution. He also summons multiple minions of Gaz'haragoth which act independently of him. Care must be taken while navigating Gaz'haragoth's lair, as the minions transform into Strange Vortices, leading to Gaz'haragoth's Nightmare. The strategy to defeat Gaz'haragoth is similar whether he is fought on top of the mountain or locked in the prison. The primary difference lies in the player's levels, as the initial encounter will likely involve lower-level characters. High-level knights (700+) can block Gaz'haragoth with the support of healers, but they must be ready to flee from the Death and Doom ability. The recommended strategy is to block him near a ramp, allowing shooters to move up and down easily. Ensure there is a vortex nearby to escape to the Nightmare. Be cautious of heavy paralyze effects, which can make escape difficult. On low-population servers, defeating Gaz'haragoth before he heals may be challenging. Some announcements hint that the nightmares can be killed to prevent his healing. This approach may provide an alternate means to defeat him.

name: Gelidrazah the Frozen
notes: This boss can only be fought when First Dragon Quest is active.
location: On Okolnir, after starting the quest you can enter the teleport right here here.
behaviour: Gelidrazah the Frozen will retreat at 1 to 399 (0.01% - 3.99%, deep red) health.
strategy: Treat it like a stronger Frost Dragon, kill it with Sudden Death Runes.

name: General Murius
notes: General Murius is the leader of Markwin's army of Minotaurs. He can most often be found supporting the minotaur troops in Mintwallin. You can use an Obsidian Knife on his corpse in order to get a Minotaur Leather.  He is thought to be an allusion of General Marius, who was a general in Ancient Rome.
abilities: Summons (1-? Minotaur Guard or Minotaur Archer )
behaviour: General Murius fights until death.
strategy: Another way to kill it is with Firebomb runes (look at the screenshot).  Stand in the Lvl 30 door in Markwin's room, firebomb the fields infront the door, wait for General Murius to come close, go behind the door, wait for General Murius to go few steps away, lure him again by going in the door, and so on~. General Murius will run through the fire all the time and after a while he will die. You only need lvl 30 to enter the door, but other doors would also work.

name: Ghazbaran
notes:
Ghazbaran - the "Lord of Blades", is a member of the Triangle of Terror. The cultists in the Formorgar Mines are said to be trying to revive the frozen demons in there to conjure the mighty archdemon. They are melting the ice in his name. The first time he appeared after the test server was on the server of Julera on July 4, 2007.
The first time he died was on the server of Candia on September 22, 2007. Ghazbaran can be seen with at least 5 Deathslicers, 2 Juggernauts, 2 Furies, and 1 Demon. The furies and demon appear to spawn with Ghazbaran, along with some of the deathslicers. Some of the deathslicer are summoned by Ghazbaran.
location: Formorgar Mines, in the pit with the Juggernaut.
behaviour: Ghazbaran runs away in low health. He also casts a defense spell on himself which will temporarily reduce every attacker's skill (depending on what he hits with) to 0. He will only remain in the realm for 4 hours.
strategy: A pair of high levels knights can lure the monsters, one by one, until remain only the boss. Many high level knights are needed to block all Deathslicers ((also recommended to lure a monster and make it destroy the Deathslicers, the same way a Orc Berserker can kill other orcs to come near you) this can also be done with summoned Demon Skeleton's on pvp or pvp-enforced worlds. Simply trap the Knight blocking the Deathslicer with Magic Walls and then attack the Knight with the summons to kill the Deathslicer.) and other knights (about 3) to block Ghazbaran (Stone Skin Amulets are strongly recommended, cause this powerful creature can even kill a knight of level 200+ with one combo). The main blocker will need a lot of healers, usually some blockers die trying to block with their own healing. The main blocker can also use Challenge to make sure Ghazbaran does not retarget on the shooters and healers. Then, just have many shooters to banish the Archdemon from our realm. This monster has extremely hard defense, it's immune to Ice, Fire and Earth Damage - Sudden Deaths or Energy spells are the best choice.

name: Ghulosh' Deathgaze
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
location: Ghulosh's room inside the Secret Library.
behaviour: It attacks from distance and moves very slowly.
strategy: See the strategy for Ghulosh.

name: Ghulosh
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: It will become Ghulosh' Deathgaze after being hit for a while.
strategy: Before going into the library, make sure to bring a Depth Galea or Helmet of the Deep, as it will be very important against this boss. From the entrance, go to the Fire Section and go down to the second floor. Go to the room south-east where you will find the teleport. Enter it and pull the Ostentatious Bookstand once your team is ready for the fight. You will have 17 minutes to finish the fight. The Secret Library Quest - Ghulosh During the fight, Ghulosh will transform into Ghulosh' Deathgaze. The objective will be to get rid of the Deathgaze, but players can not kill it, as it takes no damage from them. First, destroy The Book of Death that spawns north of the room to release a Concentrated Death (it is advised that you initially attack the book until it is on red HP first, and then just finish it when required). Now, you have to line up Ghulosh' Deathgaze with the Concentrated Death. This is because Gulosh' Death Beam actually deals heavy Drown Damage to players, but it hurts itself for 6000~8600 damage when hitting the Concentrated Death because of Damage Reflection. The Concentrated Death dies rather quickly by players and summons attacks, so make sure not to damage it yourself. If it dies, the book will shortly respawn so you can kill it to spawn another one. The Deathgaze is a ranged creature and cannot be fully trapped or it will teleport to the center of the room. To control it, it is recommended that the Knight Challenges it and forces it to one of the wall corners. Then, Magic Wall Runes and Wild Growth Runes can be used to prevent the Deathgaze from walking to the sides. Meanwhile, another player should be bringing the Concentrated Death to place it in front of the Deathgaze, as shown below. The first two times that Ghulosh' Deathgaze hits the Concentrated Death, it will be immediately enough damage to transform it back into Ghulosh. The third time, however, will require you to make the Deathgaze to hit itself several times until it transforms back, and then you'll finally be able to finish the boss. During the fight, you will also have to deal with several Bone Jaws as well as Blood Tears. The Bone Jaws should be cleared whenever possible so they do not pile up, but the Blood Tears respawn immediately upon dying, so do not waste resources or time on them. Make sure not to damage or kill the Concentrated Death in the process of clearing the minions.

name: Glitterscale
notes: Part of A Father's Burden Quest. Its corpse cannot be skinned or looted. Its respawn time can differ, but might go as low as 3 minutes 10 seconds.
behaviour: The same as a dragon.
strategy: A little bit stronger than a regular Dragon.

name: Glooth Bomb
notes: It travels a path north and leaves fire in its wake. It walks over Magic Walls and Wild Growth trees, but does not remove them. It walks on top of enemy monsters, but does not kill them. The Bomb will not pass through players. When it reaches the Underground Glooth Factory walls to the north, it will explode, hitting everyone for 1000 damage and destroying the southern plant wall allowing the monsters to pass through. You will obtain the achievement Robo Chop when you help to defeat a Glooth Bomb.
location: Second floor of the Underground Glooth Factory, south side.
behaviour: It will attack someone that is in its melee range. A glooth bomb never retreats.
strategy: Gather a team of 10 or more players to kill it. It's strong to all damage types, so use your best weapons and spells on it. Be careful with the other creatures around, specially if there's a raid happening. Watch out for the Glooth Batteries as their area spell can cause quite a lot of damage.

name: Glooth Fairy
notes: Its appearance is identical to that of a Glooth Golem.
behaviour: Fights in close range, often will stop chasing a fleeing character and walk around aimlessly for 2-3 seconds before retargetting passing through fire fields to attack a nearby player.
strategy: Entrap him with Fire Field Runes, then strike, avoiding his beams. When he's deep in the red health, he'll heal for about 12.5% of his total health (around 7,500 HP). So, focus your strongest attacks on him before he heals. However, he can only do this three times, so you can also just proceed with your attacks until he has been killed. Another strategy is to use a Fire Wall Rune in the middle of the room and two Energy Wall Runes in the shape of a box while luring him over the energy fields while avoiding his melee attacks.

name: Gnomevil
notes: Gnomevil was a member of the Gnomes who turned evil. It is said that his size "grew with evilness".
abilities: Debuff (Reduces Melee and Distance and Shielding and Magic Level )
behaviour: Gnomevil attacks the player dealing the most damage.
strategy: Gnomevil's low healing capabilities and relatively weak offensive make him the easiest warzone boss to kill, despite being the boss of the second. Gnomevil's toughest move is his melee. His beams cause mana drain, electrification and burning, making him easier for knights to block. If trapped, Gnomevil's damage can be countered with relative ease. The general strategy is to have 3-4 players (preferably knights) block Gnomevil's adjacent squares and have the shooters fire until he's dead. The player being attacked by Gnomevil (usually the highest level mage) should position themselves behind the main blocking knight, so that Gnomevil is most commonly facing them, absorbing the beams for the other knights to save mana. Challenge is probably a bad idea while Gnomevil is trapped because it would direct strong melee damage to the knight for a single turn, before Gnomevil again retargets to the highest damage dealer. For small team, it's recommended to trap boss where he spawn with 1 or 2 blockers and all shooters should stay north west of boss, this way boss wont chase them if one of blockers stand 1sqm north of his spawn position.

name: Golgordan
notes: The walls of the room is filled with Magicthrowers, Flamethrowers, Plaguethrowers and Shredderthrowers. Also Latrivan, his brother, is in the same room. It's one of the bosses of The Inquisition Quest.
abilities: Teleport beam (Reduces Melee and Distance and Shielding ) Golgordan
location: Through the teleport in The Battlefields.
behaviour: Fights until death.
strategy: Unknown

name: Gorga
location: Top floor of Medusa Tower, here.
behaviour: Gorga attacks in melee range.

name: Gorgo
notes:
Medusae boss. Part of the Paw and Fur Society tasks of Grizzly Adams.

Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-450 and starting up to 42 hp/turn)
Medusa's Gaze (changes your appearance into a stone statue)
location: Deeper Banuta, main quest floor (teleport here).
behaviour: Behaves exactly as a regular Medusa. Gorgo will retreat at 180 to 1349 (4% - 29.98%, red) health.
strategy: Treat it as a Medusa.

name: Gorzindel
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: From the entrance, go to the Fire Section, then all the way east and then south where you'll find the teleport. Enter it and pull the Ostentatious Bookstand once your team is ready for the fight. You will have 17 minutes to finish the fight. The Secret Library Quest - Gorzindel To kill Gorzindel you will first have to weaken it. To do so, start by attacking the Stolen Tome of Portals north of the room (you can ignore the Malicious and Mean Minions for now). When it dies, its corpse will be a teleport in which everyone should quickly jump into (since the boss deals heavy Paralysis, it is better to walk towards the Book when it is about to die). Each team member will be sent to a separate small room with a Malicious Minion and another book that is responsible for one of the boss' abilities or strengths. You will have around 4 turns to attack it before being sent to the main room again. Note that after returning from the small rooms, several minions will have spawned in the main room, being able to hit for significant damage if they combo, so it's better to use Avalanche Runes on them to clear the room, specially from the Malicious Minions which die faster. Repeat this process until all 5 books are dead and the boss is weakened. The following books must be destroyed: When the 5 books are dead, all that is left is for players to attack Gorzindel until it dies. During this time, it is recommended that the shooters stay near the left wall of the room to avoid the Stolen Tome's Death spell around itself.

name: Grand Canon Dominus
notes:
It's a boss of the Order of the Falcon.
Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Fights in close combat. Grand Canon Dominus never retreats.
strategy: For duos or small teams, Grand Canon Dominus isn't much harder than the other minibosses of the Falcon Bastion. Players should avoid standing in front of it due to its strong beam, which together with the other abilities can easily combo more than 2000 HP. For those trying to kill it solo, beware that the area where it spawns does not favor running too much, and you'll be hit by its attacks nonetheless.

name: Grand Chaplain Gaunder
notes:

Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: You can attack it from a distance if you stand behind the table in the room where he can't get you (this might be fixed in an upcoming patch). It's better to use elemental and holy attacks since his physical resistance and armor are quite high.

Small Flame Bomb (0-900+) Grand Commander Soeren

name: Grand Master Oberon
notes:
He is the Order of the Falcon leader and brother of Scarlett and Kesar Etzel.
Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: This boss will heal completely and a Falcon Knight or a Falcon Paladin will spawn when it reaches ~3000 hp left and will keep healing every single hit it takes until the player replies to his debate argument. Grand Master Oberon never retreats.
strategy: This battle is both physical and verbal. During the battle, once the boss reaches red health, he will summon a Falcon Knight or a Falcon Paladin and heal completely, as well as keep healing for every amount of damage you deal to him and start arguing with you, popping up an orange message until someone speaks in Local Chat Channel or NPCs Channel, then he will stop talking and become vulnerable again. Each time he gets to red HP and heals, there will be a different message from him, and in order to defeat him you must reply with the correct argument. This verbal confrontation has to be done correctly 3 times during the fight so that the boss can be killed. When you reply with the correct answer, Oberon will grunt (GRRRAAANNGH!), but if you do not reply correctly, he will laugh at you (HAHAHAHA!). All the arguments you need to reply are described in the documents that you can find inside the castle. There is a total of 8 volumes, and each one contains a quote. Tip: Since killing Oberon is a daily routine for many players, it is useful to have the answers in hotkeys or action buttons. Due to how dialog with NPCs works in Tibia, it is possible to setup only 2 buttons with all the answers, and you can use two others to indicate which button to use. This works by combining the replies to the 3 arguments that start with a T (I, VIII and IX) in one message, and the remaining replies on another. The correct reply will be recognized even when it is mixed with other replies. The reason you can not use a single message for all replies is that it would exceed the character limit for a message. You can set two buttons with the replies above and two to indicate which is which, like this:

name: Grand Mother Foulscale
notes: She is the Dragon boss that spawns with their raid on Muggy Plains (25 minutes after the initial raid message). She looks the same as a Dragon. Her corpse can be skinned in order to get a Green Dragon Leather.
abilities: Great Musical Bomb ( Summons 4 Dragon Hatchlings at once)
behaviour: She will run away with red hp.
strategy: Same as a dragon, but keep in mind she has more hp and also summons Dragon Hatchlings. Don't underestimate the damage that dragon hatchlings can deal!

name: Grandfather Tridian
notes: None.
location: Third floor (behind the piano) in Cult Cave (Liberty Bay) here.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: This boss can be very hard for lower levels because he will do invisible and heal full, a good trick is to fire/energy bomb him in a corner, that way he will be visible almost all the time.

name: Gravelord Oshuran
location: First floor of Vampire Crypts (here), only as a raid boss.
behaviour: He behaves almost like a regular Lich, paralyzing you very intensely.
strategy:
Paladin: Use Enchanted Spear and Exevo Mas San to kill his summons.
Knight: Try to trap him and use Exori Gran for kill him and his summons.

name: Great Timedisplaced Anomaly
notes: It's one of the bosses which awards Theons as part of Tibia's 25th Anniversary.
behaviour: A great timedisplaced anomaly never retreats.

name: Greedok
behaviour: Greedok attacks in melee range.

name: Grimrat
notes: Appears during the Tibia's 15th Anniversary, in a raid at a random time once a day.
location: Orc Fortress near the entrance here.
behaviour: Attacks players. Grimrat never retreats.
strategy: Just kill him. Tibia's 15th Anniversary! Grimrat! Grimrat getting killed

name: Groam
notes:
He is Dronk's friend, but apparently turned into a Deepling Scout. He spawns at most once per day (server save) per server.
The achievement Eye of the Deep can be earned by killing him.
location: East side of the Sunken Mines, during the Awash World Change.
behaviour: Same as a Deepling Scout's.Groam attacks in melee range.
strategy: Treat him as a somewhat stronger Deepling Scout.

name: Grorlam
notes: One of the oldest rare-spawning bosses. Also known as the Stone Golem's boss, although Grorlam has never been found in the vicinity of any nor does summon them.
location: Deep in Mount Sternum/Undead Cave, in an empty cave that is located under some Cave Rats (can also be reached through Ancient Temple), in the cave down after the Giant Spider, in the Dragon's spawn, in an unreachable 2 sqm area with some tombs at the undead area, and possibly other places under Mount Sternum. A Pick is needed to enter these caves. He might also spawn on fourth and fifth floor of the undead cave.
behaviour: Fights until death and rarely retargets.
strategy: Since the Christmas Update 2007, Grorlam can see invisible players and is stronger against physical attacks. Death damage, fire and possible ice damage do well against it.

name: Guard Captain Quaid
notes:
It's an Order of the Cobra boss.
Part of the Grave Danger Quest.
behaviour: Quaid stays at a ranged distance, On occasion he will spawn with an Ugly Monster, which can drop food or a Giant Ruby
strategy: Run Quaid into a corner of the room and kill him, beware his poison bomb attack that can stack with a physical damage attack, this can do approximately 1400 damage in a single shot

name: Hairman the Huge
notes: It's the Kongra's Boss. It spawns with one Kongra.
behaviour: This boss fights until death.Attacks in melee range.
strategy: Kill as a normal Kongra, but if you are a low skilled Knight or Paladin be careful because it has a good defense against Physical Damage. You can try to run him, but you can lure more apes.

name: Hatebreeder
notes: Boss of Ghastly Dragons.
abilities: Cursing Death Hit (same as normal ghastly dragon)
location: Razachai Inner Sanctum, around here or here.
behaviour: Similar to a Ghastly Dragon. Hatebreeder? will retreat at 720 to 5399 (4% - 29.99%, red) health.
strategy: The death attacks should be less effective if you wear a Death Ring or Koshei's Ancient Amulet. Depending on your vocation, you can use one of the following: Skullcracker Armor, Robe of the Underworld, Divine Plate. It's better to use energy-based attacks like Energy Wave. It heals very fast so it's a tough monster to solo. Also it spawns with more ghastly dragons.

name: Hellgorak
notes: Hellgorak is the last survivor of a demonic cabal which succumbed to the Ruthless Seven aeons ago. And Hellgorak is a survivor to the core. As the victory of the Ruthless Seven became more and more evident, he betrayed his allies and switched sides. Hellgorak decided it was better to serve under the Ruthless Seven than to die as a leader. Becoming a minion of the Ruthless Seven did not stop him from developing his evil plans. Slowly but steadily he climbed up in the ranks and used his new power and influence to improve himself. He called in favours, and killed those who possessed wisdom he needed. Over time, his demonic plans yielded fruits. With the help of stolen secrets and enchantments, his dark body is covered with glowing ancient runes that protect him from most harm. He boasts about his invulnerability which actually was proven a lie by the agents of the inquisition. Still, he shakes off most damage with ease, and it would for sure take an insane amount of attackers to bring him down. It was prophesied that no man will beat him - right before he killed the oracle. Still, he fears the Ruthless Seven who defeated him and his allies in the past. Therefore, it is safe to say that, even though he is nearly invulnerable, Hellgorak is all but immortal. It's one of the bosses of The Inquisition Quest.
abilities: Smoke UE (Reduces Distance by 50-70% for 18secs seconds) Hellgorak
location: Through the teleport in the Hives in the Inquisition Quest. He is the seventh and final boss.
behaviour: Fights to the death, retargets rapidly.
strategy: He is extremely resistant to all elements players can use. The only way to effectively damage him is to convince the Dreadbeasts which are summoned by the towers around the room. Trap Hellgorak with the blocker + 7 dreadbeasts. Druids should use Mass Healing to heal the blocker and the dreadbeasts.

name: Hemming
notes: Werewolf's boss. Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
abilities: Summons 2 War Wolves at once (white musical bomb around itself)
location: Vengoth Werewolf Cave, behind the teleport which is located here.
behaviour: Hemming runs in low health.
strategy:
Paladins and Mages: Run him around the room while shooting Assassin Stars/Prismatic Bolts/SDs. If he uses Haste, you may need to do the same to keep distance. Make sure to use Exura or Exura Gran if he catches up to you.
Knights: Shoot a Fire Bomb onto the floor somewhere, then attack Hemming and move into the middle of the fire bomb. Hemming will come after you onto the fire, but his War Wolves will not. Thus you will avoid having your shielding broken and will take considerably less melee damage. Note: Do not bother killing the War Wolves as they will most likely be summoned again very quickly.

name: Heoni
notes:
This creature was added in Summer Update 2010.
Part of A Father's Burden Quest.
abilities: Melee (? and starting up to 7 hp/turn)
location: In the mountains of Edron, behind the door here.
behaviour: Runs in low health.
strategy: Treat it as a regular Wyvern.

name: Hide
notes: It's as fast as a tarantula with haste, and has a high defense. Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
location: Its teleporter is located here. It can be very dangerous for lower levels to go to Hide because it is possible that 2 Carniphilas and 2 Tarantulas surround the hole.
behaviour: Fights till death, like a Tarantula.
strategy:
Kill her like a Tarantula, but be aware that she is quite a bit stronger.
Sorcerers & Druids: This is an easy boss for a mage level 33 or higher, if using either wand of inferno or hailstorm rod, combined with Flame Strike. You may need to use Light Healing or Intense Healing when your health drops below 150. This creature uses Haste making it difficult to outrun, not recommended for level 20 or below. You should bring Mana Potions as a precaution for lower levels. Paladins: Just run around and kill it with Royal Spears. When it hastes, keep running and heal with Exura or Exura Gran. You might need some Mana potions for lower levels. Knights: Stand still and kill it using Melee. It is strong to Physical Damage, so it is recommended to use a fire-enchanted weapon. Knights with skills 60/60 or more shouldn't have a problem killing Hide, but it is recommended to take mana potions for Wound Cleansing.

name: High Templar Cobrass
notes: New creature in Summer Update 2008.
location: Chor, below the center temple, near the Funeral Urn used in The Explorer Society Quest, downstairs here.
behaviour: It is a stronger version of a Lizard Templar.High Templar Cobrass attacks in melee range. High Templar Cobrass never retreats.
strategy: Kill it like a normal Lizard Templar.

name: Hirintror
notes: It's the boss of Ice Golems.
abilities: Self-Healing (1000 hp; once when in low health)
location: First floor of the Nibelor Ice Cave, around here and in the Formorgar Mines, around here.
behaviour: Hirintor retargets very often, but other than that behave like regular Ice Golems. Damaging him makes him say "snirr!" and triggers his AoE mana drain attack.Attacks in melee range. A hirintror never retreats.
strategy: He heals back to full once when you have almost depleted his hit points.

name: Horadron
notes: You can fight this boss if you have a Copper Prison Key, obtainable from an Unrealized Dream. To use it, go to Roshamuul Prison and use it while standing on the respective platform. You can only fight this boss alone.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Horestis
notes: In order to spawn Horestis, a team has to break all the Ornate Canopic Jars in Horestis' tomb.
behaviour: Chases its opponent and summon.
strategy: All vocations should wear a Dwarven Ring to avoid the Drunkenness he causes. There is a spot in the upper left portion of the room where only 2 creatures can attack you at a time.  Like this:  [97 EK Killing Horestis] Mages: He is weak to fire so you should use Great Fireball Runes and Flame Strike. If you think it's attacks are too much for you, use Magic Shield and a Fire Wall Rune to keep your distance.

name: Ice Overlord
notes: New creature in Summer Update 2008. It looks the same as Massive Water Elemental.
abilities: Freezing Strike (8 hp /90 turns for a total of 720 hp ) Ice Overlord
Paralyzing Windstorm (Reduces 530-710 speed points) Ice Overlord
Paralyzing Strike (Reduces 710-850 speed points for 10s) Ice Overlord
Ice Wind on himself (unknown effect) Ice Overlord
location: The Elemental Spheres Quest, Paladin's part - Ice Sphere.
behaviour: Ice Overlord attacks the enemy in close combat.
strategy: Stay diagonal to avoid its ice beam. Use Assassin Stars and Exori San. A team of 2 or 3 is recommended so you can kill 3 or more Ice Overlords. A paladin normally has time to solo 2 overlords per 8 ice soils. There is a spot in the south-east corner where you can go diagonal and the overlord can't hit you with the beam. It's better to kill the last overlord in there.

name: Ichgahal
notes: One of the bosses in the Rotten Blood Quest.
strategy: Ichgahal is the twin of Murcion, and both share similarities. This is arguably the easiest boss in the quest, and that is why it is left for last, to be fought with three Bakragore's Taints. It has three main challenges that players must face during the whole fight: There are two common strategies used on the fight. One is to have the Knight use Challenge on all Elder Bloodjaws and stand in a corner, with one Druid staying nearby to heal them. This is because the room is big enough that the Paladin can then run a half-lap on the other side of the room, having basically three shooters staying away from the Elder Bloodjaws vision the entire fight and avoiding swapping caused by the first taint. Another is to repeat the strategy used in Murcion, where the Knight just runs the full lap as well, staying half a lap behind the Paladin.

name: Inky
notes: None.
abilities: Melee (0-156 and starting up to 2 hp/turn)
location: At Yalahar, Sunken Quarter. When entering the Sunken Quarter step down from the underwater hill and head to south-east, there you should find stairs which takes you down to the boss. The boss is behind a sealed door, so make sure you have the access to that room.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Treat this boss exactly the same as you would treat normal Quara Constrictor, you can run around objects.

name: Irahsae
notes:
It's wearing a large Cobra Crown.
One of its speeches, scientia potentia est, is a Latin phrase meaning "knowledge is power".All players who sufficiently damage it during the last minute of the fight will receive the Slayer of Irahsae achievement.
abilities: Energy Bomb (3x3 square of energy fields )
location: Drefia, behind the portal here, during the Rise of Devovorga World Quest. Can be fought on Vengoth during Devovorga's Essence Mini World Change.
behaviour: Fights at close combat, runs away at very low hp. Does not retarget from the blocker, even when taking massive damage from the shooters.
strategy: Similar to a Fury, but weaker. A 4 person team is enough to safely bring down this monster. With a blocker, and 3 shooters, you should be fine. Irahsae will stand in close combat to the blocker at all times until it is very close to its death. If possible, get at least 2 Master Sorcerer's who can shoot Sudden Death Runes, because of the massive death damage this creature takes. A royal paladin or an elder druid would come in handy, to either inflict damage, or heal the blocker with Heal Friend. Irahsae is not too strong, but the blocker could take considerably high combos of up to 700 damage, maybe more. An Elite Knight of level 55 and higher with good skills and a good set should be able to survive blocking this monster us Strong Health Potions. Amount of waste will depend on how fast the shooters can bring it down. Once it starts to run, make sure all mages shoot Sudden Death at Irahsae before it hides and heal.

name: Irgix the Flimsy
notes: It's part of the Feaster of Souls Quest.
behaviour: Irgix the Flimsy never retreats.

name: Izcandar Champion of Summer
notes: This is the Summer form of Izcandar, the others being Izcandar the Banished and Izcandar Champion of Winter. It's one of the bosses of The Dream Courts Quest.
behaviour: Izcandar retargets very often and the blocker should use Challenge frequently.
strategy: Avoid staying in front of it at all costs, since its Beam and Wave attacks are its most powerful source of damage. There are two ways of killing it: the first is to constantly kill the summons in the room using area attacks, and for this mages should abuse their Earth and Energy waves as well as use Thunderstorm Runes. This method is the safest but also take longer. The other method consists in using mostly single target attacks and focusing on the boss, allowing the summons to stay alive with the blocker and some of the shooters. This method is fastest but also more dangerous and only recommended for experienced teams.

name: Izcandar Champion of Winter
notes: This is the Winter form of Izcandar, the others being Izcandar the Banished and Izcandar Champion of Summer. It's one of the bosses of The Dream Courts Quest.
behaviour: Izcandar retargets very often and the blocker should use Challenge frequently. Izcandar Champion of Winter never retreats.
strategy: Avoid staying in front of it at all costs, since its Beam and Wave attacks are its most powerful source of damage. There are two ways of killing it: the first is to constantly kill the summons in the room using area attacks, and for this mages should abuse their Earth and Energy waves as well as use Thunderstorm Runes. This method is the safest but also take longer. The other method consists in using mostly single target attacks and focusing on the boss, allowing the summons to stay alive with the blocker and some of the shooters. This method is fastest but also more dangerous and only recommended for experienced teams.

name: Izcandar the Banished
notes: This is the neutral form of Izcandar, the others being Izcandar Champion of Winter and Izcandar Champion of Summer. It's one of the bosses of The Dream Courts Quest.
behaviour: Izcandar retargets very often and the blocker should use Challenge frequently.
strategy: Izcandar does not stay in the neutral form for a long time and will change to either the Summer of Winter version shortly after becoming neutral. Some teams like to kill it in this form because it can drop both Winterblade and Summerblade, possibly doubling the odds of getting either of them (but this is unconfirmed).

name: Jailer
notes: During the Test Server when this creature was released, its creator Lionet explained what's behind its story: It looks like a Skeleton Warrior.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: Jaul
notes: Jaul, Protektor Profundis, is one of the three depth lords. Reachable in third stage of Liquid Black Quest, he is the strongest deepling boss."KENH!!" translates to "Intruder!!", and "QJELL AFAR GOU JEY!!" translates to "Qjell watch over us!!". See also: Jaul/Treasure Statistics
location: Fiehonja, southern pit of the Ancestral Grounds.
behaviour: He combos a lot, walks pretty fast and retargets a lot.Attacks in melee range. Jaul never retreats.
strategy: Get a decent level blocker or two (250+ is enough), one healer for each of the blockers and several damage dealers and just kill it with your strongest attacks. Note that knights are not only meatshields and should also attack as they do high amount of damage too. Bronze Amulet is recommended because of the manadrain Jaul does.

name: Jesse the Wicked
notes: Part of the Bank Robbery Mini World Change. Jesse is the thief that robs the Thais bank. He spawns with 4 Smugglers.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Kalyassa
notes: This boss can only be fought when First Dragon Quest is active.
behaviour: A kalyassa will retreat at 1 to 399 (0.01% - 3.99%, deep red) health.
strategy: Mages: Mana shield is recommended since it can combo 2000+. It avoids crossing energy fields, but it's a moot point given how often it spams fire bombs.

name: Katex Blood Tongue
notes: It's part of the Grimvale Quest - An Ancient Feud.
behaviour: Katex Blood Tongue never retreats.
strategy: Combos specially with a summoned Werehyena can deal a lot of damage. Low level knights can avoid this by dropping Fire Bomb Runes and running around using Whirlwind Throw and Groundshaker approaching to do melee damage once it reaches yellow health or is separated from its summoned Werehyena

name: Kerberos
notes:
Hellhound's boss. Part of the Paw and Fur Society tasks of Grizzly Adams. Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
The portal which leads to the boss is in depths of Goroma. The entrance of the cave is here. 
Follow the patches to reach boss: 

Kerberos is in north of last cave. Tibia - Kerberos Paladin level 154 killing Kerberos (Boss)
location: Goroma (look at spoiler for more info).
behaviour: Kerberos never retreats.
strategy:
Their melee attack is considerable much weaker than their wave attacks (which are fatal if combined) so it's best to block it while standing diagonal. Magic Walls, Wild Growth or Energy Wall Runes can be used to help you to staying diagonal and preventing you from the wave attacks. These creatures are very strong so don't underestimate them!
Paladins Should use Assassin Stars and cast Divine Missiles while wearing some Stone Skin Amulets. At lower levels use Energy Rings, stay at meele range, dont run and heal with Great Spirit Potions or Strong Mana Potions trying to stay at full mana all the time. Mages can try to block them without mana shield at level 200+ with some amount of luck while being quick with your healing spells, while shooting Sudden Death runes. Also it's recommended to wear some Stone Skin Amulets to reduce the Physical Damage, alternatively Might Rings.
Kerberos is weak for Ice Damage and Holy Damage, so use ice or holybased attacks.

name: Kesar
notes:
It's the creature version of Kesar the Younger. 
Part of The Order of the Lion Quest.
location: Bounac in the fields to the south-east.
behaviour: Kesar can be a nice blocker when you are facing a mutual enemy. Kesar never retreats.

name: King Chuck
notes:
If you mess around with his Cauldron he will get angry.
It's part of the final game of the Orcsoberfest event.
strategy: You won't fight King Chuck directly, but rather participate in its Feast until you gain access to its Orger Treasure.

name: King Zelos
notes: He is the final boss of the Grave Danger Quest and a former Thaian king. He is mentioned in some books: The History of King Zelos part one and part two, as well as About Nargol the Impaler.
abilities: Great Hex beam (reduces maximum hitpoints to 40%; healing received to 50% and damage dealt to 50%)
Expanding Death Ring (1000-2000; starts as a small ring near the boss after being channeled and grows bigger every second)
behaviour: King Zelos never retreats.
strategy: Its elemental weakness depend on the team performance during the boss fight. The longer it takes for the team to reach Zelos, the stronger it will be. Nevertheless, Fire is always the best element to be used against it. If the team has defeated the 4 minibosses before Zelos quickly enough, the strategy is easy. The blocker should always stay diagonal, preferably at the right side of the room near the wall so the boss doesn't face the team. The shooters should stay diagonal to avoid the Hex beam and shoot Fireball Runes for maximum single-target damage. The second blocker can either attack from distance while blocking the 3 Risen Soldiers or stay near the boss, which is more dangerous but will increase the damage output.

name: Koshei the Deathless
notes: When you enter in his room he will respawn if you haven't defeated him yet. He can't die unless you know what to do. If you kill him, he will respawn again. Gives no loot or experience.This book and its sequel give an overview of Koshei's history.
abilities: Melee (0-100 and starting up to 20 hp/turn)
Close Range Curse (1-52 (lasts for 21~ turns for a total of 319~ damage))
behaviour: Will try to kill you while summoning a Bonebeast.
strategy:
To all vocations: The use of Garlic Necklace is recommended. Even though he has many hit points, he is quite easy to defeat with a 45+ character. His self healing is really troublesome (you could end up doing 8000 damage while Koshei heals 5000 hp, before you defeat him).Mages should stay away and using their wand/rod and Exori flam or GFB runes since fire is Koshei's weakness. He sometimes does high damage so Mana shield is recommended for Mages around level 45.Paladins stay away while shooting bolts / arrows / throwing weapons and Exori San (Holy Damage). Some Health Potions would be good. Make sure to have enough mana for Exura, as the Bonebeast can Paralyze you.Knights will have a very hard time with this one, as he has many life draining attacks, coupled with the fast healing. Not recommended for Knights under level 70 (Fierce Berserk), unless you are experienced. It's also recommended to bring a shooter to help with the killing. As a knight a 20-40 Mana Potions and a few Strong Health Potions are needed as he hits hard. Also a good idea to wear a Garlic Necklace, as it has many Life Drain attacks.Note: that he will respawn shortly after you've killed him, unless you know what to do.
Part of the Koshei The Deathless Quest. Can only be successfully defeated if you use the Koshei's Ancient Amulet on his corpse.

name: Kraknaknork
notes: None.
abilities: Melee (? and starting up to 5 hp/turn)
location: Rookgaard Orc Fortress (during a quest), and in his own dimension, accessed only once after the tutorial.
behaviour: Kraknaknork tries to keep distance. A kraknaknork will retreat at 3 to 23 (3.75% - 28.75%, deep red to red) health.
strategy: Trap him in a corner and kill him.

name: Kroazur
notes: You can kill this boss once every 2 real-life hours. Part of the Threatened Dreams Quest.
behaviour: Deals approximately 70% physical damage, 20% death damage, and 10% earth damage.Kroazur attacks in melee range.
strategy: Mages and paladins below level 150 can use field runes to keep it at a distance while attacking. The room is also quite large, making it easy to maneuver around.

name: Kusuma
behaviour: Attacks in melee range. A kusuma never retreats.
strategy: Start by stepping on the Energy Vein  located here to teleport to the room just south of this tile. Kusuma avoids energy fields, which can be used to your advantage. If you're struggling to handle her damage and are using ranged attacks, consider placing energy fields around the room to limit her movement and give yourself more control while kiting her.

name: Lady Tenebris
notes: This is one of the bosses in the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
location: A dungeon here, accessible through the Death Portal and the Old Masonry.
behaviour: Fights in close combat. Every couple minutes she will teleport players into the middle of the room and after a few seconds she will cast an ultimate explosion around her (7sqm radius) that deals up to 2500 Death Damage. Lady Tenebris never retreats.

name: Lagatos
notes: No notes
location: Fiehonja, near the giant statue of god-king Qjell.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Take a level 150+ blocker to block this creature and the many Deeplings surrounding it.

name: Last Planegazer
notes: Part of the Opticording Sphere Quest.
behaviour: Attacks at close range.
strategy: Use Physical Damage.

name: Latrivan
notes: The walls of the room is filled with Magicthrowers, Flamethrowers, Plaguethrowers and Shredderthrowers. Also Golgordan, his brother, is in the same room. It's one of the bosses of The Inquisition Quest.
abilities: Teleport Beam (Reduces Melee by 25-40% for 45 seconds) Latrivan
location: Through the teleport in The Battlefields.
behaviour: Walls of the room is lines with shredderthrowers. Also Golgordan, his brother, is in the same room.
strategy: Unknown

name: Leiden
notes: Part of the Cults of Tibia Quest.
location: Boss room of Barkless Cult Trial Zone under Ab'Dendriel
behaviour: Fights in close combat.Leiden attacks in melee range.
strategy: Healing this boss by casting Mass Healing and using Ultimate Healing Rune (Item) is the fastest way to kill it. Avoid using elemental damage as it heals the boss. There is also an alternative way to kill the boss by attacking Wine Cask (Creature) which will summon Liquor Spirits which will then cast area spells that will damage Leiden.

name: Lersatio
notes: Lersatio was once a normal person and a citizen of Carlin. He, his brothers Arthei, Marziel, and Boreth, and Arthei's wife Kala, travelled to Yalahar in order to find a new home. From that moment on Marziel started keeping a diary.Lersatio is a vain vampire who dreams to see his face in a mirror again, which is why he awakens when you break the mirrors near him. He is the second boss you will encounter during the Blood Brothers Quest. He spawns with 2 Vampires.You will receive The Dust of Lersatio when you use a Blessed Wooden Stake on his dead body.
behaviour: He fights till death. Uses Invisibility very often.
strategy: Knights: the best option is to Exori or Exori Gran as much as possible while keeping an eye on your health.  That way you kill all the summons as well so they don't do extra damage.

name: Lethal Lissy
notes: Lethal Lissy is one of the pirates who constantly tries to loot Liberty Bay with overwhelming invasions of pirates. If you see her around Liberty Bay, it's not a good sign. You get a chance to kill her in the Killing in the Name of... Quest after killing 3000 pirates for Raymond Striker. The teleporter is located here. Lethal Lissy
abilities: Musical Notes (a purple field of music notes appears in front of Lethal Lissy)
behaviour: Attacks in melee range. Lethal Lissy will retreat at 58 to 434 (4% - 29.93%, red) health.
strategy: Using an ultimate attack, or focusing SD's on Lethal Lissy is recomended to get the most experience and loot the addon item.

name: Leviathan
notes: Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
location: Sea Serpent Area (look at spoiler for more info).
behaviour: Heals as quickly as a Hydra and stronger, also runs away in deep red health.
strategy: To all vocations: Keep yourself diagonal and wear a Protection Amulet or Leviathan's Amulet since most of the damage you will receive comes from their melee.Treat it like a strong Sea Serpent with more hit points, stronger attacks, and faster healing. You have 10 minutes to kill and loot it or you will be kicked out.Knights: kill it using Berserk, Fierce Berserk and Whirlwind Throw when it starts to run. It is highly recommended to cast Blood Rage and Annihilation, then combine with Berserk, Fierce Berserk, Brutal Strike and Front Sweep. Paladins: Paladins should use Assassin Stars and use your best potions to heal.

name: Lionet (Creature)
notes:
Has a high armor value.
Appeared during Tibia's 15th and 20th Anniversary celebrations, in a raid at a random time once a day.
The following message will appear:
A strange ghost has appeared somewhere in the deepling area. This calls for an experienced ghost hunter!
Then, 20 minutes later he will spawns:
The terrifying ghost Lagatos has appeared in the deepling area - and Lionet is out to hunt it!
abilities: Mana Drain UE (400-700?; often; 6 field radius; red sparkles)
location: On Fiehonja, south of the statue of Qjell (here).
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Try to separate Lionet from the other NPC's, as Sinclair and Spectulus cannot be killed. Tibia's 15th Anniversary! Lionet! Video showing how to kill Lionet.

name: Lisa
notes: Looks the same as Glooth Anemone. Implemented in the Summer Update 2014.
abilities: Self-Healing (17000-23000; few seconds after reaching deep red hp)
location: Oramond, after teleporting by Flora to waiting room, you will be moved to boss room 1 minute after pushing the lever.
behaviour: Attacks in melee range.
strategy: When in deep red hp, she will announce that she will heal herself immediately. After around 6-8 seconds she will heal 17k-23k hp getting back to yellow. Team needs to focus on their strongest attacks to bring her down before she heals, or they will have to repeat the process again. There is a time limit of 15 minutes to kill her.

name: Lizard Abomination
notes:
Introduced in Summer Update 2010.
Part of the Wrath of the Emperor Quest.
location: East of Zao and south of Dragonblaze Peaks, two floors below Zalamon.
behaviour: A lizard abomination never retreats.
strategy: Trap him as fast as you can, knights will have to use challenge a lot since he tend to switch very often. Fire and Energy Bombs will be helpful here.

name: Lizard Gate Guardian
notes: It's the boss you can find in the 5th Mission of the Children of the Revolution Quest, it spawns to the north of Muggy Plains near the great gate.
behaviour: Fights until death.
strategy: Get a high leveled blocker with you and kill it. You will be teleported to Zalamon in around 1~2 minutes after it spawns.

name: Lloyd
notes: This is one of the bosses in the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.He is the brother of Boyd, who is better known as the Mad Mage.
location: Boss room (here) accessible through Replica Dungeon and Energy Portal.
behaviour: Fights in close combat. Lloyd never retreats.
strategy: Simply kill him, he doesn't use very special attacks. He has an energy attack that seems to chain between people within 2-3 sqm but doesn't do much damage. When he has almost zero hit points left he will heal himself fully and teleport to the center of the four energy prisms, unless all energy prisms are destroyed. When this happens you can kill one energy prism. Therefore you have to kill him five times.

name: Lokathmor
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: From the entrance, go to the Energy Section and go all the way west before the hunting area where you'll find a teleport. Enter it and pull the Ostentatious Bookstand once your team is ready for the fight. You will have 17 minutes to finish the fight. Start by attacking the boss. A few moments later, the team will be sent to the center of the room with the invincible boss and trapped by Force Fields (they look like Magic Walls). At this moment, the team should all focus on the same Force Field and kill it as soon as possible to leave the trap, because within the trap Lokathmor will repeatedly cause an explosion that deals death damage, starting with around 700 damage that increases rapidly with each turn. After leaving the trap area, be aware that the range of the explosion will still reach 1sqm in front of the Force Fields. Therefore, safety is only assured after each member is at least 2sqms away from them. The Force Fields also do not block spells, and so both the explosions from the boss and your own attacks will hit through them. A Dark Knowledge will spawn north of the room. Kill it fast and quickly pick up its corpse (a Parchment of Dark Knowledge), use it on the Writing Desk on the west side of the room, and then use the desk, it will destroy the remaining Force Fields and set Lokathmor free, allowing the team to attack it for 20 seconds. After this period, the trap will restart, and players will have to repeat these steps until the boss has been killed. Time is of utmost importance in this fight, and losing one turn may be decisive for a failure. Some hints for optimal performance are:

name: Lord Azaram
notes: It's one of the bosses of Grave Danger Quest.
behaviour: Lord Azaram attacks in melee range.
strategy: Attack it with standard attacks until it disappears and Azaram's Soul appears. When it does, Druids should use Mass Healing and Sorcerers UH runes on it. This strategy will work until its health is full, but afterwards you'll have to kill the Tainted Soul Splinters and lure Azaram's Soul over the Purple Fire they become in order to make Lord Azaram appear again. Its stronger attacks are all waves and beams, so the blocker and the team should always stay diagonal to the boss.

name: Lord Retro
notes: Lord Retro is the final boss of the 25 Years of Tibia Quest. Once he's defeated you'll gain access to Retros Treasure.
location: In the Time Travel Dungeon - through the portal here, specifically found here.
behaviour: Lord Retro will retreat at 1000  (40%, yellow) health.
strategy: See 25 Years of Tibia Quest;

name: Lord of the Elements
notes: Lord of the Elements is a boss that only can be seen in The Elemental Spheres Quest. Curiously, despite being the supposed "master" of all elements, it does not dare walk over Fire Fields unless provoked. You can skin a slain Lord of the Elements using an Obsidian Knife to obtain Neutral Matter, with no chance of failure.
abilities: Summons (1-2 Massive Earth Elemental or Massive Fire Elemental or Massive Water Elemental or Massive Energy Elemental )
Shapeshifting (Turns  into; Massive Earth Elemental or Massive Fire Elemental or Massive Water Elemental or Massive Energy Elemental )
behaviour: This creature retargets all the time and can easily kill the mages. Also, it's very fast.
strategy:
Since you need one character of each vocation for this monster you will have to work as a team.
Make sure that the knight blocks him. The mages should focus on doing spell damage while the paladin shoots at him with his ammunition. make sure that the druid heals the knight since the boss can do quite some damage from time to time.

name: Lyxoph (Creature)
notes:
Appeared during Tibia's 15th and 20th Anniversary celebrations, in a raid at a random time once a day.
The following message will appear:
The birds in the forest below the Outlaw Camp have stopped to sing. There's gonna be a riot here soon.
Then, 20 minutes later he will spawns:
Lyxoph and his mechanical minions have appeared in the forest below the Outlaw Camp.
abilities: Shapeshifting (Turns victims into; Hat of the Mad )
location: Outlaw Camp, here. Spawns with 2 Tin Lizzards of Lyxoph.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Watch of his summons, together they deal a lot of damage. Tibia's 15th Anniversary! Lyxoph! Fight against Lyxoph

name: Mad Mage
notes: His true name is Boyd and he is Lloyd's brother.
behaviour: His attacks are a bit similar to a Fire Elemental's and Thornfire Wolf's, but a bit stronger.
strategy:
Treat him like a weak Infernalist. Also, he strongly targets lower level players. However, in some worlds it's hard to deal the most damage because a lot of players are waiting for him during the last waves of attacks.
Paladins: This creature is weak against physical damage so Assassin Stars combined with the Sharpshooter spell should defeat him fairly rapidly.
Knights: Like paladins, it's recommended to use strong physical spells such as a combination of Blood Rage and Fierce Berserk.
Mages: Should use Sudden Death runes. If you are a Druid, you may use Eternal Winter to deal a lot of damage.
However, if you are alone with the Mage and you won't waste supplies, you may attack him like a common creature.

name: Mad Technomancer
notes: This villainous dwarf is the last target of the Secret Service Quest chain. He is assisted by 2 Dwarf Dispensers which spawn a constant supply of Dwarf Henchmen. To get there, follow the purple lines on the image below to get to the white dots. On step 6, pull the lever to make it respawn:
abilities: Self Healing (100-200 HP; uses it very often)
behaviour: Like a dwarf geomancer, keeps distance, but unlike geomancers they run in red hp. Beware of his speed, he runs fast when fleeing.
strategy: Unknown

name: Madareth
notes: Madareth has dedicated his life to battle. Bred by The Ruthless Seven as one of their greatest warlords, Madareth has endured a painful and torturing training. Instead of creating a brilliant leader, though, they gave birth to a savage killing machine that constantly tries to improve his skills by challenging other demonic minions. Even if Madareth only uses a fraction of his skills, the usual outcome of such fights is a stack of Juggernauts and demons hacked to pieces. It is rumoured that he even defeated the mighty Orshabaal. His only weakness might be the single-mindedness with which he pursues the destruction of his victims. In his lust for battle, he often forgets his surrounding and lives only for the moment of his next strike. Though Madareth loves playing cat and mouse with his victims, he quickly loses all finesse and fully indulges in his blood lust. It is unknown how such a beast is kept in check by The Ruthless Seven. It's one of the bosses of The Inquisition Quest.
abilities: Smoke Wave (Reduces Distance by 60%-75% for 20 seconds) Madareth
Great Mana Drain Ball (0-250 Not often)
behaviour: Attacks in melee range. Madareth will retreat at 1000  (1.33%, deep red) health.
strategy: an example how to trap Madareth

name: Magma Bubble
notes: It's the final boss of the Primal Ordeal Quest.
behaviour: It does not move.
strategy: See Primal Ordeal Quest.

name: Mahatheb
notes: You can read more about Mahatheb in this book. This boss spawns quite rarely in the last chamber of the Forgotten Tomb on floor -6.
abilities: Melee (? and starting up to? hp/turn)
location: Bottom floor of the Forgotten Tomb in a Varying Monster Spawn in which the common creatures are a Vampire and a Bonebeast, here. The respawn time of this spawn point is every 3 to 6 minutes.
strategy: Kill the Vampire or Bonebeast at the end of the tomb until Mahatheb spawns. The boss itself is not much stronger than the regular monsters in the tomb.

name: Mahrdis
notes: Mahrdis was sentenced to be locked away, after his part in the conspiracies against the pharaoh Arkhotep. One of the Pharaohs of The Ancient Tombs Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-400 and starting up to 3 hp/turn)
behaviour: Malicious, will make all efforts to destroy intruders.
strategy: He attacks with fire, so blockers should try to distract him and move fast, while mages and paladins attack from far. He is guarded by 3 Dragons, a Dragon Lord and 4 Flamethrowers.

name: Major Timedisplaced Anomaly (Fiehonja)
notes: It's one of the bosses which awards Theons as part of Tibia's 25th Anniversary. The combined Loot Statistics of this boss and the other two with the same name can be seen here.
behaviour: A major timedisplaced anomaly never retreats.

name: Major Timedisplaced Anomaly (Issavi)
notes: It's one of the bosses which awards Theons as part of Tibia's 25th Anniversary. The combined Loot Statistics of this boss and the other two with the same name can be seen here.
behaviour: A major timedisplaced anomaly never retreats.

name: Major Timedisplaced Anomaly (Rascacoon)
notes: It's one of the bosses which awards Theons as part of Tibia's 25th Anniversary. The combined Loot Statistics of this boss and the other two with the same name can be seen here.
behaviour: A major timedisplaced anomaly never retreats.

name: Maliz
behaviour: Maliz attacks in melee range.

name: Malofur Mangrinder
notes:
It looks like an Ogre Brute, with different colours.
It's one of the bosses of The Dream Courts Quest.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: You will enter in a small room with an NPC, after a few seconds, you will be teleported into the boss room. Have the Knight lure the boss to the east side near the wall and avoid being in the beam it can shoot. Once it says "I'M MASHING YE TO DUST BOOM" it will become extremely slow and start doing massive damage up to 6000+. These attacks are very similar to a knights' groundshaker spell and the final attack will be a green energy wave-type spell that can also hit for a very high amount of damage. Once the boss is back to normal speed, lure it to the east wall again, and repeat the process until it dies. This boss has a 20 Minute Kill Timer.

name: Malvaroth
notes: To summon this miniboss you must use 10 Bloodstained Scythe on the Sacrificial Altar found here.
behaviour: Malvaroth attacks in melee range. Malvaroth never retreats.

name: Mamma Longlegs
notes: Spawn cannot be blocked. Part of the Spider Nest Mini World Change. After having killed it three times, you will not be able to enter the area anymore.Kill it three times for the achievement Nestling.
abilities: Melee (0-400+ and starting up to 16 hp/turn)
behaviour: Similar to a Hydra but with weaker healing.
strategy:
All depends on your level. If you are a high level you can just run around and combo rod/wand with exori mort or just using Sudden Death. If you are a lower level the best thing to defeat this boss is using Fire Field and run around it while attacking. Another alternative is to use Fire Wall and move across the middle square causing Mamma to run around the top or bottom of the wall, this is the most effective way to kill her at low levels
Paladins may want to use a shield, and Assassin Stars to kill it fast.

name: Man in the Cave
notes: The 3-4 monks he spawns with are not summoned, so be careful. When this creature is spawned, you may notice that there are far more Ice Golems than usual in the cave below him. You may be roped up the moment you step on the square below the hole in his room. You must walk around here if you want to get roped. Once roped a message will appear: You have been roped up!. The Man in the Cave was started from a post on the Tibia Forums in August 2006 by a player on Luminera named Frack'Heart (now deleted). Apparently Frack'Heart was complaining about a player in the Kazordoon Dwarf Mines who was roping creatures. His English skills were far from advanced, therefore the post was hard to understand. He is also the only creature known to drop the Fur Cap. See also: C.G.B.  Top Secret
behaviour: Runs in low health.
strategy: Kill him fast. He is a lot weaker than his summons.

name: Marziel
notes: Marziel was once a normal person and a citizen of Carlin. He, his brothers Arthei, Lersatio, and Boreth, and Arthei's wife Kala, travelled to Yalahar in order to find a new home. From that moment on Marziel started keeping a diary. From the first part of this diary it becomes clear that he used to have a girlfriend named Melava.He is the third boss you will encounter during the Blood Brothers Quest. To access the boss' room, a female character needs to walk in front of the big throne with a vampire lord on it and then throw blood on the carpet. Two Vampire Brides will appear, after killing one you are teleported to the boss room. If you are fast enough going back to the room where you killed the Vampire Bride, you can loot the body. Also, if you manage to kill both Vampire Brides at the same time the loot from both will appear in server log, but when you return to the room there will be only one body.You will receive The Dust of Marziel when you use a Blessed Wooden Stake on his dead body.
location: Vengoth Castle in the Third Tower that can be accessed.
behaviour: Goes invisible often, sometimes turns into a bat and fights until death.
strategy: Unknown

name: Massacre
notes: Massacre is the boss of the Juggernauts. He was summoned by a Customer Support member on the Christmas Test Server 2007.
location: Spawns in Apocalypse's throne room, in the Pits of Inferno.
behaviour: Same as Juggernaut.
strategy: Since he's just an edit of a Juggernaut treat him almost the same. As he is weak to Energy, Sorcerers should use Great Energy Beam, Energy Wave or Rage of the Skies, and of course Sudden Death Runes. Paladins should use Assassin Stars. At least level 150 Knight with skills 80/90 or higher and as good equipment as possible is advised for a blocker. Alternatively, a Paladin with level 200 or higher. It's better to take a couple of Druids for sio with them because Massacre deals hard combos.

name: Maw
notes:
One of the Hive Bosses
Part of the War Against the Hive Quest
behaviour: Keeps distance while shooting low amounts of damage and healing himself.
strategy: Separate him from other monsters and treat him as weak Hive Overseer without summons.

name: Mawhawk
notes: When summoning Guzzlemaws, Mawhawk says "Watch my maws!". When it says "Better flee now!", it will cast his Ultimate Explosion in 5 seconds. You can find the loot of this creature in a Reward Container. Starting at server save, there is a chance of Mawhawk spawning every 10 minutes. For example, if Mawhawk spawned at 12:03:55, as long as he was killed within 10 minutes, the next chance of him spawning will be at 12:13:55.
abilities: Ultimate Explosion (announced when in very low health) (1500-1700)
location: Mawhawk's Lair, east part of the Guzzlemaw Valley, ramp to his lair appears as a world change.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Maxxenius
notes: It's one of the bosses of The Dream Courts Quest.
behaviour: It does not retarget very often, but will frequently transform its target on an Energy Elemental. It uses its Energy Beam and Wave very often, frequently on the same turn, which may result in a high combo.
strategy: Players should wear energy protection against this boss. There are two key points to be aware of when fighting Maxxenius: 1. Maxxenius is healed by Energy Damage, so this element shouldn't be used by players. Furthermore, there are Generators that constantly use an Energy spell around them, and the outer tiles of the room will also pulsate with an energy spell. Thus, Maxxenius must be blocked away from these fields. The north-west area of the room is ideal for that, but i can also be done on the east side of the room. 2. During the fight, Maxxenius will frequently transform its target in an Energy Elemental. About 10 seconds after the transformation, the player will "explode" dealing 1000-1500 energy damage around him (2 fields radius). Thus, in order to avoid healing the boss, this player should move away from it. This can be done easily if there are 2 Knights and the one that isn't transformed Challenges Maxxenius so the other one can run away. In case no second Knight is available, the same result can also be achieved but the players will have to force Maxxenius to change target without using Challenge.

name: Mazoran
notes: He is the minion of Infernatil.
location: Grounds of Fire, a Ferumbras' Ascension Quest area.
behaviour: It fights in close range and does not retarget often. Mazoran never retreats.
strategy: This boss is one of the easiest of its peers. The main danger when facing Mazoran is the floor, which will become Lava that deals 1500 Fire Damage every minute or so. Thus, the safest strategy for the team is to position in one of the sides of the room and avoid moving. During the fight, Rages of Mazoran will also spawn when the floor becomes lava - they can be easily killed with Ice area attacks.

name: Mazzinor
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Go to the Earth Section and downstairs here (south of the Biting Books), then walk north to find a teleport. Enter it and pull the Ostentatious Bookstand once your team is ready for the fight. You will have 17 minutes to finish the fight. The Secret Library Quest - Mazzinor Together with this boss there will be several Wild Knowledges . Once you kill them, they will become a blue vortex. Every few rounds, Mazzinor will become Supercharged Mazzinor, which is invincible. After 8 seconds, the room will be hit by several simultaneous energy explosions with different center points around the room. This will cover all squares in the room and deal up to 13,000+ Energy Damage, depending on where you are standing. The closer to the center of the room players are, the higher the damage taken as they will be hit by more explosions. This damage, however, can be avoided entirely if players step on the existing vortexes to gain the form of a Knowledge Elemental . Note that this form also lasts 8 seconds, so it is recommended that you wait at least 2 seconds after the boss transformation to step on the vortex, guaranteeing your new form will last long enough. Players can only renew the form after it runs out, so if you transform too soon you will be susceptible to the explosions. Repeat this process until the boss is dead. This fight can go bad very easily if the team starts taking the explosions. A possible strategy is having the blocker stay with Mazzinor near the center of the room, and the shooters spread around them. Everyone should attack with Stone Shower Runes, hitting multiple Wild Knowledges and creating many vortexes. Furthermore, everyone should always choose a vortex to step on as soon as possible and stand next to it, preferably communicating this to the team. Communication is extremely important to avoid taking vortexes that other players were planning to use, causing chaos and possibly deaths. Other tips:

name: Megasylvan Yselda
notes:
She's a metamorphing form of Yselda, betrothed of Kesar the Younger and future Queen of Bounac.
Part of the Adventures of Galthen Quest.
location: In the Forest of Life through the Sleeping Carnisylvan here.
behaviour: She does not move. Megasylvan Yselda never retreats.
strategy: To make Megasylvan Yselda vulnerable to attacks, say the words DEMIHBOULDR SOMMBHA WITHER. This will weaken her defenses, allowing you to deal damage. Additionally, to complete the Adventures of Galthen Quest - Galthen and the Lost Queen, you must heal the four Megasylvan Saplings, which are located in each corner of the boss room. You can do this by using Ultimate Healing Runes or by having a Druid cast Mass Healing on them. This step is required in order to receive the  Violet Tulip. However, if your team deals enough damage quickly, the Saplings initial health may be sufficient for them to survive without healing, as long as Megasylvan Yselda is defeated fast enough.

name: Melting Frozen Horror
notes:
Also appears in a immortal form as the Solid Frozen Horror.
Part of the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
behaviour: A melting frozen horror attacks in melee range.
strategy: For this fight you will need a knight level 150+, a paladin level 120+, a druid level 130+ and two sorcerers 160+. Whence coming inside the boss room you will notice two Icicles and a Dragon Egg between them. Shot Magic Walls in front of these pillars, let the sorcerers use their strongest fire attacks on the Dragon Egg to get it to full HP. When reaching full HP, you can start SD'ing the boss. Keep the boss away from the egg, and keep the Frozen Minions away from the boss, as their attacks as well as all Ice Damage heals it. Continue with this strategy untill the boss is dead.

name: Mephiles
notes: It's the third floor boss. Use his body to get a random reward before you use the body of Evil Mastermind, otherwise you may not get any item. Is an allusion to the demon Mephistopheles that appears in literature as a stock character version of the Devil.
behaviour: He will attack at a certain distance. Therefore, if you approach him, he will run away.Attacks from a distance.
strategy: Corner him and kill it fast.

name: Merikh the Slaughterer
notes:
Try to stay away unless you want to be surrounded by his summons. Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest. 
Note: The mission rewards are given before facing this boss, but he must be fought before you can re-take the task.
location: Magician Quarter (Yalahar), past the teleport on the top floor, which is located here.
behaviour: Fights in close combat. Merikh the Slaughterer never retreats.
strategy: The biggest problem to fight this boss is reaching his location, as the upper floor of the djinn tower is FULL of efreets, with their summons, they can bring down a level 80 knight in a strong combo if all are lured to the stairs, bring the best potions you can drink and heal whenever your hp gets lower than 800, Elven Amulet is STRONGLY recommended to go up this last floor (although the efreets will deplete it within 5 seconds average), might ring can be useful for lower level vocations, it's not recommended to go up the last floor for levels below 80. You can consider this boss as a stronger Efreet with a lot of hitpoints. Any vocation should kill him quickly before his summons increase total damage. Paladins should run and use Assassin Stars. Mages should simply attack him with SD's and/or Ice Strike. Knights: Since moving is not necessary while fighting him, you bring a strong two handed weapon and wear a Sword, Axe, or Club Ring while fighting him and wear your Dwarven Ring later. Also, bring along some mana potions to attack him with berserk, heal if your hp gets below 500, and 800 if he has both summons.

name: Mindmasher (Weak)
notes: They are copied of the regular version, Mindmasher.
strategy: They are weak, just focus on their master.

name: Mindmasher
notes:
One of the Hive Bosses
Part of the War Against the Hive Quest
abilities: makes you drown for some time
summons four weak copies of himself
behaviour: Summons copies of himself to attack with. Both him and his summons can go invisible. Its summons are extremely weak to physical damage.
strategy: Separate from other monsters and simply take him down, he's not too strong.

name: Minion of Skyrr
notes: Appeared during the Tibia's 15th Anniversary, as a summon of Skyrr (Creature).
location: In the Raider Camp mountains here.
behaviour: Attacks players.Minion of Skyrr attacks in melee range. Minion of Skyrr never retreats.
strategy: Kill its master quickly! Tibia's 15th Anniversary! 13 Skyrr! Fight against Skyrr

name: Minor Timedisplaced Anomaly (Ankrahmun)
notes: It's one of the bosses which awards Theons as part of Tibia's 25th Anniversary. The combined Loot Statistics of this boss and the other two with the same name can be seen here.
behaviour: A minor timedisplaced anomaly never retreats.

name: Minor Timedisplaced Anomaly (Greenshore)
notes: It's one of the bosses which awards Theons as part of Tibia's 25th Anniversary. The combined Loot Statistics of this boss and the other two with the same name can be seen here.
behaviour: A minor timedisplaced anomaly never retreats.

name: Minor Timedisplaced Anomaly (Rookgaard)
notes: It's one of the bosses which awards Theons as part of Tibia's 25th Anniversary. The combined Loot Statistics of this boss and the other two with the same name can be seen here.
behaviour: A minor timedisplaced anomaly never retreats.

name: Mirade (Creature)
notes:
Appeared during Tibia's 15th and 20th Anniversary celebrations as well as on January 7 and 8, 2018 (unintended), in a raid at a random time once a day.
The following message will appear:
A troll is happily trolling the Orc Fortress - somebody call the CMs!
Then, 20 minutes later she will spawn:
Mirade and Rejana have assumed control of the Orc Fortress!
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Mitmah Vanguard
notes: Defeating the boss for the first time will grant you the achievement Museum Goer, as well as the second addon for the Ancient Aucar Outfits.
behaviour: The boss teleports and casts energy UE for up to 6k energy damage while the arena shields are up, it also casts a full-screen root, immobilizing all within the vicinity. Additionally it can break through magical defenses such as magic walls and wild growths.Mitmah Vanguard attacks in melee range.
strategy: Keep at a distance - Energy UE when close

name: Monstor
notes: It's the fifth floor boss. Use his body to get a random reward before you use the body of Evil Mastermind, otherwise you may not get any item.  Probably an allusion to The Incredible Hulk.
behaviour: Attacks in melee range. Monstor? never retreats.
strategy: The stairs that goes up can be used so you get hit only by 2 monsters, try to trap yourself there with 2 gargoyles and shoot monstor with distance attacks.

name: Mooh'Tah Master
notes: You must survive the Mooh'Tah Master for two minutes during a missing in The New Frontier Quest. He can't be killed, and you can't leave the arena before the time of 2 minutes.
location: Zao, in a small enclosed arena at the center of the orc camp.
behaviour: Cannot be killed. Attacks until you leave or die.
strategy: Never stand in front of it, always be at an angle and at least 2 sqm away from it. Very easy to survive for 2 minutes, all vocations just run from it and use Light Healing when you get paralyzed. You can do the mission at as low level as 50. If you are a mage it's a good idea to use magic shield because of the energy beam. All vocations should walk big rounds in the arena because it's not so fast.

name: Moohtant Wallbreaker
notes: Moohtant Wallbreakers are bred to become living siege weapons. They are an unstoppable force and will destroy anything in their paths. They are sent to breach the Underground Glooth Factory Plant, and will do so unchallenged. The Moohtant Wallbreaker will walk directly west until he reaches the plant. He will push all players in his way backward, walk over all fields, magic walls and wild growth trees. He will stand on his allies if he must, although they surprisingly get out unharmed.
location: Oramond Underground Glooth Factory, second floor, east side during a raid.
behaviour: It fights in close combat. A moohtant wallbreaker never retreats.
strategy: The Moohtant Wallbreaker is the boss of the minotaur raids. The objective of the raid is to kill it before it reaches the Plant wall. If it does, it will explode and the wall will be destroyed, damaging players standing near it for 1000 hitpoints. It moves at a rate of about 1 tile per 10 seconds, which gives about 50 minutes(?) to kill the Wallbreaker. Focus all of your firepower on it before it's too late!

name: Morgaroth
notes: Morgaroth, the schemer, is an Archdemon and also a member of the Triangle of Terror. Morgaroth was first sighted on Arcania on August 07, 2006. It was first killed on Aldora and Titania on September 6, 2006. When it appears, all players on the world receive 3 messages that are broadcasted exactly 6 minutes apart. Morgaroth spawns when the last message appears, exactly 12 minutes after the first message.
abilities: Exori Debuff (Reduces Distance by 50-90% for 7 seconds) Morgaroth
Strike Debuff (Reduces Melee and Shielding by 70-100% for 3 seconds) Morgaroth
behaviour: Morgaroth will retreat at 2500  (4.55%, red) health.

name: Morguthis
notes: Morguthis, Arkhotep's general, was sentenced to be locked away after his part in the conspiracies against the pharaoh. He is guarded by 8 Shredderthrowers. One of the Pharaohs of The Ancient Tombs Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-680 and starting up to 4 hp/turn)
Bloodrage (Increases melee by 50-70% for 5 seconds) Morguthis
behaviour: Malicious; will make all efforts to destroy intruders.Attacks in melee range.
strategy: He will melee with anyone in close proximity, this allows distance attackers better chances to defeat him quickly.

name: Morik the Gladiator
notes: Spawns when using the armor decoration in Morik's room. Part of the In Service of Yalahar Quest.
abilities: Party Buffs Wave (increase all your or monsters melee skills for some seconds)
location: The Arena Quarter. Arena second floor east area, here.
behaviour: Same as a Gladiator. Runs at very Low Health.
strategy:
Shoot from the door so you can only get hit by 2 monsters. Recommended to wear a Protection Amulet to lower the physical damage he inflicts.
Knight: Can easily kill him with lvl 40 and skills 65/65. Bring your best weapon and shield, as Morik hits quite hard, it's best to fight him in balance as he tends to hit for quite some damage, exori whenever he summons a gladiator to hit both at the same time, DO NOT LET HIM HAVE 2 SUMMONS!!! 2 summons will break your shielding quite easily and Morik will hit you for major damage, make sure to bring him down fast or you will waste many potions.

name: Mornenion
notes: Part of the Bank Robbery Mini World Change. Mornenion is the thief that robs the Venore bank.
abilities: Distance Arrows (similar to an Elf Scout ) (0-40)
behaviour: Behaves like an Elf Scout.
strategy: Same as with an Elf Scout.

name: Morshabaal
