abilities: Ice Chain "Increases per player hit" (4,000 - 30,000+) Morshabaal
location: Morshabaal appears inside a teleporter that spawns at the stone circle in the northwest of Edron, here. Only characters of level 150 or higher can enter.
behaviour: Morshabaal will retreat at very low health.Morshabaal attacks in melee range.
strategy: Morshabaal has 3 stages with increasing strength: It will always have a counter next to its name: The stronger forms of Morshabaal take less damage and do more Damage Reflection, so the team must always focus on keeping it in the regular Morshabaal stage. Even though it is still possible to deal damage to it in the enraged form, it will not be very efficient. When it is in Furious stage, it will take very little damage and reflect a lot more of it, so teams should avoid reaching this stage as it is both dangerous and expensive to fight it. While being targeted, the blockers will slowly build up a counter next to their name as well. When this counter reaches 20, the character will take more damage and Morshabaal will heal more through Lifesteal. The counter can be decreased by letting another blocker be the target. The common strategy for killing Morshabaal is the following: The blockers (preferably 3 level 600+ Elite Knights) bring Morshabaal to the north-east corner of the room and trap it next to one of the pillars. All shooters must stack diagonally near the eastern wall between two pillars. Players should only attack when the counter is above 5 and stop before it changes to the red symbol. The blockers should keep switching positions and taking turns at blocking it so that all knights can reduce their counters. Keep repeating the process of attacking and waiting to slowly reduce Morshabaal's health until it is defeated. There are several key factors that must be taken into account during the fight:

name: Mounted Thorn Knight
notes: This is one of the bosses in the Forgotten Knowledge Quest. It looks like a Crystal Warlord mounted on a Flamesteed. It is one form of the Thorn Knight.
location: A dungeon here, accessible through the Desecrated Glade.
behaviour: They can destroy a Possessed Tree (2500 hp) with one hit.
strategy: Do not use Death Damage against it otherwise it will heal 10 times the damage it was supposed to receive.

name: Mozradek
notes: It's one of the bosses of Kilmaresh Quest.
location: In a small cave north of Issavi here
behaviour: Mozradek never retreats.
strategy: Use Ice Damage and avoid its waves.

name: Mr. Punish
notes: Mr. Punish has first been sighted and killed on Solera, Dec 26th 2006.  He is the boss of the Dark Torturers.
location: Pits of Inferno in Tafariel's Throne room.
behaviour: Runs in very low health.
strategy: Block him with Magic Wall or Wild Growth Runes to trap it because he is very fast. You need one good blocker only. The shooters must shoot Sudden Death Runes or Death Strike.

name: Munster
notes: It is a Rat Boss that is generally made for lower levels to kill. Looks like a regular Cave Rat. Spawns with 2 Rats and 3 Cave Rats.
location: Rookgaard, Free Account Main Rat Caves, on the second floor.
behaviour: Munster runs when seriously injured also moves object that are in his way. If a weak creature is blocking its path, Munster will kill it in order to reach target.
strategy: Kill the summoned Rats, then proceed to kill Munster.

name: Murcion
notes: One of the bosses in the Rotten Blood Quest.
strategy: Murcion is the twin of Ichgahal, and both share similarities. It has three main challenges that players must face during the whole fight: This is one of the harder fights due to the small room, which leaves very little place to run around. The common strategy is to have the Paladin immediately grab the target from Murcion, then run around in a circle as wide as possible. The movement flow is very important, because if the Paladin moves too fast they will complete a whole lap before the mould tracks have disappeared, but if they move too slow the boss will end up healing from standing on its track. Paladins should also avoid diagonal steps as much as possible, since Murcion constantly uses its Paralyse spell, and this could cause the boss to stand still for too long and end up healing. All shooters should avoid getting close to the boss to avoid drawing its target. If the boss switches target to any shooter, they should immediately run on the same direction that Paladin was moving towards, to keep Murcion moving on the correct direction. Failing to react quickly will cause the boss to stand on its mould tracks and heal. Lower level teams can not afford to have the boss heal this way multiple times, or they will run out of time to kill the boss. The Knight should Challenge the Elder Bloodjaws as soon as they spawn, and run around the room in the same direction as the Paladin, but falling behind around half a lap, so that they are always at the opposite side of the room. Knights should try to step near the Mushrooms when running their lap, to help clear the path for the Paladin's next lap. The clearer the path is for the Paladin, the easier it will be to keep the movement flow of Murcion. However, a balance should also be found, because the boss has a limit to how many Mushrooms can be active at the same time, and leaving a few behind might be desirable to avoid situations where the boss summons enough mushrooms to trap itself in them, causing it to stand still and significantly heal multiple times in a very short period.

name: Mutated Zalamon
notes:
Introduced in Summer Update 2010.
Part of the Wrath of the Emperor Quest.
abilities: Shapeshifting (Turns  into; Serpent Spawn or Lizard Snakecharmer or Draken Abomination )
Shapeshifting (Turns  into; Snake God Essence or Lizard Abomination )
location: East of Zao and south of Dragonblaze Peaks, two floors below Zalamon.
behaviour: Fight until death.
strategy: Trap him as fast as you can, knights will have to use challenge a lot since he tends to switch very often. Fire and Energy Bombs will be helpful here.

name: Necropharus
notes: Is the Necromancer's boss, and looks the same as a Necromancer.
abilities: Melee (0-102 and starting up to 5 hp/turn)
location: Halls of Sacrifice (task boss, teleporter located here), Lich Hell (room with Vampires), Medusa Shield Quest room, Hero Cave Grim Reapers, Oasis Tomb (here).
behaviour: Necropharus fights until death.Attacks from a distance.

name: Neferi the Spy
notes: It's one of the minibosses of Kilmaresh Quest, Wanted mission.
location: Through a teleport located near Issavi's boat, here.
behaviour: Neferi the Spy never retreats.

name: Obujos
notes: Obujos, Defensor Profundis, is one of the three depth lords. Reachable in third stage of Liquid Black Quest. He is the second strongest deepling boss. See also: Obujos/Treasure Statistics
abilities: Melee (0-1200 and starting up to 18 hp/turn)
behaviour: He walks on all kinds of fields, he has strong ice beam/wave. Obujos will retreat at 1 to 1399 (0% - 4%, deep red) health.
strategy: Trap him in narrow path in south part of his arena and block him with Wild Growth to avoid retarget. Don't let him walk around, because he may recover his health quickly. Bronze Amulet is highly recommended as Obujos does mana drain attack about every second turn. Druids should use their strongest ice spells because this boss is weak on ice.

name: Ocyakao
abilities: Death Life Drain Ball around itself (40-100?) Ocyakao
Freezin Explosion Ball around itself ( Freezes you) (0-10?) Ocyakao
behaviour: Fights until death, follows you. Damaging him makes him say "Grrrr! Kisavuta!" and triggers his AoE life drain attack.Attacks in melee range.
strategy: Spawns together with large group of other Chakoyas. There are 5 waves in total, each 5 seconds apart. The first 4 waves contain Chakoyas, and on the 5th wave Ocyakao spawns (20 seconds after the first wave). It is advisable to use Thunderstorm Runes to get rid of his minions, or invisibility to hide from them. Comparable to an Orc Leader.

name: Omrafir
notes: Omrafir heals continuously. These heals are strengthened when he steps on a fire field as well as when he takes any fire damage ex:Great  fireball,flame strike,fireball rune, saying "Omrafir gains new strength from the fire". Omrafir casts a very strong fire beam a few seconds after saying "OMRAFIR INHALES DEEPLY!". When Omrafir drops to about 50% of health, the server will continuously check whether Flame of Omrafir have been killed or not. If any flames have been killed, Omrafir will despawn and 9 Hellfire Fighters will appear all over the room. Once all Hellfire Fighters have been killed Omrafir respawns in the center of the room. However, this scenario will not happen more than three times. Omrafir uses the new reward system.
behaviour: Omrafir chases his target and fights in close combat. He seems to attack his targets persistently, moving diagonally through summons that obstruct him. He summons Flames of Omrafir immediately when others are slain. A omrafir never retreats.
strategy:
There are two ways of succeeding in the killing of Omrafir.First of all you have to trap Omrafir in a corner using Wild Growth Runes or Magic Wall Runes and make sure you do not stand in the range of his strong fire beam as it has been confirmed to hit a high level mage for close to 13k dmg with mana shield. Then you can choose between these two ways of killing:Short: Once he is trapped kill him using single-target attacks such as Ice Strike, Icicle Runes or Sudden Death Runes and make sure you do not kill a single flame. If you managed not to kill a single flame he will fight until death without exploding.
Long: Once he is trapped attack him using the spells and runes you would like. This time you do not have to pay attention to his flames. Keep attacking him until he exploded a total of three times and then kill him as he will not explode a fourth time no matter if you kill his flames again or not.
NOTE: Apparently he always explodes in the last hit (one time at least).

name: Omruc
notes: Omruc was sentenced to be locked away, after his part in the conspiracies against the pharaoh, Arkhotep. One of the Pharaohs of The Ancient Tombs Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-116+ and starting up to 3 hp/turn)
behaviour: Malicious, will make all efforts to destroy intruders.
strategy: He keeps distance from players and attacks with distance weapons. Make sure to GFB the stalkers every now and then, because they will heavily break your shielding. Firebombing him may also prove useful, as he will unlikely change his position and mages will know where to aim runes when he becomes invisible. He is guarded by 2 stalkers, 6 magicthrowers and 6 shredderthrowers.

name: Oodok Witchmaster
abilities: Poison Storm around itself (20-40?) Oodok Witchmaster
behaviour: Similar to a Dworc Voodoomaster.
strategy: Unknown

name: Orger Treasure
behaviour: Immobile, creature doesn't move.
strategy: Kill it.

name: Orshabaal
notes:
It's a Demon Lord - lesser of the Demon Overlord (which are yet to plague Tibia) but still dangerous.
Whenever you think the world is safe and all the monsters have been killed, when you least expect it, Orshabaal surfaces. It is a Demon Lord who normally hides very deep down in the depths of The Edron Hero Cave.
Its magical and physical powers are overwhelming! Many brave heroes have fallen by the great fireball and energy beam it utilizes. To make matters worse, it flees when it reaches red health, and if the adventurers are not fast enough in killing it, Orshabaal's vile healing magic will allow it to return to the fray. Whenever it chooses to raid a world it won't come alone, it brings a lot of Demons as company to help spread death and disaster. Even though Orshabaal has since lost his title of strongest monster, he remains the most infamous, due to his spawn location on the surface (the Triangle of Terror hide deep below the surface, and Ferumbras sits at the very top of his citadel). You are able to use Blessed Wooden Stake on his corpse as well as on all his summoned demon's corpses, in order to get Demon Dust. Sometimes Orshabaal gets trapped by his own Demons because he doesn't kill his summons like Scarabs kill Larvas. Orshabaal was first sighted on Pacera, Aug 26th 2005.
He was first killed on Titania, Sept 11th 2005. To all players on the world it appears, 3 messages are broadcasted in white text.
abilities: Debuff (Reduces Distance by 50-90% for 6 seconds) Orshabaal
location: North of Edron near the Dragon Lair in the stone circle (here).
behaviour: Attacks in melee range. Orshabaal will retreat at 2500  (11.11%, red) health.
strategy:
Nowadays, Orshabaal will most likely die in a few seconds because of the high number of players who will be waiting for it. In such cases, the best strategy is try to position yourself around its spawn location and attack it as soon as possible when it appears. If the server is new, or if there are few players online, you may use the strategy that was for a long time the only way to kill this once-fearsome boss. Lure it to the famous spot near the entrance of Cyclopolis. When it is at red health, shoot Magic Walls so it cannot run away. The blocker should party mode with the shooters and get the loot as soon as possible after killing it.
Since it is likely the blocker will not be able to heal quickly enough when Orshabaal performs a strong combo, it is advised to have at least a few mages using Ultimate Healing or Exura Sio on the blocker. A good strategy is luring Orshabaal into a place that you can block only him between 2 trees, or in a corridor where 1-2 Demons limit its movement, helping avoid the line-of-sight attacks. Also its possible to use a medium level char (or a low level) as bait to lure him in a place where he will get trapped by his summons, after that people can easily shoot and Orshabaal will not move until its near death. Also, keep in mind that when the blocker is blocking Orshabaal, it will still tend to use Great Fireball and Great Energy Beam, so you may want to stand diagonally and far away from it to avoid these attacks or you may experience a quick death.

name: Outburst
notes: A boss in the Heart of Destruction Quest.
behaviour: He will transform into Charging Outburst after taking some damage. This will occur a few times. A outburst never retreats.
strategy: Trap him and kill him.

name: Owin (Creature)
notes: You might encounter Owin like this when it is full moon on Grimvale.
abilities: Red Sparkles Bomb (Reduces Melee and Distance ) Owin
location: Grimvale, during Full Moon (12th-14th of each month), here.
behaviour: Fights like a Wereboar.
strategy: Face it like a stronger Wereboar.

name: Paiz the Pauperizer
notes: He's the Draken's boss. Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
abilities: Poison Spit (poisons you up to 20 hp/turn)
location: Razachai, behind the teleport located here (access gained during Wrath of the Emperor Quest - Mission 08: Uninvited Guests).
behaviour: Chases you quickly and fights until death.
strategy: First of all, try to stay diagonal at all times, as his wave is very strong. Mages should use ice-based spells, while Paladins can use Sharpshooter,Assassin Stars and Ethereal Spear. It's a hard creature for Knights, and one should use a weapon combined with Berserk based spells all the time to kill it fast.

name: Penciljack (Creature)
notes:
Appeared during Tibia's 15th and 20th Anniversary celebrations, in a raid at a random time once a day.
The following message will appear:
A muse has appeared south of Vengoth castle and creative energy is starting to form.
Then, 20 minutes later he will spawns:
Penciljack is in the house! Try fight him south of Vengoth castle - if you dare.
location: South of Vengoth Castle entrance, here.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown. Tibia's 15th Anniversary! 10 Penciljack! Video showing an encounter with Penciljack.

name: Phrodomo
notes: One of its speeches, Mors Certa, Hora Certa, is Latin for Death is certain, this hour surely.All players who sufficiently damage it during the last minute of the fight will receive the Slayer of Phrodomo achievement.
location: Ghostlands, behind the portal here, during the Rise of Devovorga World Quest. Can be fought on Vengoth during Devovorga's Essence Mini World Change.
behaviour: Phrodomo attacks the enemy with his strong melee until death.
strategy: Physical resistant equipment such as Stone Skin Amulets and Might Rings are a good choice to bring along. It is a good idea to use Magic Walls or Wild Growth runes to trap it. Fire attacks work well so using Firebombs and summoning Fire Elementals can also help a lot. Smaller teams can expect a wait as this creature has a lot of health. Knights can try to block it at level 170 or higher.

name: Plagirath
notes: He's the minion of Verminor.
location: Grounds of Plague, a Ferumbras' Ascension Quest area.
behaviour: It will retarget somewhat often. Plagirath never retreats.
strategy: Do not run to the center of its room to avoid luring too many Disgusting Oozes. The blocker should try to trap it near a wall while the shooters stay distant to avoid the area damage. During the fight, it's recommended to avoid running around since the Disgusting Oozes use a very strong paralyze spell and will constantly spawn around the room. All shooters should attack mainly with Great Fireball Runes in order to kill the summons around the blocker. During the fight, Plagirath will sometimes transform its target into a Bog Raider. When this transformation runs out after about 10 seconds, the transformed player will "explode" receiving 1500 damage and that will also hit the players around him. Since running around the room is not recommended, shooters should stay distant from the blocker and when the transformation happens everyone should make sure they have enough mana and health to take the explosion. Note that once Plagirath dies, the Disgusting Oozes will not disappear, so leaving the boss room must also be done carefully and in an organized manner. Killing the boss near the exit will make this last step safer.

name: Plagueroot
notes: It's one of the bosses of The Dream Courts Quest.
behaviour: From time to time it will teleport itself to a different place in the room.
strategy: Avoid standing right in front of it. To make the battle easier, do not allow the Plant Attendants to become Plant Abominations. Earth Damage heals the boss, so shouldn't be used against it.

name: Planestrider
notes: It looks like a cyborg face. When its health gets below 80%, it loses its nose and looks like this: It's a boss of the Opticording Sphere Quest.
abilities: Summons (1-3 Lost Ghost Of A Planegazer )
behaviour: It doesn't move. Planestrider never retreats.
strategy: Stand at a distance and attack.

name: Preceptor Lazare
notes:
It's a boss of the Order of the Falcon. He is Mentioned in Grey Plague Research (Book).
Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Fights in close combat. Preceptor Lazare never retreats.
strategy: Unknown

name: Prince Drazzak
notes: Five people are required to even enter his room in the first place. Apparently, there is a connection between Prince Drazzak and Variphor. You will receive the achievement Noblesse Obliterated after killing this boss.
abilities: Ultimate Explosion (smaller area) (3000-6000, only affects knights)
Teleports everyone in the room to him
location: Boss pit of Roshamuul Prison (here), a team of 5 players can enter his room with a Golden Prison Key (north switchplates, here).
behaviour: Druid taking 9760 Earth Damage while wearing 30% Earth Protection. Very erratic. At completely random times he will shout "All <VOCATION>S must DIE!" and 5 seconds after that he will cast a large AoE ability dealing massive damage to said vocation(s) and shouts DIE!. When he shouts "GET OVER HERE!", all players in the room are teleported next to him. His retargeting is also rather frequent.
strategy: Prince Drazzak All vocations should wear as much protection against Death Damage as possible (remember that many items can be imbued with Powerful Lich Shroud), followed by protection against the vocation's element (see abilities). The boss is resistant to damage, has a lot of hitpoints and heals a lot; prepare for a long battle (15-25 minutes). The most dangerous parts of the fight are the moments and Prince Drazzak teleports everyone to him, since he usually uses his Death spells immediately after that. Because of this, the whole team should be able to take and/or reduce about 6000 Death Damage. When the Demons spawn (they are not actually summons but regular Demons), quickly pass them to the blocker (but keep an eye on the UE warnings) and kill them, they can be quite a hassle if still alive when the boss teleports the team. Paladins, Sorcerers and Druids should bring the mana recovering dish and cupcake for emergencies, which can happen if the boss teleports the team twice in a short time. Knights: In order to safely block this boss, the should be able to take the Fire UE damage (level 450+ recommended). Even though it can hit quite a lot, with the proper protection it will be safer for the team as a whole if the Knight takes this damage and quickly heal afterwards, which shouldn't be very hard since the spell is announced beforehand. Paladins: The vocation with a greater chance of dying due to the high Death Damage from the boss teleport and the slow mana recovering. Wearing Energy Rings as well as Stone Skin Amulets (40 should be enough) are strongly recommended. Always keep an eye on your Ring duration and Amulet charges and replace them before they run out. When the Demons are summoned they will quickly use up the SSA charges, get rid of them as fast as possible to equip a new one. Mages: Might Rings will greatly reduce the damage taken, 20 should be more than enough for the fight (remember to replace them). Always keep the boss and the blocker on the limit of your game window to make sure you're outside the UE range, which is quite large. Druids should wear Earth Damage protection where Death protection isn't possible in case they take the damage. Bring at least 500 SDs and 500 UMPs - this fight takes a while.

name: Professor Maxxen
notes: It's the final boss of the Hero of Rathleton Quest.
behaviour: Professor Maxxen attacks and chases players until death.Attacks in melee range.
strategy: Treat him as a stronger Walker, however be careful with the explosion mechanics of his room.

name: Pythius the Rotten (Creature)
notes: The Curse starts at 1 and normally stops after 34~ turns, but if he curses you again the 34 turns starts over from the damage it currently did. So the longer he keeps cursing you the higher the damage will get. The damage increases with 20% each turn. In the turn 34 it will look like this 366 then 439. Some people have died getting hits of 1400+ per turn. In the reward room make sure you heal or use mana shield if the damage is higher than your hp and wear any death protection equipments or you might die. Paladins can simply use Cure Curse to remove it. Also: On the floor under some trash there's a Guardian Shield a Spike Sword and a Knight Axe. If you have the skills you could pick them them up while killing Pythius.
abilities: Death Bomb (Summons up to 2 Undead Gladiators )
Cursing Missile (+20% death damage per turn; last 34~ turns; around 2700 total damage)
behaviour: Like a Undead Dragon
strategy:
Open PvP and Optional PvP worlds: should use Fire Bomb or Fire Wall runes and run around it.
Mages: It's immune to energy and death. So even if it looks like an undead dragon don't bother with exori vis. It seems that it doesn't have any resistance or weakness to ice, so your best bet could be exori frigo, icicle or avalanche (will help kill the summons as well). The room you face it in is large enough to run it. So just run it and watch your mana/hp. Another way you can do it is put a couple fire bombs or a fire wall and he will walk around it.
Knight: should use the 2 diagonal fire fields in the center, this will keep Pythius from moving and at the same time you will avoid the waves. Moreover, it is recommended to use a poison bomb at the corner, so that the summoned Undead Gladiator cannot attack you with melee. As a picture has done below. Level 110+ recomended, healing with 1000 HP using GHP. Like this: Knight Level 113 killing Pythius the Rotten Use Fire Field to keep Pythius the Rotten standing at diagonal spot.And use poison bomb to block summoned Undead Gladiator, so that it couldn't come to you. All Vocations: should kill it fast as you can. You need a Golden Mug to reach it. Also one great idea is for every vocation to use might ring or death ring even though it reduces your shielding by -10 it also reduces death damage so there is less chances of catching the curse and its death attacks will not as hurt you much.
Elven Amulet and Stone Skin Amulet are also great ideas. In the treasure room it is recomended to use Koshei's Ancient Amulet or Death Ring or any other death protection equips to not die to curse.
Level 139 EK (Rhysypie Too) killing Pythius the Rotten.

name: Ragiaz
notes: He's the minion of Ashfalor.
location: Grounds of Undeath, a Ferumbras' Ascension Quest area.
behaviour: When you defeat one of his Death Dragon summons before reaching the Bone Capsule stage, it will immediately respawn with the message Ragiaz power revives his minion!.
strategy: After a certain amount of damage, he becomes a Bone Capsule in order to regenerate (20k-50k? hp), so kill the capsule quickly.

name: Raging Mage
notes:
Was introduced in the Summer Update 2011. Spawns after the Energized Raging Mage has been killed.This, however, will not happen until your server has killed 2000 Yielothaxes.
This raid message will appear when he has been killed: Exactly five minutes later the dimensional portal gets closed and this message appears:
behaviour: Fights in close combat. Tries to escape when his health drops to red.

name: Rahemos
notes: Rahemos, a great conjurer, was sentenced to be locked away, after his part in the conspiracies against the pharaoh. He is guarded by a Warlock and a Magicthrower. He spawns even with players in his room. One of the Pharaohs of The Ancient Tombs Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-130 and starting up to 4 hp/turn)
behaviour: Malicious, he will make all efforts to destroy intruders.
strategy: He uses strong magic attacks, so use blockers to run around him and distance fighters to fire on him. Due to his high magic resistance and notable weakness to physical damage, it is highly recommended for mages to use Explosion runes (Druids can combine this with Physical Strike). Higher level knights can easily solo Rahemos with a couple of quick Fierce Berserks, Front Sweeps and an Annihilation spell. A Demon Skeleton can be summoned to draw attention from the Magicthrower as well as deal extra damage to Rahemos.

name: Ratmiral Blackwhiskers
notes: It's the final boss of A Pirate's Tail Quest.
behaviour: Attacks in close range.
strategy: Try to wear Life Drain protection to mitigate damage dealt by Pirat Artillerists. Single-target attacks work well but you may want to use area attacks to kill the Elite Pirats that spawn during the fight, as well as the minibosses that help Ratmiral.

name: Ravenous Hunger
notes:
A popular daily boss due to being the only source of Elven Mail in the game.
Part of the Cults of Tibia Quest.
behaviour: Fights in close combat.Ravenous Hunger attacks in melee range.
strategy: Once it spawns, fill one side of the cave with Fire Bomb Runes and then bring the boss there. This will keep its summons away as long as you do not attack them. Mages should stand far from the boss or to the side to not heal him through his life drain wave.

name: Raxias
notes: It's a Faun micro-boss. You may face it if you shipwreck when taking a shortcut route with captain Charles from Port Hope to another city.
location: On the small island just north of Feyrist.
behaviour: Raxias attacks in melee range.
strategy: Treat it like a slightly stronger Faun. If you are a low level, stay diagonally and use a Dwarven Ring to avoid getting Drunk.

name: Razzagorn
notes: He's the minion of Apocalypse.
location: Grounds of Destruction, a Ferumbras' Ascension Quest area.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: When he summons Eruption of Destructions kill them first, otherwise Razzagorn becomes stronger.

name: Realityquake
notes: A boss in the Heart of Destruction Quest.

name: Rupture
notes: One of the bosses in the Heart of Destruction Quest.
behaviour: A rupture never retreats.
strategy: Every few minutes during the fight, Rupture will summon a Damage Resonance. When he does, immediately stop attacking him and focus on killing the Resonance, since every time he is hit while the Damage Resonance is spawned will cause him to gain several thousand hitpoints back. For this same reason, do not use damage over time effects on him (such as Inflict Wound), since these hits will also cause him to heal.

name: Samael
notes:
Samael managed to switch worlds during a small ritual performed by Eclesius to help his former assistant, Turian, who is now transformed into a frog. While Samael was bewildered right after entering our world, Eclesius managed to lock him up in a cage located under Eclesius' home. Keeping Samael's cage locked and in good shape is needed to "prevent the apocalypse", according to Eclesius who refers to him as a Demon Uberoverlord.
Its name is confirmed by his fellow inmate A Confused Frog who describes Samael as an annoyed Demon Overlord.
It is not possible to see Samael from any known place in Tibia, however it is possible to hear his screams from outside his cellar, from this cave in Thais sewers and from Thais prison.
Although some players believe it might be possible to reach and face Samael, there is no sustainable evidence that points the devs ever intended to make it possible for players to reach Samael.
location: In a cellar under Eclesius' home, here.
behaviour: Unknown.

name: Scarlett Etzel
notes: She is the leader of the Order of the Cobra and sister of Oberon and Kesar Etzel.
abilities: Poison Ultimate Explosion when damaged in the locked state (7500) Scarlett Etzel
behaviour: Scarlett Etzel attacks in melee range. Scarlett Etzel never retreats.
strategy: Scarlett is initially immortal. In order to maker her vulnerable, you have to use the Galthen's Chestplate which appears on a trophy stand near the throne. When you do that, Scarlett will stop moving and become vulnerable for 8 seconds. There is a faster way to dealing damage to her, however: Scarlett will take 7500 damage if she's attacked while the four mirrors around her are facing her. Note that she will also use her Ultimate Poison Explosion at the same time, dealing 7500 Earth Damage to the players around. Only one player should attack her, however, since she will instantly become invulnerable and attacking Scarlett Etzel when she is not vulnerable will heal her in 5000 hitpoints. Thus, the recommended step by step for beginners is:

name: Sir Valorcrest
notes: Spawns with 0-4 Vampires, you will notice FAR more vampires close to the stairs than usual at the Vampire cave when this creature spawns. You can use a blessed wooden stake on his corpse in order to get Vampire Dust.
behaviour: Summon as many Vampires as he can and tries to kill his enemy with strong melee attacks and makes you drunk. He fights to the death and doesn't run away in low health - This could be because of the fact that he seems to be a Knight Vampire due to his high melee damage, name, and honorable fighting style (Fights to the death).
strategy:
Knights: It IS possible to solo this creature for a knight of level 80+ (it's still not recommended, however) using defensive fighting, Great Health Potions and Exori, just take around 150-200 Great Health Potion and about 50-80 Mana Potions to do this, because killing him is expensive so do this only if you REALLY want to kill him, in order to do this lure him to the stairs, then make sure he's at melee range and attack him with your best weapon and use Exori as often as you can to deal damage to him and get rid of the Vampires surrounding you, as damage will decrease once you kill the Vampires that regularly spawn in the cave as you will only have to fight his summons. It's best to make them run away, as they won't respawn and you can focus on fighting Sir Valorcrest, just keep using Great Health Potions as often as you can, whether you need them or not, as a strong combo can give you a free trip to the Temple. If your health goes below 200 it's recommended to go upstairs to heal and then go back.
Mages should have a blocker and shoot with fire spells, but other elements work too.
Paladins: Same strategy as mage, blocker and shoot with bolts/Enchanted Spears while using Divine Missile. 
Higher Level Knight can block it (100+) while a Paladin/Mage quickly kill it.

name: Tanjis
notes: Tanjis, Expeditus Profundis, is one of the three depth lords. He is the most harmless but most frequently appearing of the deepling guardians. Access to his lair is earned by helping to repair the ramp to the Ancestral Grounds, during the Liquid Black Quest. Teams may enter each guardian's lair once for each time they make a sufficient attempt to repair the ramp to the Ancestral Grounds. However, access to any further guardians is revoked if players open any treasure chest outside of their lairs. Tanjis spawns each 3-10 minutes depending on players online, and cannot be blocked from spawning (same as the inquisition bosses, pharaohs and the black knight). Teams can stay in Tanjis' room for 20 minutes, the timer starting when they enter the teleport. Reentry is denied after players gain experience from Tanjis. Thus, teams can earn a few minutes by jumping out and in Tanjis' lair when the first Tanjis is on his last hitpoints. Tanjis always drops exactly one item: Depth Ocrea, Ornate Mace, or Ornate Shield. Players who receive experience from killing Tanjis will be able to open the treasure chest outside of his lair, to receive Trophy of Tanjis, 20 Platinum Coins, Necklace of the Deep, Warrior's Shield and either Tanjis' Sight or 10 Black Pearls.  See also: Tanjis/Treasure Statistics
abilities: Self Healing about once per turn (0-1000+)
location: Fiehonja Ancestral Grounds, eastern pit (teleport here).
behaviour: Tanjis will target the player hitting him for the most damage. Typically, this is a high level Paladin. He will not retarget to a player blocking his path.Attacks in melee range.
strategy: Tanjis' lair with his spawn location marked. Trapping Tanjis can be difficult. Because of his retargeting behavior, the shooters are advised to stand away from Tanjis while the blocker lures and traps him. The environment makes trapping him difficult also, knights will almost always be forced to stand in waves/beams because Wild Growth will not last long enough. Once trapped, it's a battle against his healing. Tanjis will attack shooters very frequently, even when trapped. Shooters can expect to be hit with strong Mana Drain and Ice-based attacks every 2-5 turns. Shooters are recommended to position themselves away from other team members, or move to another location when they find themselves being targeted (but be mindful of his waves). This avoids unnecessary mana/health loss for the other members.

name: Teneshpar
notes: It can't be looted and its corpse cannot be moved. It respawns where its corpse is.All players who sufficiently damage it during the last minute of the fight will receive the Slayer of Teneshpar achievement.
abilities: Drowning (45 turns of 20 damage; 900 damage total)
location: Folda, behind the portal here, during the Rise of Devovorga World Quest. Can be fought on Vengoth during the Devovorga's Essence Mini World Change.
behaviour: Retargets, retreats at low health.
strategy:
Sorcerers and Druids: Glacier Set will reduce Ice Damage, but this is not necessary. You will need to heal after each hit as Teneshpar has various strong attacks, and using Magic Shield is recommendable. Heal the blocker and throw all the fire, ice, energy and earth spells you have at it.
Knights and Paladins: Since this creature is immune to Physical Damage, you'll have a hard time killing it. It's advised to throw several Fire Bombs on the floor next to each other and then make Teneshpar chase you back and forth on the middle row. Also bring some Great Fireball Runes to deal some extra damage. If the fire fields get weaker, just cover them with some new Fire Bombs. Knights and Paladins of level 130 or above killing Teneshpar during Devovorga's Essence Mini World Change should wear Firewalker Boots (PvP) to minimise the damage they take from their fields.

name: Tentugly's Head
notes: It's one of the bosses in A Pirate's Tail Quest.

behaviour: It doesn't move. A tentugly's head never retreats.
strategy: Just focus on killing it when it appears, otherwise deal with its tentacles.

name: Terofar
notes: It is extremely difficult boss for paladins and knights due to his skill reducing abilities.
abilities: Curse (1-1000? Long cooldown,uses once per fight)
Wave (Reduces Melee and Distance and Shielding )
behaviour: Attacks in melee range.
strategy:
All vocations: Due to his strong abilities and melee it is advised to use prismatic rings along with Prismatic Necklace, Gill Necklace or Stone Skin Amulets.
Mages: Enter with Energy Ring and Stone Skin Amulet equipped. In the best case scenario, you will summon a monster that will reach Terofar before you do, so he's the one to be inflicted with a curse. If that doesn't work, you should keep an eye on the death hits you get and once it starts hitting over 300, you may want to put an Energy Ring again until the curse is gone. Keep Terofar on diagonal all the time, so you can avoid his waves, keep summoning Fire Devils in case they die, and just shoot it down with your Wand of Defiance/Glacial Rod and Sudden Death Runes. It will take around 10 minutes before it dies even if you are a high level.
It's also wise to carry few Mastermind Potions along and drink one of them each time you failed to react fast enough and got yourself hitted with Skill lowering wave.
Paladins: You can start killing it pretty smooth around 400 level. Just stay on diagonal, keep on using Sharpshooter along with Great Spirit Potions and shoot it down with Infernal Bolts, Sudden Death Runes and occasional Strong Ethereal Spear. Remember to heal yourself to full before casting each Sharpshooter. It's also wise to carry Energy Ring and Pot of Blackjack/Rotworm Stew in case things go south and you can't overheal the damage you get.
Knights: It's totally or at least nearly impossible to kill it as a Knight. Better ask your fellow friends with other vocation to do it for you.

behaviour: Malicious, will make all efforts to destroy intruders. Thalas never retreats.
strategy: He will attack with distance magic attacks, so use blockers to corner him and distance fighters to fire on him. He is guarded by 4 Necromancers and 12 Plaguethrowers (6 around Thalas and 6 more near the teleport).

name: The Abomination
notes: The Abomination is a raid boss that spawns approximately every 180 days. When this raid happens, it starts with the Abominable Spawn appearing in 4 out of 10 possible locations. The miniboss on the 4 locations share the same health pool and it seems to be required to have players in all rooms to defeat it. The remaining portals will bring you to empty rooms. The possible locations are: Once the Abominable Spawn is defeated, its corpse will become a vortex that brings players to the lair of The Abomination. Only through the 4 original portals where the Spawn was present it will be possible to reach The Abomination. Before it appears, a message is broadcast in white text to all players on that world:
abilities: Poison Explosion (Reduces 1200+ speed points) The Abomination
Cursing Explosion (2300~ final hit?) The Abomination
location: The Abomination appears inside his own room under the Ice Islands, here. Information on how to get there is explained under Notes above.
strategy: Secondary blockers should lure Abominable Servants and Abomination Cultists to one side of the room (for example, the east side) while the main blocker lures The Abomination to the opposite side. It's important that nobody tries to block The Abomination and one or more Abominable Servants at the same time as their presence seems to increase The Abomination's attack power. The cultists must be kept away or else Abomination will devour them and refill his health. This way, shooters and healers will stay closer to the center of the room. It's advised to stand in diagonal of it in order to avoid its plus-shaped attack that goes along the entire room (if you are further from the Abomination, even outside of its vision, but still standing directly in front of it vertically or horizontally, you'll get hit). When The Abomination says a vocation's name, every character from that vocation should retreat for a few seconds (6-8?) until it casts an area spell that affects character from the said vocation. When it mentions the knight vocation, the main blocker is advised to retreat to the north, not luring it into the shooters and healers. When it says "YOU ALL .. WILL .... DIE!!!", a 10-second timer will be visible under its name and everyone should pay attention to it and retreat before the timer ends in order to avoid its special "doom" spell. This "doom" is UE-shaped and includes another plus-shape attack which will reach across the whole room, so once again do not stand directly in front of the boss, even if it is outside of your screen. It should be easier to avoid this AOE by running diagonally to the boss, since it also becomes very slow during this period. Additionally, the boss will reflect 300~400% of most damage types received while in this form.

name: The Armored Voidborn
notes: Part of the Cults of Tibia Quest.
location: The Orc Cult hideout in the Edron Orc Cave
behaviour: Fights in close combat.
strategy: It's strong to all damage dealt by players, but can be damaged by Containment Crystals which will use an area spell that hurts it when they are attacked. Once the Crystals kill it, it transforms into The Unarmored Voidborn which can be killed by players.

name: The Astral Source
notes:
It also exists in a distorted form, The Distorted Astral Source.
Part of the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
location: Final boss room of the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: The Baron from Below
notes: Part of the Dangerous Depths Quest.
behaviour: It retargets often so the blocker should try to constantly Challenge it.
strategy: It's recommended to have at least two blockers that will keep boss away from shooters. Every 15 seconds, an Organic Matter will appear in the room and the boss will become The Hungry Baron from Below, which is immune to all damage. You have 10 seconds to kill the Organic Matter or the boss will eat it and recover half of its maximum HP. After the Organic Matter is killed, 4 Aggressive Matters will spawn. Kill them quickly as well because they deal considerable damage. Repeat this process until you finally kill boss. Due to the lava geysers (explode dealing 1500 Fire Damage) and Aggressive Lava around the room, it's recommended for all players to use equipment that provide fire protection. Blockers should use Life Drain Protection, they will receive more this type of damage than any other type.

name: The Big Bad One
notes: New creature in Summer Update 2008.
location: Edron, spawns somewhere around here with 0-2 War Wolves.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Just kill it like a War Wolf.

name: The Blazing Rose
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: The Blazing Time Guardian
notes: The Blazing Time Guardian, The Freezing Time Guardian, and The Time Guardian all share a common Health pool, they are among one of five mini bosses in the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
location: Deep below north-west of Edron, here (accessible through the Astral Shaper Dungeon behind the Holy Portal).
behaviour: Cycles through three phases: starts as The Time Guardian, transforms into The Freezing Time Guardian, reverts to The Time Guardian, then shifts to The Blazing Time Guardian before returning to The Time Guardian.
strategy: Use Ice Damage, which will cause Time Wasters to spawn. Lower-level teams should be careful of doing much damage during this phase, as spawning too many Time Wasters can be dangerous. Also, note that to kill a Time Waster, players must use the corpse of a Lost Time on the Time Waster. Using Fire Damage in this phase heals the boss.

name: The Blightfather
notes: It is the Lancer Beetles' boss that spawns with their raid in Muggy Plains (30 minutes after the initial raid message).
abilities: makes you Cursed (damage raises up to?)
behaviour: The Blightfather will retreat at 4 to 24 (1% - 6%, deep red to red) health.
strategy: Simply kill it. The Blightfather is as strong as an ordinary Lancer Beetle, just faster.

name: The Bloodtusk
notes:
According to Grizzly Adams, "The citizens of Svargrond live in fear because of a frightfully bad-tempered mammoth they call 'Blood Tusk'."
Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
location: North-west of Svargrond. Reached after levitating 5 floors up on the passage to the glacier here, then heading north and entering the portal located here.
behaviour: It fights until death.
strategy: Kill it like a normal Mammoth, it is slightly stronger and have more hp but it's not too hard to kill them. Mages and Paladins be prepared to take some extra damage, he is hard to outrun in his small ice cave.

name: The Bloodweb
notes:
Crystal Spider's boss. Part of the Paw and Fur Society tasks of Grizzly Adams. Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
When you kill The Bloodweb you'll receive the achievement Arachnoise.
The portal which leads to the boss is inside the Formorgar Glacier, here.
abilities: Melee (0-280 and starting up to 8 hp/turn)
behaviour: The Bloodweb never retreats.
strategy: Treat it like a Crystal Spider with twice its usual strength. It will be easier for Mages and Paladins to defeat it if they use an Energy Wall Rune.

name: The Brainstealer
notes: It's the final boss of the Too Hot to Handle Quest.
abilities: Destroys Magic Walls and Rush Wood
behaviour: The Brainstealer never retreats.
strategy: Avoid staying in front of it because of its strong beam spells. During the fight, players hit by the boss will receive Madness, an effect that deals damager over time. The Madness is contagious so it's suggested that players do not move too much so they don't get/pass Madness. When the Mental Nexus' spawn the boss will become invulnerable. Position one or both Fleeting Thoughts close to the Nexus to kill it, but do not get hit by the Nexus' spell as it will heal it. Repeat this mechanic twice to defeat the Brainstealer.

name: The Collector
notes: The Collector "lives solely to collect all kinds of rare gems, crystals and minerals. Offering an item it does not already own, reportedly allows passage into its lair." (Spectulus).
location: Vega, in a cave below the stony pond.
behaviour: Runs away in deep red hps.
strategy:
Knights with 50/50 with the equipment given to you on Island of Destiny will be able to kill it. - Sorcerers, Druids and Paladins should get distance from it and kill it while running. Try to always keep walking on the ice, so it won't hurt you.
Be careful Low-Level players, his attacks really hurt.

name: The Corruptor of Souls
notes: It's the vulnerable form of The Remorseless Corruptor. Part of the Cults of Tibia Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: The Count of the Core
notes: Part of the Dangerous Depths Quest.
behaviour: This monster heals when receiving Fire Damage, including the damage dealt by the monsters and mechanics in the room (Ember Beasts, the fire cannons, and Snail Slimes). It summons a Snail Slime after taking some damage.
strategy: Trap him in a corner of the room with a player on every SQM at the range of 3 SQM of the boss, this will avoid it summoning Snail Slimes when taking damage. The Snail Slimes blow up when dying and deal 1730 Fire Damage in an small area. Druids and Sorcerers should avoid boss beams because it reduces Magic Level.

name: The Count
notes: It is not possible to summon him from his coffin without the associated quest.
location: Green Claw Swamp, beneath the Blood Herb Quest area.
strategy:
Kill him as fast as possible, since he does really high combos (up to 700) when a banshee is summoned. He probably isn't a creature to be hunted. He's strong, dangerous and doesn't drop any valuable item other than a Vampire Shield.
If you release him and don't kill him, you can not release him again, so you will have to buy The Ring of the Count from a player or from Black Bert to continue The Inquisition Quest. If you put 3 garlic necklaces on the counters around the buried coffin, you can save yourself a lot of trouble. After that, you use the upper part of the coffin and The Weakened Count appears (looks the same as regular vampire and causes the same damage). This strategy is highly recommended to use!

name: The Destruction
notes: A boss from the Heart of Destruction Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: The Devourer of Secrets
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: This boss is part of the final battle of the Secret Library Quest, check it for more context. After another minute killing the raid, the northwestern wing will be opened: THE NORTH WESTERN WING HAS BEEN BREACHED! RUSH TO CRUSH THE INTRUDERS! Inside this final wing you will face The Devourer of Secrets together with War Servants and 4 The Book of Secrets. Do not destroy the Books, as they will make The Devourer of Secrets stronger. Simply kill the boss while healing the books with Mass Healing and Ultimate Healing Runes, as they will take damage from the boss and the summons. After killing The Devourer of Secrets, go back to the central chamber where a new raid will start (After the death of the devourer of secrets the invasion of the central chamber continues!)

name: The Diamond Blossom
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: The Distorted Astral Source
notes:
It is a distorted form of The Astral Source.
Part of the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
location: Final boss room of the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: The Dread Maiden
notes: The Dread Maiden's is initially strong to all damage types, however, as the battle progresses it will be weakened to the point it takes damage in a normal way. It's part of the Feaster of Souls Quest.
behaviour: The Dread Maiden never retreats.
strategy: The blocker should take The Dread Maiden to a corner of the room and keep it there. During the fight, Red, Green and Blue ghosts will spawn in the room. These ghosts must be lured to vortices of their respective color in order to weaken the boss and keep it weakened afterwards. Be careful not to lure the ghosts onto the wrong vortex as this will cause them to heal the boss or deal damage to you. This should be done by the shooters so the blocker can focus on keeping the boss standing still.

name: The Duke of the Depths
notes: Part of the Dangerous Depths Quest.
abilities: Fireball Beam (?) The Duke of the Depths
Fire Wave (529-780) The Duke of the Depths
Trembling UE (?) The Duke of the Depths
behaviour: The boss re-targets very often and it hits by melee and fire attacks mainly.
strategy: The main blocker should be at least level 300 (but 450 is recommended) with Fire Damage protection. Trap the boss on the east side of the room by the exit teleport so it doesn't roam around and attack the shooters. Every 20 seconds, 5 Fiery Hearts will appear in the room and the boss will become The Fire Empowered Duke, which is immune to all damage. The Fire Duke also has much stronger attacks and use them often if attacked, so all the shooters should stop attacking the boss. The Fiery Hearts must be killed quickly or they'll become Fiery Bloods, which will walk around the room and attack the shooters. Once the boss is vulnerable again, focus all damage on it. Repeat this process several times until it's defeated.

name: The Enraged Thorn Knight
notes: This is one of the bosses in the Forgotten Knowledge Quest. It looks like a Crystal Warlord and is one form of the Thorn Knight.
location: A dungeon here, accessible through the Desecrated Glade.
behaviour: The enraged Thorn Knight never retreats.
strategy: Do not use Death Damage against it otherwise it will heal 10 times the damage it was supposed to receive.

name: The Evil Eye
notes: It's the Bonelords' Boss. It can cause Death Damage and all different kinds of Magical Damage. Always spawns with 3 Bonelords and 2 Elder Bonelords near it. When the Evil Eye is present in Hellgate, large clusters of Bonelords and Elder Bonelords (groups of 5 or 6) that are not normally present appear.
abilities: Mana Drain Wave (150-250) The Evil Eye
Life drain Wave (75-85) The Evil Eye
Life drain Shot (110-130) The Evil Eye
paralyze (200-230 points for 20 seconds) The Evil Eye
location: North East of the Hellgate Library.
behaviour: The Evil Eye attacks from a distance. The Evil Eye never retreats.
strategy:
Knights should rush in and kill it fast if you have no shooters. It has no Melee attack, so it will continue to use its distance attacks when you are up close. Be especially careful of the many Summons, and use Berserk to kill them if necessary. Using a Stealth Ring may be useful to avoid the Demon Skeletons' extra damage.
Paladins Stay diagonal, hit them with your weapon, and exori san. Use potions if your health is low.
Mages should use their wand to kill him. Avoid or ignore the summons and kill The Evil Eye first unless you are taking too much damage. It might be useful to run in circles to avoid getting hurt by the summoned Demon Skeletons and Ghosts. Also, using Invisible or a Stealth Ring might be useful to avoid the summons' damage.

name: The False God
notes: Part of the Cults of Tibia Quest.
behaviour: The False God will fight in close combat until death.
strategy: Focus all your firepower on it while running around the room to avoid the Sphere of Wrath.

name: The Fear Feaster
notes: It's part of the Feaster of Souls Quest.
behaviour: The Fear Feaster never retreats.

name: The Fettered Shatterer
notes: Part of the Ferumbras' Ascendant Quest.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: The Fire Empowered Duke
notes: Part of the Dangerous Depths Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: The First Dragon
notes: Part of the First Dragon Quest.
behaviour: The First Dragon attacks in melee range.
strategy: See First Dragon Quest.

name: The Flaming Orchid
notes: As part of the Asura Palace Quest, access to the boss is granted every 20 hours but requires defeating 3 Cave Hydras and 2 Greater Fire Elementals each time you wish to enter.
abilities: Mana Drain Spark Beam (291-381) The Flaming Orchid
Death Area on victim (304-495) The Flaming Orchid
Burning Fire Area The Flaming Orchid
Death Missile Spark (Unknown maybe soulfire) The Flaming Orchid
Debuff (Reduces Melee and Shielding by 30-37% for 8 seconds) The Flaming Orchid
Paralyzing Black Cloud (Reduces 340 Speed Points) The Flaming Orchid
behaviour: The Flaming Orchid attacks in melee range. The Flaming Orchid never retreats.

name: The Freezing Time Guardian
notes: The Freezing Time Guardian, The Blazing Time Guardian, and The Time Guardian all share a common Health pool, they are among one of five mini bosses in the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
location: Deep below north-west of Edron, here (accessible through the Astral Shaper Dungeon behind the Holy Portal).
behaviour: Cycles through three phases: starts as The Time Guardian, transforms into The Freezing Time Guardian, reverts to The Time Guardian, then shifts to The Blazing Time Guardian before returning to The Time Guardian.
strategy: Use Fire Damage, which will also cause Lost Times to spawn; kill them and use their corpse on a Time Waster to eliminate them, as they are invulnerable to player damage. Using Ice Damage in this phase heals the boss.

name: The Frog Prince
notes: New creature in Summer Update 2008, spawns near Alatar Lake with another green frog. Looks the same as a Green Frog.
behaviour: Spawns with 4 Green Frogs. unlike the Green Frog, he attacks players instead of running away from them. This creature runs away in dark yellow health with speed faster than that of a normal Green Frog.
strategy: It's weak, just kill it.

name: The Great Schnitzel
notes: Part of Orcsoberfest World Quest
abilities: Lemon Juice of Doom (makes you drunk)
location: Orcsoberfest Island. Reach its hideout by entering an  Omnious Cauldron, whose locations are listed here. Use  All Knowing Sausages to find out which location is currently active.
behaviour: It does not move and cannot be pushed.
strategy: Do not attack him, doing so will cause Drunkenness. Kill the  Spawn of the Schnitzel and use the  Schnitzel Meat Grinder on it to hurt it 250 hp. After it reaches black HP bar, you will only deal 1 damage but still get Schnitzel Points.

name: The Handmaiden
notes: Pacera was the first server to kill it. The Handmaiden is the Hand of Cursed Fate boss.
abilities: Melee (0-750+ and starting up to 30 hp/turn)
location: Pits of Inferno, in Pumin's Throneroom.
behaviour: Similar behaviour to the Hand of Cursed Fate.
strategy: One Knight must have, at least 2500 or more Hitpoints to try to block this creature. Use Holy Damage, Ice Damage or Energy Damage to kill this boss.

name: The Horned Fox
notes: He is one of the Minotaur bosses. He has a Secret Hideout near the Dwarf Mines of Kazordoon which he rarely visits. He is one of the few Minotaurs that has been proven to be able to write (as evidenced by this document). You can use an Obsidian Knife on his corpse in order to skin Minotaur Leather.
abilities: Summons (1-2 Minotaur Guard or Minotaur Archer or Minotaur Mage )
location:
At the other side of the teleporter. The teleporter to him is located here, at the way to the place where he spawned before the Killing in the Name of... Quest was introduced to Tibia, but just one floor further down. It is also marked when you complete the task of killing 5000 minotaurs so it isn't hard to find.
The Horned Fox can also spawn randomly, e.g. at the top of the mountain here, by the campfire in the cave here, or in the room right before you enter the teleporter to the task version of The Horned Fox here.
behaviour: The Horned Fox fights until death.
strategy:
Mages: Kill him fast with Ice Strike or Death Strike so you won't get much damage from him nor his summons. Ideally, use Invisibility so as not to receive any damage from his summons (if he has time to summon). 
Knights: Try to trap him in a corner so you know where he is when he goes invisible. When he goes invisible use Berserk. Use Stealth Ring so you don't receive damage from his summons. 
Paladins: Kill him fast and use Invisibility so you don't receive damage from his summons. Further, it is recommended that you run him so as to minimize damage.

name: The Hunger
notes: A boss from the Heart of Destruction Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: The Hungerer
notes: Rare Spitter boss found on the bottom of the Hive Outpost in Liberty Bay, in a ~20-minute Varying Monster Spawn in which the common creatures are a Hive Overseer and a Spidris Elite, and the possible rare bosses are The Hungerer, The Manhunter, and The Mean Masher. This respawn point can be blocked if you stay too close. The safest way is to leave the Hive Outpost while waiting for the spawn.

name: The Hungry Baron from Below
notes: It's eager to devour Organic Matter. Part of the Dangerous Depths Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Don't attack it, destroy its food so it becomes The Baron from Below again.

name: The Imperor
notes: The Imperor is the Diabolic Imp boss. It was killed first time on Solera, later on Pacera and Refugia.
abilities: Some kind of energy bomb around itself with unknown effect
location: Pits of Inferno in Infernatil's Throneroom.
behaviour: It moves extremely fast, and it spams you with all kinds of hits.
strategy: Trap it in a corner and SD it really quickly. Avoid letting it escape, you will get lured in really big spawns. When it heals it can do really high damage together with the normal spawn when it starts with attacking again.

name: The Keeper
notes: This creature was added in Summer Update 2010. Part of the Wrath of the Emperor Quest quest.
location: Northern Zao in his lair, spawned by using poison on the purple plants.
behaviour: Behavior like that of a serpent spawn. Retreats at very low health.
strategy: Dont fight it at all. Try to make it moving into the poison field spawning in the cave (causes 8000 damage every time).

name: The Last Lore Keeper
notes: This is the last boss in the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
abilities: Energy Chain (429-996) The Last Lore Keeper
Mana Drain Chain (173-474) The Last Lore Keeper
location: Deep below Nargor, here (accessible through the Astral Shaper Boss Dungeon behind an Energy Gate).
behaviour: Fights in close range and retargets quite often.
strategy: See Forgotten Knowledge Quest.

name: The Lily of Night
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: The Lord of the Lice
notes: It looks like Mutated Rats. It will yell Swarm forth, minions! when summoning creatures.
abilities: Melee (0-396 and starting up to? hp/turn)
Dizzy Missile The Lord of the Lice
Explosion Wave The Lord of the Lice
Summon 3 Brimstone Bugs or 3 Larvas at or 3 Insect Swarms once The Lord of the Lice
Sparkles Exori The Lord of the Lice
location: Grounds of Plague, a Ferumbras' Ascension Quest area.

name: The Manhunter
notes: Rare Spidris boss found on the bottom of the Hive Outpost in Liberty Bay, in a ~20-minute Varying Monster Spawn in which the common creatures are a Hive Overseer and a Spidris Elite, and the possible rare bosses are The Hungerer, The Manhunter, and The Mean Masher. This respawn point can be blocked if you stay in the spawn room.
behaviour: Approaches the target very fast.
strategy: Separate it from other monsters, stand diagonally and take it down.

name: The Many
notes: The Hydra boss has more health and heals faster than a normal Hydra, it is part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
location: Chor, through a teleporter located here.
behaviour: Treat it like a regular Hydra
strategy: Treat it like a regular Hydra, but, unlike a regular hydra it doesnt walk into fire fields

name: The Mean Masher
notes: A rare Hive Overseer boss found on the bottom of the Hive Outpost in Liberty Bay, in a ~20-minute Varying Monster Spawn in which the common creatures are a Hive Overseer and a Spidris Elite, and the possible rare bosses are The Hungerer, The Manhunter, and The Mean Masher.
location: Bottom floor of the Hive Outpost.
behaviour: Very similar to a Hive Overseer, it attacks from distance while using its summons to do melee damage.
strategy: Treat it like a slightly stronger Hive Overseer.

name: The Mega Magmaoid
notes: Part of the Too Hot to Handle Quest.
behaviour: The Mega Magmaoid never retreats.
strategy: See Too Hot to Handle Quest.

name: The Monster
notes: The Monster is a creation of Doctor Marrow. It's the final boss of The Cradle of Monsters Quest.
behaviour: Attacks in close range and doesn't retarget very often.
strategy: It's immune to all damage when its counter is at the maximum value of 20. The lower the counter is, the weaker The Monster will be. It can be weakened by forcing it to walk over the liquids spilled when the Alchemistical Containers in the room are destroyed.

name: The Moonlight Aster
notes: As part of the Asura Palace Quest, access to the boss is granted every 20 hours but requires defeating 2 Vicious Liches and 2 Vile Destroyers each time you wish to enter.
abilities: Mana Drain Spark Beam (313-345) The Moonlight Aster
Debuff (Reduces Melee and Shielding by 20-27% for 7 seconds) The Moonlight Aster
Paralyzing Black Cloud (Reduces 335 Speed Points) The Moonlight Aster
behaviour: The Moonlight Aster attacks in melee range. The Moonlight Aster never retreats.

name: The Mutated Pumpkin
notes: It spawns every 4 hours starting a few seconds after after Server Open (not to be confused with Server Save) on Halloween (between the Server Saves of October 31 and November 3). When it spawns, the following message is broadcast to all players: Once the Mutated Pumpkin has been slain, a portal east of Darashia opens for 30 minutes (here), where all fighters can skin the corpse for the achievement Mutated Presents, and one of the following: The exiting portal will take the player to Darashia Temple. You will be automatically kicked out of the reward room after 5 minutes with the message "You can't bear staying in this room any longer."
abilities: Mana Drain Wave (8-12) The Mutated Pumpkin
Giant Star Bomb (makes you heavily drunk ) The Mutated Pumpkin
Shapeshifting (Turns victims into; The Mutated Pumpkin )
Linear Terra Wave (turns you into a pumpkin )
Confetti Wave (gives you haste ) The Mutated Pumpkin
location: Spawns west of Darashia around here or here or here during Halloween.
behaviour: Fights in close combat. The Mutated Pumpkin never retreats.
strategy: Try to trap it since it retargets a lot and it's very fast. Then just attack it until it's dead.

name: The Nightmare Beast
notes: It's the final boss of The Dream Courts Quest.
behaviour: The boss will change targets frequently, so it's better to trap it in the spot west of the room where it won't be able to move to another target.The Nightmare Beast attacks in melee range.
strategy: The boss itself isn't very hard to deal with, though everyone should be careful because it can deal up to 1000 damage just using its distance attacks. In order to succeed in the fight, however, the team must be organized and take turns in using the Totem in the room to create Dream Catchers and remove the curse that is applied to one character at a time, otherwise this person will be kicked out of the room. If there are 5 players doing this in a previously determined order, the boss fight shouldn't be very complicated to kill using Sudden Death Runes and single-target ammunition. Most of its attacks seem to deal Death Damage, so protection against this element is probably the best to use during the fight.

name: The Noxious Spawn
notes: Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
location: In a room in Deeper Banuta through a teleporter (here).
behaviour: Runs away in low health
strategy: This boss heals alot more than the normal serpent spawn. Also his waves and his beams are stronger than the normal ones, so you should stay diagonal to it. Knights should use Fierce Berserk and Blood Rage while avoiding waves and beams. Paladins should use Assassin Stars and Holy Missile while running around in the room. Druids and Sorcerers should use mana shield and Sudden Death Runes while running around in the room, from level 130 on you don't have to use mana shield.

name: The Old Whopper
notes: New creature in Summer Update 2008. He spawns with several cyclopes smiths.
abilities: Drunkwave (3 sqm in front of himself; makes you very drunk)
location: The Old Whopper spawns before the level 30 door leading to the Behemoth Quest at floor -4 of Cyclopolis, (here).
behaviour: Fights until death.
strategy: It's a very easy creature, just kill it.

name: The Old Widow
notes: It's the Giant Spider's boss. Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-700 and starting up to 30 hp/turn)
Great Poison Bomb The Old Widow
paralyze (200-220 points for 25 seconds) The Old Widow
location: Its task teleport is located on the Plains of Havoc, here. Sometimes it spawns outside with all the other Giant Spiders.
behaviour: The Old Widow never retreats.
strategy:
To all vocations: stand at the most southern spot in the cave to make sure only The Old Widow can hit you, and its summons cannot. It is not a very good idea to try to outrun it, as its heavy paralysis and ability to haste make this very difficult. If you are lucky enough, a Giant Spider will stand in front of you, not The Old Widow, and then you will have an easy time killing it (for mages and paladins). Knights just kill the Giant Spider and then The Old Widow.If your level is below 90, it's wise to use Stone Skin Amulets (2-4 may be enough) and Might Rings to increase you chances. 
Mages: This is a hard monster to solo as a mage, try not to face it below level 80 as 2,000+ mana and the use of Great Mana Potions are recommended. Since it is a very fast creature, Wild Growth/Magic Walls will come in handy. Use Magic Shield because it can hit 600 easily. Unlike Giant Spiders, The Old Widow is strong to Fire Damage so Hell's Core will hit less. Take a Wand of Voodoo or Underworld Rod and attack it with Sudden Death runes while drinking plenty of Great Mana Potions. Terra Set is also recommended, although you might want to wear a Protection Amulet or Stone Skin Amulet rather than a Terra Amulet. If your level is below 60 then you will most likely die even with Magic Shield, however, it is possible for a level 60 mage to solo The Old Widow using Energy Walls and Sudden Death runes.
Paladins: Level 80+ can kill it by using Assassin Stars and Energy Ring. Before you pass into the teleport, make sure you use Haste or Strong Haste to avoid being trapped and once you get inside the boss room, keep using Strong Mana Potions or Great Spirit Potions when your mana falls low.
Knights: Level 90+ can kill it by using Defensive Fighting, Great Health Potions and Fierce Berserk. Always drink Mana Potions and use Fierce Berserk with full hp. If your level is below 80 you will have high chances to die, because The Old Widow will deal you more damage than you can recover from. It is highly recommended to cast Blood Rage, then combine with Berserk, Fierce Berserk, Brutal Strike and Front Sweep.

name: The Pale Count
notes: Affected by the boss chest loot system and special AI. When summoning a Nightfiend he says "Out of the dark I call you, fiend in the night!". Once the Pale Count reaches yellow health he will say "Dare to follow me to my Sanctuary below and you shall DIE!" and teleport himself downstairs at full health. When the Pale Count spawns, the following raid message appears: Note about loot:
location: During a raid under Drefia, initially here. After reaching yellow health it teleports itself with full health to the lower floor and spawns in front of the mirror, exactly here. Entrance to this place, which is opened only during his raid, is located here.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: The Pale Count fights at melee range and switches target often, a decent level knight should block it, using Challenge frequently. If there are many players waiting for it, then make sure you position yourself well and use your best attacks to have a higher chance of good loot.

name: The Pale Worm
notes: It's the final boss of the Feaster of Souls Quest.
behaviour: The Pale Worm never retreats.

name: The Percht Queen
notes: While it's frozen, it will be immune to damage and look like this: It's the boss of the Winterlight Solstice event.
behaviour: It does not move. The Percht Queen never retreats.
strategy: You can fight the queen with up to 5 players, once every 20 hours. The fight is very easy and there is pretty much no danger of dying, a team of players around level 50 should be enough to do it. In order to defeat the Percht Queen, you must first unfreeze it. To do so, you'll have to do the following steps: 1. As soon as you pull the lever, you'll be in a small room with a Warm Bonfire  and Vortex of Nature , here. Use the bonfire and a Percht Warding Torch  will appear in front of it, pick it up. 2. Step on the Vortex and your appearance will change to a Leaf Golem. 3. Go down, and then quickly go all the way to the other side of the dungeon, here. Do not go north. When you step near the wall, a Rush Wood (Quest)  (tree) will appear. Use it 5 times, each time a Branch  will appear in front of the tree, pick them all up. 4. Go to the south where there will be a Burn Out Bonfire , here. If it's not lit, use your torch on it and light it up, so it changes into a Smoldering Bonfire . Start using the wood on the bonfire. 5. After using all the wood, go back to the west side, transform yourself into the Leaf Golem and repeat this process until the bonfire is so big that it's a Blazing Bonfire  and a Warm Fire  appears (20 Branches are necessary). 6. When the Warm Fire appears, the bonfire will stop burning, use a torch on it again (the torch only lasts for 40 seconds, so you'll also need to constantly pick up a new one). Then, use the bonfire and you'll start burning yourself . 7. Lure the Warm Fire to the north, but be careful because the Percht Minions will try to kill it. Also avoid the Ice beams that come from the north of the room. The Warm Fire will explode and deal damage to The Percht Queen. Repeat the process above until The Percht Queen is not frozen anymore (required 4 Warm Fires) and can be killed by the players. Important notes:
loot: The Crown of the Percht Queen (Ice)
The Crown of the Percht Queen (Fire)

name: The Plasmother
notes: The Plasmother is the Defiler boss. It was killed first time on Furora.
abilities: Poison Ball (poisons you up to 40 hp/turn)
behaviour: He run in low health and Summons up to 2 Defilers.
strategy: Try to block it with a Knight and use Sudden Death or Death Strike. Wild Growth and Magic Wall will help your team a lot.

name: The Primal Menace
notes: It's part of the Primal Ordeal Quest
behaviour: The Primal Menace attacks in melee range.
strategy: The fight can be split into two moments - with and without Primal Pack Beast summons. During the fight without Primal Pack Beasts a Knight should keep the boss at the middle of the room and shooters stay around the room to observe the environment for spawning Primal Pods and Primal Pack Beasts - besides shooters should simply strike the boss with Sudden Death Runes. It is advised for Paladins to use bow with Diamond Arrow to avoid changing the bow and crossbow during the fight to minimize the risk of losing attack turns. Mages should preserve their Hell's Core and Eternal Winter spells for the summons. Any time a Primal Pod spawns, anybody nearby (including the Knight) should run and step on it immediately - otherwise a Fungosaurus will spawn,  which will decrease your chances of completing the boss significantly. At some point the boss will start to summon Primal Pack Beasts. Shooters have to be careful and attempt to run to the opposite side of the room from the spawning summon (to not get the agro at all) while the Knight should go closer to the spawning Primal Pack Beast and challenge it as soon as possible. Once done the Knight should attempt to return to the middle of the room. Moments with Primal Pack Beast summons When this happens, the shooters should focus on AoE damage. The rune used should be Great Fireball Runes. Sorcerers should wave the box with his fire and energy waves while Druids should use their Terra Wave as frequently as possible as you have approximately 10 turns to kill the Primal Pack Beast - otherwise it will transform into Fungosaurus. The terra wave of Druid is not effective to The Primal Menace, nevertheless it works fine against Primal Pack Beasts and Fungosauruses and it should be your priority to kill it as fast as possible. It is advised that one of the team members pay special attention to the time of killing the summons - and if there are chances that one of these will transform into a Fungosaurus the mages should cast their Hell's Core and/or Eternal Winter spells immediately. It may also happen that you won't be able to kill the summons on time and a Fungosaurus will spawn in place of not killed Primal Pack Beast. It is a quite critical situation for the team - the Knight loses his mobility as the Fungosaurus causes Feared status, so that Knight has to use Fire Bomb Rune to avoid randomly running. Summons will keep spawning so it's fully on shooters now to lure the Primal Pack Beasts to the blocker. Note: The Knight has also to pay extra attention as Primal Pods that appear near him will clear any field from bombs, so they might need to be renewed to avoid random running due to the Feared status. Before you go:

name: The Rage
notes: A boss from the Heart of Destruction Quest. Appears with Frenzies.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Unknown

name: The Ravager
notes: He gets healed every time he steps on Stone Tile with lizard symbol.
location: Oramond, south in the Oramond Catacombs.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: You can only fight this boss in teams of 4. It's recommended that your team consist of exactly 1 knight and 3 shooters. The Ravager spawns with 4 Greater Canopic Jars in the room and can summon Canopic Jars. Both of these will remain statically positioned but if The Ravager is moved away from the Canopic Jar he will summon new ones near him. To have any chance of defeating The Ravager, your shooters must defeat all the Greater Canopic Jars while the knight forces The Ravager to bring all the Canopic Jars closer to him. When all the Canopic Jars are bunched together, the knight should move so that The Ravager is out of the healing range of the Canopic Jars but is still in the range so that the jars will not despawn. When the positioning has been set up the team should focus on trapping and killing The Ravager. Do not allow him to move when set up. Preferably, the knight will be diagonal to The Ravager, and will have the boss trapped with Wild Growth Runes or Magic Wall Runes. The shooters should position themselves behind the knight when it is trapped, so that it will not escape the trap to attack another party member.

name: The Scion of Havoc
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: This boss is part of the final battle of the Secret Library Quest, check it for more context. After another minute killing the raid, the southeastern wing will be opened: THE SOUTH EASTERN WING HAS BEEN BREACHED! RUSH TO CRUSH THE INTRUDERS! Inside this wing you will find The Scion of Havoc and several Spawns of Havoc. You should not kill the Spawns of Havoc , since when they die they will explode and deal 1000+ damage to all players around it. This damage also heals The Scion of Havoc. Thus, in order to kill it, it is better to trap it in a corner while one or two members of the team keep the Spawns of Havoc away from the boss. After killing The Scion of Havoc, go back to the central chamber where a new raid will start (After the death of the scion of havoc the invasion of the central chamber continues!)
