behaviour: Unknown
strategy:
This boss is part of the final battle of the Secret Library Quest, check it for more context. After some more time killing the raid in the main room, the following messages will appear: The Leader of the invasion finally joins the battle! Beware, the scourge of oblivion enters the fray! In the central chamber, you will face The Scourge of Oblivion, which will constantly change between three stages. During the "regular" stage, players should deal as much damage do the boss as possible. The two other stages will be accompanied by a broadcast: While the boss is invulnerable, the shooters should clear the summons that will keep spawning around them during the fight, as they can deal significant damage to the shooters. Upon killing The Scourge of Oblivion, you will get the achievement Library Liberator and the following messages will appear at the center of the room: NOOOO! WE HAVE BEEN FOOLED! THE ATTACK WAS A RUSE!
AMIDST THE DISTRACTION THE KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THE GODBREAKER HAS BEEN STOLEN!
COME TO ME! WE HAVE TO TALK!

strategy: It's invulnerable to physical damage. Dealing elemental damage to it while it is standing on a geyser will turn it into its vulnerable form, The Sinister Hermit (Blue). Whenever is changes to The Sinister Hermit (Blue) it will summon two Vermin Swarm

name: The Snapper
notes: Recently several citizens of Port Hope have vanished. It is rumoured that they were killed by a crocodile. The people call it 'Snapper'. Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest. It cannot be killed until Grizzly Adams lets you enter the teleporter.
location: Tiquanda Reptile and Crustacean Caves - here
behaviour: The Snapper is a melee combatant so chases its opponent, but runs in very low health.
strategy:
Kill it like a normal Crocodile.
Paladins and Mages: There is a big rock in the middle they can run around and shoot at him from.
Knights: If your level is lower than 20, bring potions because he has a high defense and you won't hit too much.

notes: Part of the Cults of Tibia Quest.

behaviour: The Souldespoiler attacks in melee range.
strategy: Just attack this boss form with whatever you have. It won't take much damage but Freed Souls will start spawning. These do an area attack that will damage the boss so keep them close. Once three Freed Souls have spawned the boss will start dying quickly.

name: The Source of Corruption
notes: It's the final boss of the Cults of Tibia Quest.
location: Feyrist, behind the teleport next to Gerimor.
behaviour: It fights in close combat. The Source Of Corruption never retreats.
strategy: It's easier to kill it if the blockers trap it in one of the corners of the room. Shooters should be careful because besides its spells, it will also reflect 15% of all the damage dealt to it.

name: The Spellstealer (Creator)
notes: Part of The Secret Library Quest.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: This boss is part of the final battle of the Secret Library Quest, check it for more context. Enter the teleport to the northeast. Inside, you will find The Spellstealer and Demon Slaves. The Spellstealer on its red and green form is invulnerable to all attacks. To make it vulnerable, players must lure it to the vortex corresponding to its color: When the boss steps on the correct vortex, it changes to a light gray color and becomes vulnerable. After some time being hit, it will become invulnerable again (The spellstealer absorbs the power of destruction! or The spellstealer absorbs the power of creation!), and it will have to be lured to the corresponding vortex. Repeat this until it is killed and then go back to the central chamber where a new raid will start (After the death of the spellstealer the invasion of the central chamber continues!) with the addition of Invading Demons.

name: The Time Guardian
notes: The Time Guardian, The Freezing Time Guardian, and The Blazing Time Guardian all share a common Health pool, they are among one of five mini bosses in the Forgotten Knowledge Quest.
location: Deep below north-west of Edron, here (accessible through the Astral Shaper Dungeon behind the Holy Portal).
behaviour: Cycles through three phases: starts as The Time Guardian, transforms into The Freezing Time Guardian, reverts to The Time Guardian, then shifts to The Blazing Time Guardian before returning to The Time Guardian.
strategy: Focus on dealing steady Physical Damage or Death Damage, as this form is strong to other elemental types.

name: The Unarmored Voidborn
notes:
This boss is probably Tibia's creature with the highest elemental weakness, but since it has a lot of hitpoints it still takes a while to kill it. When fighting it you'll easily see hits of 2000, 3000 and even up to 8000 when dealing Critical Hits.
Part of the Cults of Tibia Quest.
location: The Orc Cult hideout in the Edron Orc Cave.
behaviour: The Unarmored Voidborn attacks in melee range.
strategy: It spawns once The Armored Voidborn is killed. It's weak to all damage types so use your best attacks on him.

location: Corruption Hole. One spawn point is near the eye, here, and the other spawn point is with the Ghastly Dragons, here.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: The Weakened Count

strategy: It's like a normal Vampire so kill it as if you were killing a Vampire.

name: The Welter
notes: With him spawn 8? eggs, which hatch to produce Spawns of the Welter, which do very minor damage but heal every monster around it (including The Welter) for massive amounts.
abilities: strong Self Healing (17000+ only once when on red hp)
behaviour: Fights until death.
strategy:
The Welter on Fidera When the eggs create the spawns, the blockers should use Challenge on them and lure them away from the boss. Be careful when luring away because if you get trapped by them the only way out is to have someone come take them off of you - the spawns will heal themselves and all other monsters around them, you cannot reasonably expect to kill your way out of a trap. Make sure all spawns are lured away from the boss and that they will not roam around. If a spawn roams and finds you killing the boss, they will heal it back to full health very quickly. Once the spawns are away from the boss, focus all your firepower on it. It is soloable by luring the spawns away from the boss. However, due to the difficulty of that and the chance of spawns roaming to you, it is strongly recommend you bring a group.
will heal itself once on red hp and a message will appear,while a Spawn of the Welter will disappear:<the welter devours his spawn and heals himself>

location: A dungeon here, accessible through the Desecrated Glade.
strategy: Do not use Death Damage against it otherwise it will heal 10 times the damage it was supposed to receive.

name: Thul
notes: The Quara boss, it looks the same as a Quara Constrictor but is stronger. It always spawns with 2 Quara Hydromancers and 2 Quara Mantassins, except in the quest room where it spawns alone. Thul is a boss of the Killing in the Name of... Quest. The portal which leads to the boss is under the boat of Coral Comb in Calassa, here.
location: Calassa, near and underneath the ship with the Coral Comb (two spawns), here.
behaviour: When he uses poison bomb he will poison himself but he is not weak or strong against earth damage. Thul will run at about 40 health (tested at 37, note that Quara Constrictors run at 40). Thul will retreat at 40  (1.36%, deep red) health.
strategy: Thul can be found in two areas: he is in the quest room when someone enters it and he can spawn just west of the teleport to it. Thul and his Massive Water Elemental summons do not cross energy fields unless they cannot reach you otherwise. It can be handy for paladins and mages to throw an energy wall toward the teleport (quest room Thul) and run over it to avoid close-combat attacks (they will all run around the coral). Note that Thul can poison bomb over energy walls, but will do so very rarely while chasing you around them.

name: Timira the Many-Headed
notes: It's part of the Within the Tides Quest. The first time a character defeats Timira, they will always get a Naga Basin from her loot.
abilities: Fire Ultimate Explosion (560-577) Timira the Many-Headed
location: Emerald Gardens, an island of Marapur.
behaviour: Timira fights in close range, but her AoE and chain attacks will often affect other players in the room.Timira the Many-Headed attacks in melee range.
strategy: The final part of the fight against Timira is quite simple. If fighting with a lower level team, the blocker can trap Timira at the north-west corner of the room so it won't switch to the shooters. Most elements work well on Timira, although Sorcerers should avoid their waves as they'll do more damage by simply using Sudden Death Runes. For the strategies of the initial stages of the fight, see Within the Tides Quest.

name: Tiquandas Revenge
notes: It's the Carniphila's boss. It looks and behaves like a Carniphila, but it is much stronger.
location:
Deep in the Tiquandian Jungle, has been seen here,  here and here. 
The portal to the boss for the special task is located here.
behaviour: Tiquandas Revenge fights until death.
strategy: If you are a Mage, it would definitely be smart to use Sudden Death Runes to kill this. You wouldn't want it to get close to you. The blocker (if there's any) should run it and absorb its distance attacks but not let it come to Melee. If you are a Knight the only and best strategy is to use best weapon and Fierce Berserk. If you are a Paladin use Assassin Stars if possible. Its Healing is extremely fast, much more than Hydra. This is not a regular spawn.

name: Ungreez
notes: Was implemented in the Summer Update 2008. Part of the Demon Hunter Outfits quest, you need to kill Ungreez to gain all experience for your first addon. Ungreez is Stronger than a Demon and its tolerance to attacks are the reason for it. You can use a Blessed Wooden Stake on Ungreez once slain to get a Demon Dust.
location: Edron Hero Cave in the teleport just west of the Memory Stone for the Explorer Society.
behaviour: This monster fights until the death, with its strong beam attack you should stay diagonal. He walks through Energy and Poison Fields, although it is not immune to them.
strategy:
Just like a normal Demon, however, does not summon Fire Elementals.Knights try to use Exori Gran. It is strongly advised for knights under level 100 to have a blocker or a healer, since he heals often.Mages can easily solo them from level 45 and up, run from teleport to teleport and using Magic Shield and Sudden death runes to speed up the killing a little. You can also run it in the room, since the room is quite big. Ice spells/runes will also work. If you have blocker you don't need go outside the teleport to charge mana.Paladins should run or kill with a blocker while using Assassin Stars and Exori San.
Paladins can kill Ungreez at lower levels with a blocker, using Enchanted Spear and exori san, be careful with great fireballs.

name: Urmahlullu the Immaculate
behaviour: Urmahlullu the Immaculate attacks in melee range.
strategy:
Just trap it and attack it. It will become the Wildness of Urmahlullu before it dies.
Part of the Kilmaresh Quest.

name: Urmahlullu the Tamed
behaviour: Urmahlullu the Tamed attacks in melee range.
strategy: Just trap it and attack it. It will become the Wisdom of Urmahlullu before it dies.

name: Urmahlullu the Weakened
strategy: Just trap it and kill it. Part of the Kilmaresh Quest.

name: Ushuriel
notes: Hall of the Colossi Ushuriel The Crystal Caves  An example how to trap Ushuriel Loving it to kill and slaughter, he serves the Ruthless Seven as an executioner. Gifted with immense powers, Ushuriel usually just ignores any attacks and then starts to torment his target. His executions are lengthy procedures as he enjoys the fear and death struggle of his victims. As he is mostly confronted with helpless victims, it might confuse him if an opponent is actually fighting back. Still, it is very unlikely that someone will face the chief executioner of the Ruthless Seven and lives to tell the tale. Though perfectly capable to handle almost any opponent, he likes to strip his victims of their powers and enjoys their weakness and fear. If you allow him to rob you of your powers, your small chance to survive this encounter is gone and you are as good as dead. It's one of the bosses of The Inquisition Quest.
abilities: Death Ball (Curses you up to 800 total) Ushuriel
Purple Note UE (makes you Drunk ) Ushuriel
location: In the Demon Forge following the Hall of the Colossi. He is the first Demon Forge boss of The Inquisition Quest.
behaviour: Ushuriel is fast and dangerous. Ushuriel will retreat at 1 to 1259 (0% - 4%, deep red) health.
strategy: Using invisible before entering Ushuriel Seal (Antica) Players who attempt to kill Ushuriel solo, should create energy fields with Energy Wall Rune on the ground and make him walk over them. Knights are advised to bring the strongest elemental melee weapon, for example Tagralt Blade, to hit him with Blood Rage and some exori attacks while running. Soloing Ushuriel will take some time though.

name: Utua Stone Sting
notes: It's part of the Grimvale Quest - An Ancient Feud.
behaviour: Chases enemy. Utua Stone Sting never retreats.
strategy:
Knights: Stay diagonal to avoid the Life Drain wave.
Other vocations: Kite it, it's slow.

name: Vashresamun
notes: She was sentenced to be locked away, after her part in the conspiracies against the pharaoh, Arkhotep. She is the only female pharaoh. One of the Pharaohs of The Ancient Tombs Quest.
abilities: Melee (0-200 and starting up to 3 hp/turn)
behaviour: Malicious, will make all efforts to destroy intruders.
strategy:
She will melee with any in close proximity, this allows distance attackers better chances to defeat her quick. She is guarded by 2 Banshees, 4 Magicthrowers and 2 Shredderthrowers.
She is the most harmless of the Pharaohs.

name: Vemiath
notes: One of the bosses in the Rotten Blood Quest.
strategy: Vemiath is the twin of Chagorz, and both share similarities. It fights together with two  Elder Bloodjaws, not considering modifiers from taints. During the fight, players have a counter next to their names, increasing by one per second to a maximum of 21. When under maximum stacks, characters will take 15% maximum health Agony Damage per second. Each time a player moves, they "drop" these charges on the ground, leaving  Darklight Spark as tracks and reducing the counter by one. Stepping or staying over the Darklight Sparks causes 3% maximum health per second as Agony Damage. After three seconds, the Darklight Sparks turn into their second stage,  Darklight Fields, which last for two seconds but also cause 3% maximum health agony damage immediately upon being stepped on. Therefore, players can take take up to 18% maximum health per second if not handling these carefully. The boss can summon multiple  Pillars of Dark Energy. These can chain players for Energy Damage. When taking damage from this chain spell, a different counter is applied to the characters hit by it. This counter is reduced at a rate of one per second and deals 1,200~ Energy Damage with every tick. The maximum counter value is 10. Players should be extra careful when having these because getting hit by Vemiath's beam spell will trigger all charges at once, dealing a high Energy Damage outburst. Every 90 seconds, a  Rotten Charge will appear at the center of the room, lasting for 15 seconds. Players must lure an Elder Bloodjaw into it. If no Elder Bloodjaw steps on it: If an Elder Bloodjaw steps on it:

name: Vengar
behaviour: Vengar attacks in melee range.

name: Versperoth
notes: Minion of Abyssador.
behaviour: Doesn't move.
strategy: Do not stand adjacent to it, it's pointless because it does not move and thus will not chase your shooters. To spawn it you must step on its dirt mount. When Versperoth spawns you have 20 seconds to deal as much damage as possible. After 20 seconds, Versperoth will disappear, and 10+ minions of Versperoth will spawn in the room. Versperoth will reappear 10 seconds later. This repeats until either your team or Versperoth dies. Excess minions will disappear after new ones spawn. When Versperoth is in the room, focus fire on it. When it disappears, focus on the minions most threatening to the team. Energy Walls can be used to protect shooters but they will cross if they retarget at the right time. Note that Versperoth does not heal itself.

name: Vilear
behaviour: Vilear attacks in melee range.

name: Vok the Freakish
notes: It's part of the Feaster of Souls Quest.
behaviour: Vok the Freakish never retreats.

name: Vulnerable Cocoon
notes: Vulnerable Cocoon on Harmonia
behaviour: Does not move.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Warlord Ruzad
notes: No notes
location: Orc Fortress, in the tower near Orc Powder Quest Room, here.
behaviour: Treat like a strong Orc Warlord, but it Summons Orc Berserkers.
strategy: Be careful when facing this creature. Don't let him Summon, or you can die easily. The strategy is almost the same than an Orc Warlord. Using Stealth Rings or Invisibility would prevent you from being damaged by the summoned Orc Berserkers, but not the Orc leaders.

name: Weakened Shlorg
notes: One of the raid bosses with special mechanics.
behaviour: Fights in close range.
strategy: To start with he is invincible so you must use Smoking Coal on the basins in the room to make him a Weakened Shlorg then he is finally killable, its advised to run and kill this monster because he has strong physical attacks.

name: White Pale
notes: One of the two bosses of Rotworms, the other being the Rotworm Queen.
location: Edron Rotworm Cave (here), Darashia Rotworm Caves (here), Vandura Rotworm Cave(here).
behaviour: Similar to a Rotworm, but stronger.
strategy: Just kill it.

name: Wildness of Urmahlullu
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Just trap it and attack it. It will become the Urmahlullu the Tamed before it dies.Part of the Kilmaresh Quest.

name: Willi Wasp
notes: A boss appearing in a random raid north of Carlin. Raid messages are:
abilities: Melee (0-? and starting up to? hp/turn)
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Wisdom of Urmahlullu
behaviour: It fights from distance, but this can be easily avoided if Urmahlullu the Tamed is trapped before being killed.
strategy: Just trap it and attack it. It will become the Urmahlullu the Weakened when it dies.

name: World Devourer
notes: The final boss from the Heart of Destruction Quest.
behaviour: This boss has the ability of the combination of the 3 mini-boss before him. The Hunger, The Rage, The Destruction. World Devourer never retreats.
strategy: 1st mechanic: When Greed appears, Walk the boss over the teleport so that it changes its color then walk the Greed on the teleport so it disappears. Shooters should focus on the summons and ads to clear the way for the knights handling the boss and the Greed. The longer it takes to get rid of the Greed, the more Greed will appear. 2nd mechanic: Whenever a Disruption appears, make sure to kill it as soon as possible so that it does not transform into Overcharged Disruption, which is significantly stronger. 3rd mechanic: Whenever a Frenzy appears, make sure to kill it then resume attacking the boss. Priority goes to killing Disruption over Frenzy to avoid them changing to their overcharged form.

name: Wrath of the Emperor
notes:
Introduced in Summer Update 2010.
Part of the Wrath of the Emperor Quest.
behaviour: Unknown.
strategy: Unknown.

name: Xenia
notes: screenshot
location: Venore Amazon Camp, here or the room below.
behaviour: Runs at very low health.
strategy: Knights, fight with good skills. Paladins, try to avoid the melee atacks. Mages, same as paladins.

name: Xogixath
notes: It's one of the bosses of Kilmaresh Quest.
behaviour: Xogixath attacks in melee range. Xogixath never retreats.
strategy: Do not use Fire Damage against this boss since 55% of it will be reflected back to you.

name: Yaga the Crone
notes: No notes
location: Four levels underground, on the way to Blood Herb Quest, here.
behaviour: She always tries to stay away from the attacker, so she can burn you with her powerful fire missiles and poison you at a distance.Attacks from a distance.
strategy: Try to push her in the corner and stand diagonally, so she won't run away and shoot more Fire Fields.

name: Yakchal
notes: The Ice Witches Boss, talked about in this book. Note that she did not disappear after 45 minutes after the awakening!
behaviour: Attacks from a distance. Yakchal will retreat at 1 to 229 (0.02% - 3.98%, deep red) health.
strategy:
If you are using a blocker, they should stay near the Sarcophagus when it gets summoned, and will need to use a lot of Great Health Potions. The shooters should be spread out through the room, and should use SD runes on Yakchal. Be careful when waking her, because you will also wake up a huge number of Ice Witches, Ice Golems, Crystal Spiders and Frost Dragons. (In four 'waves', approximately 6-8 Frost Dragons, 10~ Crystal Spiders, 15~ Ice Witches, 20-30 Ice Golems and the Yakchal will spawn in only the south of the room! More monsters, mainly Ice Golems and Crystal Spiders, will spawn in the west, north and east in the room.) Those creatures will not all come at the same time. One strategy is to use the south-east corner of the room as a retreat-point when a lot of monsters are summoned. First make sure to kill all the summons, then trap Yakchal with an Energy Bomb Rune, so she won't move. Then finish her off with SD:s. Another strategy is having 1 person awaken her, and then rush to the south doors. Use a Frozen Starlight on the sarcophagus to awaken her (The Frozen Starlight can break when it's used on the sarcophagus to awake the Yakchal, but usually it won't. You can awaken Yakchal many times, but the delay between awakenings is random.  To be compared with:  Make sure somebody blocks respawn on the other side, otherwise there could be a Demon, Plaguesmiths and Nightmares. If you're fast enough, you won't have to go to the other side of the door to be safe from the most of the creatures that will spawn with the awakening.
From those doors, you can then slowly lure all creatures one by one, and sooner or later Yakchal will come too. Unless your team has a lot of firepower, try to trap her in a corner somewhere, she will run away in very low health.
Shoot at her with Sudden Death runes and/or Assassin Stars.

name: Yirkas Blue Scales
notes: It's part of the Grimvale Quest - An Ancient Feud.
behaviour: Yirkas Blue Scales never retreats.
strategy:
Knights: Standing diagonally will not make you evade the Terra Wave, because it's very wide (the same size as Mutated Human's wave). This boss can also deal high combos, so Energy Protection is recommended.
Other Vocations: Stay away and attack from distance to avoid most of its abilities. There are two big pillars in the boss room, so you can use them to your advantage.

name: Zamulosh
notes: He's the minion of Bazir. Part of the Ferumbras' Ascension Quest.
abilities: Blue Sparkles Invisible Bomb (Turns everyone invisible 3secs~) Zamulosh
location: Grounds of Deceit, a Ferumbras' Ascension Quest area.
behaviour: Zamulosh will become Invisible very often. It is occasionally teleported to the center of the room. Zamulosh never retreats.
strategy: Since this boss will be found with multiple clones (5 weak and 1 equally strong), that best way to deal with it is to always attack using area damage (such as Avalanche Runes and Diamond Arrows) to hit them all. If the false Zamuloshs aren't attacked, the team will be teleported to the center of the room, forcing you to lose turns and reposition, so even if you figure out which one is the real Zamulosh, focusing on it is not recommended. It may be difficult to keep up with the real boss' HP during the fight, but if the team is using area attacks the real Zamulosh will eventually die (and the clones also disappear when this happens).

name: Zanakeph
notes: It's the boss of the Undead Dragons. Part of the Killing in the Name of... Quest.
location: Razachai, behind the teleport located here (access gained during Wrath of the Emperor Quest - Mission 08: Uninvited Guests).
behaviour: It behaves like a normal Undead Dragon, which means it will run in deep red hp.
strategy: This boss is one of the hardest of the quest, so be careful. Knights should stand diagonal and spam attack spells, whilst Paladins should kite him around the room. Mages should use energy-based spells such as Energy Wave, Great Energy Beam, Ultimate Energy Strike and kite him around the room until he's dead. Energy Walls can be utilized to keep him at bay.

name: Zarabustor
notes: He is the boss of Warlocks. Spawns with 2 Warlocks. Disappears one hour after respawning.
location: Demona, in the room Northeast of the pentagram room, here.
behaviour: Zarabustor behaves same as a normal Warlock.
strategy: Trap him in the corner and kill him like a Warlock.

name: Zarcorix of Yalahar
notes: Part of the Cults of Tibia Quest.
location: Feyrist, behind the teleport next to Gerimor.
behaviour: It fights in close combat.
strategy: This creature cannot be killed. It does not deal a lot of damage, but it must be kept far from the main fight because of its huge Damage Reflection ability.

name: Zavarash
notes: Seems to be weaker than other prison bosses.
behaviour: Unknown
strategy: Do not waste time on hitting his clone which is invulnerable to any kind of damage. Use an Energy Bomb Rune underneath you to avoid the Dark Torturers. Stay Diagonal to avoid beams and waves, and unless you are a Knight, stay out of his melee range as well. If you put any DOT (Damage over time)-effect on him (Inflict Wound from Knights, Soulfire or Ignite from Sorcerers, Envenom from Duids and Holy Flash from Paladins), he stops using his Invisibility.

name: Zevelon Duskbringer
notes: New creature in Summer Update 2008. It can be assumed that he is an Elven Vampire due to the fact he says "Ashari", shoots sniper arrows and dwells in Hellgate, which is extremely close to Ab'dendriel.
behaviour: Spawns with 0-3 vampires, Goes Invisible and runs away in low health.
strategy: Beware if you are low level, because this boss will be fatal for you. Higher level Mages should run, heal when he paralyzes you and shoot Flame Strike and GFBs when he goes invisible, so you hurt summoned vampires and boss at the same time and get him visible again.

name: Zomba
notes: Zomba is the Lions' boss and only spawns during the Darashian lion raid. The following message will appear when he spawns:
behaviour: Behaves like a strong Lion.
strategy: He's not very challenging but is always accompanied by some Lions.

name: Zorvorax
notes: This boss can only be fought when First Dragon Quest is active.
location: Edron Vampire Crypt last floor, here.
behaviour: Unknown A zorvorax will retreat at 1 to 399 (0.01% - 3.99%, deep red) health.
strategy:
Mages: Since it's very resistant to most elements but holy, mages will have a hard time killing it. Those above level 200 should use their Special Summons and Energy attacks. Since druids do not have Energy spells, Explosion Runes are the next best option, specially at lower levels.
Paladins: Use an Energy Wall Rune and run across it to avoid the boss damage.
Knights: Stand diagonal and attack boss. Dropping a Fire Bomb Rune helps keep the boss diagonally since it doesn't walk over fire.

name: Zugurosh
notes: He is a Ruthless Seven Servant, and you must defeat him in order to proceed through The Inquisition Quest. Despite his might, the demon known as Zugurosh is a coward, and he would be the first to admit that - if he were threatened enough. Zugurosh spent a good part of his past hiding from real and assumed enemies. Seeking for protection, he joined the ranks of The Ruthless Seven soon after they had established themselves as the mightiest of all surviving cabals. Though he is quick on the uptake, his cowardice prevented him from gaining any significant power until his paranoia helped him to discover a treachery in the ranks of The Ruthless Seven Minions. This granted him the attention of his dark masters and a rather high position in their ranks that only resulted in intensifying his fears. Zugurosh prefers to be a living coward than a dead hero. Ironically his cowardice and paranoia made him a valuable tool for The Ruthless Seven who entrusted him with several safety measures for their numerous operations. Assuming enemies and betrayal everywhere, Zugurosh is responsible for some of the most important and essential safety measures of The Ruthless Seven. He has a rather unique network of bribed and threatened informants. Though treachery and backstabbing is quite common among demons, this kind of controlled betrayal on a grand scale is a rather unusual concept for their race, and so far it works quite well. Zugurosh hates every fair fight, and he ensures that things are in his favour before he makes his move. He enjoys to prey upon helpless victims and loves nothing more than cheap victories using deceit, traps and ambushes. Since demons do not mind much about such tactics, Zugurosh is quite respected by his kind. It's one of the bosses of The Inquisition Quest.
behaviour: Zugurosh runs on very low health. Zugurosh will retreat at 4500  (4.97%, red) health.
strategy: It would be very wise to trap this boss as he retargets very frequently to the nearest creature. The best way would to use Wild Growth by a Druid so you can still shoot the boss and heal the blocker, and they stay longer than Magic Walls. If possible, try to ensure the main blocker is not hit by the towers since they reduce from 85% to 100% of their Shielding. This can be done by putting shooters or Summoned Creatures close to the pillars since they target the nearest player. Summoning Fire Devils or Fire Elementals to help deal damage with a few mages would be wise if he is trapped, as he has an immense amount of health. The more firepower the better to take down this "healthy" demon.

name: Zulazza the Corruptor
notes: It spawns during the Orc Raid on Zzaion on the top floor of the furthest tower to the south, the highest tower in Zzaion. It appears when the final raid message is shown, which is often an unpleasant surprise for players. Before it spawns, five messages are broadcast in white text to all players on that game world:
location: Zzaion (Zao) most southern tower, top floor.
behaviour: It retargets a lot. It will always try to get close to you. It uses strong magic spells and deals an incredible amount of melee damage. It runs away on black health (1400~).Zulazza the Corruptor attacks in melee range.
strategy:
Try to kill it with a big group of high levels. Be extremely careful since the melee hits are extremely high. It can easily one-hit a level 170 paladin (without magic shield). Keep a constant eye on your health and mana (it also drains your mana). Adviced is to heal every turn. Even if you have a lot of health, this monster can deal a great amount of damage. That combined with his poison bomb can kill you without even noticing it. It poisons you from 20 - 30hp per turn.
When you are about to get low on health, just go down the stairs and quickly regenerate. Watch out for any Draken Warmaster and Draken Spellweaver respawns.
If you are with not so many players, try to let one knight run through the chamber while others shoot because this boss is not fast at all, however, if it retargets, it could be disastrous.

name: Zushuka
notes: This boss uses the revised reward system. Your rewards will vary depending on your participation in the fight. The Frost Spiders and Frost Servants will not grant you participation points, nor will destroying the pillars or taking damage from the invincible Zushuka; only the killable Zushuka will yield rewards.
abilities: strong Self Healing once when on red hp (7485-7515)
behaviour: Fights in close combat. Fully heals herself the first time she is low in health.
strategy: This boss fight can be very hard, it is not recommended below level 150. The battle of Zushuka has two stages. Throughout the entire battle, Frost Spiders will spawn along the horizontal line in the center of the temple and up to 4? Frost Servants will spawn by the altar. These will stop spawning when Zushuka is dead, but the spawned monsters will not disappear when Zushuka is killed. In the first stage, Zushuka is invincible and her clothing is of a lighter color. To progress to stage 2, the glowing ice cubes on the west and east side of the heart of the temple must be destroyed. To destroy the cubes, take a Thawing Ice Pick from the altar (center) and quickly run to the west or east side to use the pickaxe on the cubes. You must do this on 3 cubes on each side. Note that the thawing ice picks will vanish (and respawn) after 5 seconds, and the decaying starts immediately when it spawns. It is recommended to first move a thawing ice pick, wait for it to disappear and pick up the new one from the same spot on the altar, thus giving you maximum time to use it. You may also add it to a hotkey or action button. Keep in mind that while you run from the altar to the glowing ice cubes, there will be a massive amount of Frost Spiders which aim to slow you down and block your path. If you cannot manage, you can use Energy Bomb Runes or Energy Walls to create a clear path from the altar to the cubes. Alternatively, a knight can block the majority of the spiders while another player runs the thawing ice picks. Also keep in mind that Zushuka can deal a massive amount of damage herself. Since you can't do anything with her right now, it is recommended to lure her away from the center while you progress. In the second stage, the invincible Zushuka will disappear and a new one, in a darker blue outfit, will spawn by the altar. Zushuka can now be killed. Hold off the minions and kill the boss. When Zushuka reaches low health, she will recover about half its health points (~7500 hp), but only once. This may be a long battle so it is recommended to bring plenty of supplies.
